loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ms. Ana María came for the first time to the credit institution on February 15th 2008. She sells coffee, as well as grocery store products. She lives at her parents’ house in the Callampaya region, and runs her business there. She is single and supports three children of 8, 5 and 3 years of age on her own. She doesn’t have any active loans from other credit institutions. In spite of the meager income, this activity provides for all her expenses. The loan will be used to buy wholesale products such as sugar, rice and noodles.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ana María llegó por primera vez a la institución el 15 de febrero de 2008. Su actividad principal es la venta de café, aunque también se dedica a la venta de abarrotes. La señora vive en casa de sus padres en la zona Callampaya, y su actividad la realiza en el mismo domicilio. Doña Ana María no tiene esposo y sola saca adelante a tres niños de 8,5 y 3 años de edad. Actualmente la señora no tiene créditos con otras instituciones financieras. A pesar de que los ingresos no son muchos, con esta actividad es con lo que solventa todos sus gastos. El crédito le sirve para abastecerse al por mayor de productos como azúcar, arroz, fideos, para luego comercializarlos.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of sugar, rice and other products.

loans.name: Bechijtic 2 Group

texts.es:
Alicia is part of the Solidarity Bechijtic 2 Group from the community of Chamula, Chiapas. She is 21 years old and single. Together with her parents and her five brothers and sisters, she grows vegetables: chard, spinich, radishes, lettuce, turnips and cabbage, which they sell to wholesalers who then sell them in the nearby local communities. In this way, her family works to obtain the resources to survive. With a loan she will invest in purchasing seeds and fertilizers so they can have a good harvest. Her other colleagues: Manuela, Veronica and Guadalupe, work at the same activity, and Josefina has a small grocery installed in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

ALICIA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO SOLIDARIO BECHIJTIC 2 DE LA COMUNIDAD DE CHAMULA, CHIAPAS. ELLA TIENE 21 AÑOS, ES SOLTERA. JUNTO CON SUS PADRES Y SUS CINCO HERMANOS SE DEDICA AL CULTIVO DE VERDURAS: ACELGA, ESPINACAS, RABANOS, LECHUGA, NAVOS, REPOLLO Y LOS VENDE CON MAYORISTAS QUE LOS COMERCIALIZAN A LAS LOCALIDADES MAS CERCANAS. DE ESTA FORMA SU FAMILIA TRABAJA Y OBTIENE RECURSOS PARA SOBREVIVIR, CON SU PRESTAMO INVERTIRA COMPRANDO SEMILLAS Y FERTILIZANTES PARA OBTENER UNA BUENA COSECHA SUS DEMAS COMPAÑERAS MANUELA, VERONICA Y GUADALUPE DESEMPEÑAN LA MISMA ACTIVIDAD A ESEPCION DE JOSEFINA QUE TIENE INSTALADO UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and seeds.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Alternativa Solidaria Chiapas (AlSol) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
"I have an unfinished construction since I had to use the money I had saved to make that room. I am only missing the concrete roof to be able to inhabit it, even if I have to do the finishing and painting afterwards. That will be done little by little since it will require a greater investment." I am requesting a loan for $600 USD to build the concrete roof of a room in my home.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


“Tengo una construcción sin terminar debido a que tuve que disponer del dinero que tenia guardado para hacer el cuarto, solo me falta la losa de concreto y así podremos habitarlo, aunque después enjarre las paredes y lo pinte, eso será poco a poco ya que requiero de una inversión más grande”. Solicito $ 600.00 dlls para poner la losa de concreto en un cuarto de mi vivienda.

loans.use: Building a concrete roof / Construcción de losa de concreto.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Bendecidas 1 Group

texts.es:
Dominga is an artisan and she makes bracelets, belts, shawls, and small animals and figures by hand with silk and wool threads. She sells within and outside of the state of Chiapas, where tourism is strong. She also sells to wholesalers. In this way she helps her husband with the family expenses. She is 48 years old and has 9 children. With this loan she will invest in the wholesale purchase of threads. She is part of the Bendecidas 1 Group, along with Lilia, Elena and Estela, who are also artisans.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

DOMINGA ES ARTESANA HACE PULCERAS, CINTURONES, CHALES, ANIMALITOS Y PERSONAJES DE FORMA ARTESANAL CON HILO DE SEDA, Y LANA. ELLA LOS VENDE DENTRO Y FUERA DEL ESTADO CHIAPAS EN DONDE PREDOMINA EL TURISMO, TAMBIEN VENDE POR ENTREGO A MAYORISTAS. DE ESTA FORMA ELLA APOYA A SU ESPOSO CON LOS GASTOS FAMILIARES. TIENE 48 AÑOS Y TUVO 9 HIJOS. CON SU PRESTAMO INVERTIRA EN LA COMPRA DE HILOS AL POR MAYOR. FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO LLAMADO BENDECIDAS 1 JUNTO CON LILIA, ELENA Y ESTELA QUE TAMBIEN SON ARTESANAS.

loans.use: Purchase thread.

loans.name: Bendecidas 2 Group

texts.es:
María Guadalupe is 26 years old, married and has 3 children. When she was very young she learned crafts from her mother, who worked in this profession. She makes bracelets, belts, animal figures and personalities from the EZLN guerrilla group. When she has a certain amount done, she gives them to her mother, who sells them within and outside of the state of Chiapas. She belongs to the Bendecidas 2 Group along with Isabel, Juana and Lucia, who are also artisans. They are originally from the community of Chamula, but many years ago emigrated to the city of San Cristobal, where they now live.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

MARIA GUADALUPE TIENE 26 AÑOS, CASADA, TRES HIJOS. ELLA DESDE MUY PEQUEÑA APRENDIO LA ACTIVIDAD ARTESANAL YA QUE SU MAMA SE HA DEDICADO A ESTA PROFESION. ELLA HACE PULCERAS, CINTURONES, CABALLITOS Y PERSONAJES DEL GRUPO GUERRILLERO EZLN. CUANDO ELLA TIENE UN CIERTA CANTIDAD SE LO DA A SU MAMA QUIEN LO VENDE DENTRO Y FUERA DEL ESTADO DE CHIAPAS. PERTENECE AL GRUPO LLAMADO BENDECIDAS 2 JUNTO CON ISABEL, JUANA Y LUCIA QUE TAMBIEN SON ARTESANAS. ELLAS SON ORIGINARIAS DE LA COMUNIDAD DE CHAMULA PERO DESDE HACE MUCHOS AÑOS EMIGRARON A LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL DONDE ACTUALMENTE VIVEN.

loans.use: Purchase threads.

loans.name: Duo Fatima Group

texts.es:
Mrs. Elvira is married and is 55 years old. She has two children who attend middle school at a public school. Her husband helps with the household expenses. He is a bricklayer, plumber, and electrician, even though he does not have a stable job; he constantly travels to the Yungas.

They own a house, three rooms and a small living room, dining room, bathroom, and kitchen, with basic services of electricity, drinking water, and sewerage. Their home is located in an urban neighborhood called Santa Rosa GranD. in the zone of Villa Fatima. They have a small capital, and this is why she requires a loan to increase her working capital.

Mrs. Vicky is 49 years of age, separated, and lives alone with her son who attends college and who sometimes helps her with the housework at the boarding house. Her only income is that which is generated by this business, which is located in the main avenue of an affluent commercial zone. Her home is located in the boarding house, and with this activity she supports her son through his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Elvira es casada tiene 55 años D. edad, con dos hijos que están en secundaria en colegio estatal. El esposo le ayuda con los gastos D. la casa es albañil, plomero y electricista, aunque no cuenta con estabilidad laboral; viaja constantemente a los Yungas.

Cuenta con vivienda propia, tres habitaciones, una pequeña salita, comedor baño y cocina, y los servicios básicos D. luz, agua potable y alcantarillado. Su vivienda se encuentra ubicada en un barrio urbano llamado Santa Rosa GranD. en la zona D. Villa Fátima, tiene un pequeño capital y es por eso que requiere crédito para incremento D. su capital D. trabajo.

La sra. Vicky, tiene 49 años D. edad, es separada, vive sola con su hijo universitario que algunas veces le ayuda con los quehaceres D. la pensión, el único ingreso que tiene es el que le genera ese negocio el cual está ubicado en la avenida principal D. una zona comercial D. gran afluencia, se encuentra en su mismo domicilio, y con esta actividad costea los estudios D. su hijo.

loans.use: Buying rice, pasta, potato, oil in large quantities (COMPRA DE ARROZ, FIDEO, PAPA, ACEITE POR CANTIDAD)

loans.name: Angelo 3 Group

texts.es:
Yolanda sells lingerie, perfumes and cosmetics. She sells them to her friends and neighbors who live nearby. When she has a new product to offer, she goes door to door. With her loan she would like to increase her purchases of different products to offer to her clients, and in this way, contribute to the family income. She is 28 years old, has two children, and belongs to the solidarity group called Angelo 3 along with Roxana, Janey (sale of perfumes and cosmetics), Jesus Irma (catalog sale of shoes) and Liliana Dolores, who will set up a cafeteria one of the universities.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

. YOLANDA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE LENCERIA, PERFUMES Y COSMETICOS, LOS VENDE CON AMIGAS Y VECINAS CERCA DE SU LOCALIDAD. CUANDO TIENE UN PRODUCTO NUEVO VA OFRECIENDO DE CASA EN CASA. CON SU PRESTAMO PRETENDE AUMENTAR LA COMPRA DE MAS PRODUCTOS PARA OFRECER A SUS CLIENTAS, Y DE ESTA FORMA CONTRIBUIR AL GASTO FAMILIAR, ELLA TIENE 28 AÑOS, DOS HIJOS Y PERTENECE AL GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO ANGELO 3 JUNTO CON: ROXANA JANEY (VENTA DE PERFUMES Y COSMETICOS), JESUS IRMA (VENTA DE ZAPATOS POR CATALOGO) Y LILIANA DOLORES INSTALARA UNA CAFETERIA EN UNA ESCUELA UNIVERSITARIA.

loans.use: Purchase perfumes and cosmetics.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Alternativa Solidaria Chiapas (AlSol) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
"I have been in the business of making stainless steel boxes for a year and a half. I am now being requested materials to make equipment for industrial automatization (electric materials or pneumatic, which are used in the manufacturing of cables and harnesses) but I am laking the capital necessary to purchase the materials since it's an investment I was not contemplating. Several clients owe me money and that is why my money is on hold." I am requesting a loan for  $1,200 to purchase materials for the manufacturing of industrial automatization equipment.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.




“Mi negocio es la fabricación de cajas de acero inoxidable desde hace 1 año y medio, ahora me están pidiendo material para fabricar un equipo de Automatización Industrial (Material Eléctrico o Neumático, sirve para la fabricación de cables o arneses )   pero me falta el capital para la compra del material ya que es una inversión que no tenia contemplada tengo varios clientes que me deben y es por eso que tengo el dinero detenido” Solicito $ 1 200.00 dlls para comprar material para la elaboración de un equipo de automatización industrial

loans.use: Purchasing electrical materials to make industrial automatization equipment / Compra de material electrico para (Automatización Industrial)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Mrs. Juana has had this stand for approximately 12 years. The stand is located in the property of the Military School of Engineering E.M.I in the area of Alto Irpavi. Her husband works as a janitor in the same area.

Mrs. Juana has been a customer of Emprender for 5 years, demonstrating punctuality in her payments because her business is solvent because of the characteristics of the Military School. She has 5 children, two of whom work independently. Together with her husband Isidro Muni, who receives a salary, they collaborate to support their children and fulfill their loan obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Juana ya lleva en el puesto aproximadamente 12 años de antigüedad, este se encuentra ubicado en los predios de la Escuela Militar de Ingenieria E.M.I. de la zona de Alto Irpavi, en la misma su esposo trabaja como portero.

La Sra Juana es cliente de Emprender de hace 5 años atrás, demostrando puntualidad en sus pagos, ya que el negocio que tiene es solvente por las características de esa Institución de estudio, ella tiene 5 hijos de los cuales los dos mayores trabajan ya independientemente, y juntamente con el esposo Isidro Muni quien recibe un sueldo se colaboran para llevar adelante a sus hijos menores y cumplir con sus obligaciones crediticias.

loans.use: Stock her stand with all kinds of sweets (Surtir el puesto de venta con todo tipo de golosinas)

loans.name: Hermogenes

texts.es:
Mr. Hermogenes L. is 49 years old, one of the oldest residents in his area and well-known by everyone thanks to his butcher shop. His business is productive enough, as he brings meat in pieces, generating a good profit margin. His family is composed of three members: himself, his wife and his youngest daughter. His older daughters are independent and work. His wife collaborates with the business. Regarding his credit history, Mr. Hermogenes is one of the institution’s oldest clients and always makes his payments timely.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Hermogenes L. tiene 49 años de edad, es uno de los vecinos más antiguos de la zona y gracias a su carnicería muchas personas lo conocen. El negocio es bastante solvente pues trae carne por piezas, lo que le da un margen de ganancias bueno. Su familia está compuesta por 3 miembros: él, su esposa y una de sus hijas que es menor. Tiene hijas mayores, pero que ya son independientes y trabajan. Su esposa colabora en el negocio. Respecto a su historial crediticio, Don Hermogenes es uno de los clientes más antiguos con los que cuenta la institución y muy puntual en sus pagos.

loans.use: Purchase of meat whole pieces.

loans.name: Maria Hilda

texts.es:
María Hilda R. started her business in Mexico City 30 years ago, which she and her sister ran from their home. When she got married she went to Zacatecas and started the same business, also from her house, until she was able to rent out a commercial space and expand her services to include not only cuts and coloring but also makeup, nails, etc. The main reason for having the business is to help her husband with education expenses for their 5 children, because as they began growing up and advancing in school these expenses increased and her husband´s income was insufficient.

She needs a loan of US $325, which she will repay in 6 months. With this money she will buy equipment to speed up the process of applying nails. Hilda and her family thank you for your support!

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

María Hilda R. comenzó su negocio en la ciudad de México, DF hace 30 años, en su casa en conjunto con su hermana. Cuando se caso se fue a Zacatecas, y empezó también en la sala de su casa, hasta que pudo rentar un local para ampliar los servicios no nada mas de cortes y tintes, sino maquillajes, uñas, etc. La razón principal de este negocio es apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de educación de sus 5 hijos ya que cuando empezaron a crecer, y al ir avanzando en la escuela estos se incrementaron por lo cual el ingreso económico de su esposo empezó a ser insuficiente.

Ella necesita un crédito de US $325 que esta dispuesta a pagar en 6 meses con este dinero comprara una maquina para acelerar el proceso de aplicación de uñas. Hilda y su familia te agradecerán el apoyo que les brindes!!

loans.use: Purchase of equipment

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Mrs. Maura is 43 years old and has lived in the city of La Paz for more than 20 years. She is one of the earliest customers of the institution, because she worked 32 sequences with the solidarity group yanapacunas with an impecable credit history. She is currently requesting her second individual loan.

Her family is comprised by 7 people, including the parents. Their eldest son is independent; their second daughter, even though an adult, still depends on her parents because she suffers from epilepsy; their three youngest children are still students. Her husband is a public servant, working in the municipal government of La Paz for which he receives a monthly salary which he invests in supporting his family.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

La señora tiene 43 años de edad con residencia de mas de 20 años en la ciudad de La Paz, es una de las clientes mas antiguas de la institución, ya que trabajó 32 secuencias con el grupo solidario yanapacunas con un historial crediticio impecable, actualmente solicita su segundo crédito individual.

su familia esta compuesta por 7 miembros incluido los padres de los cuales el hijo mayor ya es independiente, su segunda hija aunque ya es mayor de edad aún depende de sus padres debido a que padece de Epilepsia, y sus tres hijos menores aun son estudiantes. El esposo es Servidor pùblico, trabaja en el gobierno Municipal de La Paz por lo cual percibe un salario mensual que invierte en la manutención de su familia.

loans.use: Buying raw materials for production (COMPRA DE INSUMOS PARA SU PRODUCCION)

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene Chávez D. started in the food business in 1997, working for one of her relative´s business after she divorced, due to the family income decreasing and her having to look for a way to cover household expenses and those of her 3 children. In 2000 she decided to put up her own "gorditas" stand (a small thick tortilla made from corn flour, split open and usually filled with chicken or meat, accompanied by salsa). Her daughters help her out in their free time by making the fillings and attending to the customers.

She now requires a loan of US $575, which will be repaid in 6 months, to remodel her commercial premises, as over time her clientele has increased and she would like to have a place that is bigger and with a better appearance, from the overall image to the furnishings.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Irene Chávez D. empezó su negocio de comida en 1997, trabajando como empleada familiar en un negocio similar cuando se divorcio, debido a que los ingresos familiares disminuyeron, y tuvo que buscar la forma de solventar los gastos de su casa así como de sus 3 hijos. En el 2000, es cuando decide poner su propio puesto de gorditas y con el apoyo de sus hijas quienes en tiempo libre le ayudan con los guisos y a atender a los clientes.

Ahora requiere de un crédito de US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para la remodelación e su local ya que con el tiempo sus clientela se ha incrementado y ella desea tener un local mas grande y mejor presentado desde la imagen hasta el mobiliario.

loans.use: Purchase furnishings and expand commercial premises.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda, 23 years old, is a young mother who raises and sells chickens. She also sells cakes that she makes with great care in her humble small kitchen. Her husband works with her and together they wish to increase the quantity of chickens in their barn with the goal of increasing their income to then become the best breeders of their beautiful city.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Nilda, de 23 años de edad, es una joven madre que se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos, adicionalmente también oferta queques que prepara con mucho cuidado en el horno de su humilde cocinita.Su esposo colabora con su actividad y juntos desean incrementar la cantidad de pollos de su galpón a fin de incrementar sus ingresos y convertirse en los mejores criadores de su bella ciudad.

loans.use: Raise a greater quantity of chickens

loans.name: Alex

texts.es:
Alex Enrique is 49 years old and has been renting 10 rooms in his home for two years. This activity has brought him notable results and has raised his family’s quality of life. Nevertheless, like all homes, with the passage of time the house needs certain repairs and even more so when the rooms are rented out. For this reason she is asking for a loan to remodel, paint and provide greater comfortable surroundings to his renters.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Alex Enrique, de 49 años de edad, se dedica desde hace dos años a alquilar diez habitaciones en su domicilio, esta actividad le ha traído notables resultados y ha elevado el nivel de vida de su querida familia, sin embargo como todo domicilio con el paso de los años necesita de ciertos arreglos y más aún cuando estos van a ser otorgados en alquiler. Por esa razón su petición de un préstamo atiende a la necesidad de refaccionar, pintar y brindar mayores comodidades a su inquilinos.

loans.use: Remodel rental space to provide greater comfort for tenants

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa Mercedes has sold wood for quite some time thanks to the advice and initiative of her dear husband. In little time she became the premiere seller of these products, and her client’s orders have increased with every order. Seeing these needs she has decided to open a store in her small home, nevertheless she has plans to move it to a place more conducive to this type of activity, and therefore she is asking for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa Mercedes, se dedica a la comercialización de madera desde hace mucho tiempo gracias a los consejos e iniciativa de su querido esposo. En poco tiempo se ha convertido en la vendedora por excelencia de este producto y cada vez la exigencia de sus clientes es más alta, ante esta necesidad ha decidido improvisar en su pequeña casa una almacén, sin embargo tiene planes de mudarlo a un lugar propicio para esta actividad y a esa razón precisamente atiende la solicitud de su préstamo.

loans.use: Open a store.

loans.name: Keyla

texts.es:
Mrs. Keyla Isabel is 30 years old and mother to an 11 year old son named Jonathan. With much effort she has purchased a mototaxi which provides daily sustenance to her family. It is driven by her husband and managed by Keyla. Her wish is to soon build a school services with these vehicles which means she must ask for a loan to acquire another mototaxi to increase her income and make her goal reality.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Keyla Isabel, de 30 años de edad es madre de un hijo de 11 años, de nombre Jonathan, con mucho esfuerzo a comprado un mototaxi, herramienta de sustento diario para su familia que es conducida por su esposo y administrada por ella.Su deseo de construir pronto una empresa de servicios escolares con estos vehículos la conducen a solicitar un préstamo para adquirir un mototaxi más a fin de elevar sus ingresos y hacer más factible su anhelo.

loans.use: Purchase a mototaxi.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
“I have tried to make improvements to my home but in reality the economic situation is very difficult. I would like to put in a concrete floor on the patio of my home so that there isn’t as much dirt and also I need to construct a security wall. The houses are very close together and are separated only by a wall so it is very easy that someone enters the home to rob it.” I am asking for $650 to put a concrete floor on the patio of my home and construct a security wall.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

“He tratado de hacerle mejoras a mi vivienda pero en realidad la situación económica esta muy difícil, me gustaría poner piso de concreto en el patio de mi vivienda para evitar que haya tanta tierra y también necesito construir una barda, las casas están muy pegadas ya que solo nos separa una pared y es más fácil que alguien se meta a robar”. Solicito $ 650.00 dlls para poner piso de concreto en el patio de mi casa y levantar una barda.

loans.use: Put in a floor and construct a security wall

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita D. L. C. began selling home products in 2000, when a friend lent her catalogues and Margarita began to help her, sharing the profits. So Margarita decided to become an independent seller – she needed income in her home and not being able to support her children when her husband was without a job was the motive for selling by catalogue.

By the nature of this business she now needs to buy a new line as the seasons are changing and therefore she needs a loan of US $250 that will be repaid in 6 months. We support Margarita so that she and her family have a better quality of life!

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Margarita D. L. C. inicio en L. venta D. productos para el hogar en el 2000, cuando una comadre le presto sus catálogos y elL. empezó a ayudarle dividiendo las ganancias por lo cual decidió dedicarse individualmente a esto; L. falta D. ingresos económicos en su casa y el no tener el sustento básico para sus hijos una vez que su esposo se quedo sin trabajo, fue lo que L. motivo a vender por catalogo.

Por L. naturaleza D. este negocio ahora elL. necesita compra una nueva línea por cambio D. temporada y para ello necesita D. US $250 que liquidara en un plazo D. 6 meses. Apoyemos a margarita para que elL. y su familia tengan una mejor calidad D. vida!.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Agustin Edgardo

texts.es:
“A few months ago I purchased my home, where I live with my father, my sister and her son. We all work and we do what is possible to do to live comfortably. We would like to put security bars on the windows and doors and construct a perimeter wall to provide security to our home.” I am asking for a loan of $500 to construct a wall and add security bars to my home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

“Hace algunos meses que me entregaron mi vivienda, ahí vivo con mi papa, mi hermana y su hijo todos trabajamos y hacemos lo posible por vivir cómodamente nos gustaría poner protecciones y levantar una barda para dar más seguridad a nuestro hogar” Solicito $ 500.00 dlls para construir una barda y poner protecciones en mi vivienda

loans.use: Put security bars and a security wall on my home

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Ms. Felipa is a simple woman, a single mother with four daughters, abandoned by her husband. Her daughters help her with the gathering of fabric remnants, which she uses for the manufacture of mattresses to make a living for the family. She lives in a remote area of the extremely cold city of El Alto, where the family occupies a single room. She has a good credit history to date and makes her payments timely.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Felipa es una persona muy sencilla; es madre soltera con 4 hijas, ya que su esposo se fue D. la casa. Sus hijas le ayudan en la recolección D. telas en retazo, que usa para la elaboración D. colchones. Estos ingresos le permiten subsistir. Ella vive en una zona muy alejada D. la ciudad D. El Alto, en donD. el clima es muy frío; ocupa una habitación con toda su familia. Tiene un historial crediticio muy bueno a la fecha, y no presenta problemas D. pago.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric remnants.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.es:
Good low middle class client. Her husband is in Argentina working as a sewer. In her spare time she sells fresh fish, in order to make a living and support her three children. She makes her payments timely.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Buena Cliente de clase media baja. Su esposo está en la Argentina trabajando de costurero. En sus ratos libre se dedica a otra actividad (venta de pescado fresco), para la manutención de sus tres hijos. Es muy puntual en sus pagos.

loans.use: Purchase of paraffin wax for the manufacture of candles.

loans.name: Carlos José

texts.es:
Carlos is 48 years old. Due to a difficult financial situation, his family separated until conditions would improve. His wife does not live with them. Instead, he lives with his three daughters who are 5, 12, and 14 years old, in the region of Sabana Grande. He has 7 years of experience in the beef and pork business, which he learned from his mother who had a company and devoted most of her time to business. In the afternoons, he works as a cab driver to bring in more income to sustain his 3 daughters, who depend on him. His wife, lacked a job and felt it was necessary to leave the country to find work. She is working in Spanish and sends home money to support the family. Due to this way of life, this father works hard every day to support his daughters with the best quality of life he can afford. Their butcher shop supplies large amounts of meat to the population that reside in their region. He buys meat daily and sells them fresh to his customers. Due to high demand, this man seeks a loan to invest in more fresh meat and buy in greater quantities so he can have enough to sell during the mornings.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Don Carlos tiene 48 años de edad, por la difícil situación económica su familia sufre una separación hasta que la situación mejore ya que la esposa no vive con ellos, este señor habita con sus tres hijas de 5, 12 y 14 años en la comarca de Sabana Grande, el señor Carlos, lleva 7 años de dedicarse a comercializar carne de res y cerdo, esta actividad lo realiza en compañía de su madre quien le dedica el mayor tiempo al negocio y le apoya en esta actividad, por la tarde el señor trabaja de taxista, esto con el objetivo de buscar mayores ingresos con lo pueda subsanar todos los gastos de sus 3 hijas, quienes están a su cargo, ya que la esposa ante la falta de empleo se vio en la necesidad de irse a trabajar fuera del país, trabajando de domestica en España y envía remesas para apoyar en los gastos familiares. Es así como este padre diariamente trabaja con el fin de brindarles a sus hijas una mejor calidad de vida. La carnicería abastece en gran medida a la mayoría de los pobladores de la comarca en donde reside, la carne la compra a diario, ya que ofrecen a sus clientes un producto fresco, debido a la demanda de este producto el señor solicita un préstamo para invertir en carne fresca, comprar mas cantidad de carne para cubrir su demanda y así poder ofrecer a sus clientes carne toda la mañana.

loans.use: to buy more beef and pork

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase 2 hundredweights of rice, 2 hundredweights of sugar, one hundredweight of beans, 2 drums of oil, 2 boxes of soap bars, 2 cases of bathroom tissue paper, 3 cases of ramen noodles, one box of eggs, and one case of milk.

payments.comment: La cuota real de pago es de $ 30.66 dólares.

loans.name: Lourdes Teresa's Group

texts.en:
Lourdes Teresa is a woman with a sharp sense of humor and charisma, and she is the leader of a group of five businesswomen in San Cristobal. She sells men’s and women’s clothing. Lourdes explains that she pays close attention to customer demand and the season when she makes the purchases of goods to add to her inventory. She says that her business is successful and profitable. She plans to use her loan to purchase more clothing in bulk in order to increase her sales volume and her income.

The loan funds will be distributed among the five entrepreneurs, and each one will invest her loan in her own business.

The other members of the group are:

Lucia D. L. S. Martinez, who sells clothing in bulk.

Daysi Victoria P. M., an active woman that sells a collection of beauty products.

Miguelina C., who runs a small grocery store.

Amantina D. L. S. Martinez

NOTE: Members of the group warrant one another’s loans. If one of the members fails in repaying the loan, the other members will have to take the responsibility.

loans.use: Purchase clothing in bulk to boost a small business.  The others entrepreneurs will invest their funds in their own business.

loans.name: Eridania's Group

texts.en:
Eridania is 35 years old and a single mother raising two school-going children. She’s very active and is the leader of a group of five entrepreneurs in San Cristobal.

Eridania has been operating a beauty parlor in the community for ten years, and now she has a lot of customers that visit her salon for her various services. She offers women’s haircuts, partial- and full-highlight hair-dying, washing and blow-drying and the like. Eridania explains that the salon is her main source of income of her family and she has to get more and more customers in order to increase her revenues.

Along with four other entrepreneurs, Eridania is requesting a loan to invest in her business. The loan funds will be distributed among the group, and each entrepreneur will invest her funds in her own business.

The other members of the group are:

Maria Nelis R., who runs a small cafeteria.

Basilia D. J. P., who sells an assortment of sweets and candies

Tomasa P. D. M., an active woman that sells fruits and vegetables.

Bélgica C., who also runs a small cafeteria.

NOTE: Members of the group warrant one another’s loans. If one member fails in repaying the loan, the other members will have to take the responsibility.

loans.use: To purchase stock goods such as beauty products, goods for a small cafeteria.

loans.name: Yissel's Group

texts.en:
Yissel is the coordinator of a group of five dynamic and hard-working entrepreneurs of San Cristobal.

Yissel is a single mother who has to work a lot to feed her son and support her university studies. Yissel owns and runs a beauty salon, specializing in nail-care. She offers services such as nail polish, designer nails, artificial nail removal, pedicures, and so forth. Yissel hopes that her business’s growth will help her increase her revenues and hire two or three girls to help her attend to her customers. Yissel is requesting a loan together with the other members of the group. Each entrepreneur will use her loan for her own business.

The other members are:

Altagracia Ydira B. P., Normaliza J. A. and Juana F. D. L. C. will purchase clothing in bulk in order to boost their businesses.

Miguelina A. will buy an assortment of products for a small grocery store.

NOTE: Members of the group warrant one another’s loans. If one of the members fails in repaying the loan, the other members will have to take the responsibility.

loans.use: Purchase of products for a small beauty parlor.  The other entrepreneurs will buy products related to their respective business.

loans.name: Anna Rosanny's Group

texts.en:
Anna Rosanny is the coordinator of a group of five women, all of whom carry on businesses in San Cristobal.

Anna Rosanny is 32 years old and is a well-educated woman. She attends to an English course because “Speaking a global language opens the gate to prosperity”, she says. Anna Rosanny owns and operates clothing store which she started seven years ago. Her store offers a collection of fashionable clothing to women, men and children of the community. Anna hopes that her business can grow enough so she can start a branch office in another area of San Cristobal. Together with other four entrepreneurs, Anna is requesting a loan to boost her business. The loan funds will be distributed among the group, and each entrepreneur will invest in her own business.

The other members of the group are:

Denny Margarita F. N., a young entrepreneur which sells an assortment of pants in the same community.

Adriana N., an experienced businesswoman that has been selling fresh meat for ten years.

Lucía Esperanza R. A., a young and budding entrepreneur. She sells silver jewelry and is finishing a small location to run her business.

Gaudy Nereyda C. A. also sells silver jewelry.

NOTE: Members of the group warrant one another’s loans. If one member fails in repaying the loan, the other members will have to take the responsibility.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing in bulk, silver jewelry and other goods for several businesses.

loans.name: Abdul Jalil

texts.en:
Abdul Jalil lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with 2 sons and he lives with his own family. He has a metal shop and he has been involved in this business for more than 8 years. For 6 years of that time he was a student in a metal shop. This is the second year that he works alone.

He needs some machines so he wants to take an individual loan to buy new machines and complete his stock to attract more clients. He is happy that he has the opportunity to make a good income and help his family.

loans.use: To buy new machines

loans.name: Hoaz Ali

texts.en: Hoaz Ali lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and he has a retail shop. He is a very popular man in the area where he is working. He wants to expand his activities so he requested an individual loan to buy milk, sweets, candies, juices, soaps, sugar, baskets and extra materials to complete his stock to make his business more successful. He is happy with this process of small loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy milk, sweets, candies, juices and other products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase clothing in bulk for inventory.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 40 years old and she has three children, one of whom is studying in university. Her husband is unemployed. She has a small room in her house and she uses it for sewing. Her sister lives with them and helps with sewing. She has applied to get $1200 to purchase a new sewing machine and some fabric in order to increase her income and expand her project.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware and accept that this loan may represent a higher risk.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e. masking portions of the picture, altering his name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new sewing machine

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.en:
María Del Carmen is in her early 50s and is the very proud mother of three boys. Her husband works for a moving company. María sells a wide variety of à la mode products, ranging from perfumes, deodorants and body lotion to shoes and pants. She operates the business from her house, and she receives the patronage of thousands of people who want to buy her goods. She explains that she wants to get a new showcase to display her products so that people can better see the products she’s selling.

María says proudly that she has a very good clientele including college teachers and important persons of her community.

She’ll use her loan to buy more products to replenish her store and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy a large variety of inventory.

loans.name: Hanoi Altagracia

texts.en:
Hanoi Altagracia is 30 years old and married with no children. Hanoi is an ambitious and successful entrepreneur. She owns and operates a clothing store in the Hato Nuevo community of San Cristobal. Her store is well stocked and lots of people regularly visit to get pants, shirts and to check out the chic collection of shoes she offers.

Hanoi wants to expand her business. She’s thinking about offering nail-care services to her customers. She says that she worked for a long time in a nail center and that she has a huge knowledge and experience in the matter.

With her loan, Hanoi will buy fashionable new pants and shoes to add to her inventory so as to attract new customers.

This is the third loan Hanoi will take from FSMA. She is a trustworthy and responsible person, and she always had repaid the loan on time.

loans.use: Hanoi will invest in bulk clothing in order to replenish her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase perfumes, beauty products, and clothing for a small store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of hair care products for a small beauty parlor.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw materials in order to keep producing and selling food.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in the buy of raw materials to produce food for a small cafeteria.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: Antonia is thirty years old and she lives with her four children (three girls and one boy) in the Mulo community of Yamasá. To supply the family’s needs, Antonia sells clothing to men, women and children of the community. Shortly after starting her business, Antonia got a loan with which she made the purchase of a wide variety of clothing she needed to have a well-supplied stock.  The entrepreneur wisely used her loan, and she managed to move her business forward and she repaid successfully the loan. Antonia hopes that she’d like to see her children become professionals, and she says she'd move heaven and earth to help them achieve this goal. In the meantime, she’s supporting their primary school studies. Antonia is requesting a loan to buy a new collection of shirts and pants to add to boost her business. The entrepreneur is working hard to improve her life and her children’s.

loans.use: Purchase of a variety of new fashionable pants for a small clothing store.

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.en: Anatalia is forty-six years old and the proud single mother of three daughters and one son, all of whom attend school. To make a living and sustain her family, she sells homemaD. food. Anatalia defines herself as a great cook, and she says that she prepares delicious dishes. Anatalia has been running her business for almost one year, and currently she has a lot of customers that visit her house every day to purchase her succulent dishes. With her loan, Anatalia will buy a wiD. variety of goods to keep preparing her food and increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase an assortment of products in order to continue producing food for her customers.

loans.name: Thi An's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dương Thị An is 27 years old and has three young children. She lives with her large family which includes four generations under one roof. Her husband is a factory worker, but his job is in another part of Vietnam. Mrs. Dương is solely responsible for her business and for looking after her extended family. She earns a living by making rice noodles and raising pigs and sometimes has to resort to manual labor to make ends meat. Although Mrs. Dương has never borrowed money prior to this request, she would like a loan for $130 in order to expand her core business of producing rice noodles. Another group member, Mrs. Đỗ plans to use her portion of the loan for her woodshop. Mrs. Nghiêm needs $130 for her grocery business. The last two members of the group, Mrs. Nguyên and Mrs. Nguyên will use their funds to raise pigs. | Chị Dương Thị An, 27 tuổi, có 3 con nhỏ. Chị sống cùng chồng, mẹ chồng, ông chồng và 3 con gái. Gia đình chị đông người, chồng là công nhân đi làm xa nhà nên mọi gánh nặng gia đình dồn lên vay chị. Hàng ngày, ngoài chăm sốc gia đình, chị còn làm mỳ gạo, nuôi lợn và khi có thời gian chị còn đi làm thuê để có thêm thu nhập. Chị chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu, nay tham gia chương trình tài chính vi mô Binhminh với mức vốn 2006000 đồng để mua gạo làm mỳ. Chị hy vọng với khoản tiền này sẽ giúp chị phát triển nghề cũng như cải thiện cuộc sống gia đình hơn.
Trong nhóm chị còn có:
Chị Đỗ Thị Mai vay 2006000 đồng để chồng phát triển nghề mộc
Chị Nghiêm Thị Mai vay 2006000 đồng để thêm vốn mua hàng tạp hoá bán.
Chị Nguyễn Thị Hợi vay 2006000 đồng để thêm vốn mua cám cho lợn
Anh Nguyên Văn Ninh vay 2006000 đồng để thêm vốn mua cám cho lợn.

loans.use: Business expansion | Mua hàng

loans.name: Thi Xuan's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn is 34 years old and has two children in school. Her husband is a successful general contractor. Mrs. Nguyễn tends T. their rice paddies, raises pigs, and makes rice paper wrappers for an income. She is also involved with her community after she was elected as a leader for their women. Mrs. Nguyễn wants T. loan $130 from Kiva for a term of twenty-five weeks T. purchase more feed for her pigs. Other members of her loan group want T. expand their current businesses. One member of the group with the same last name, Mrs. Nguyễn, raises chickens. Mrs. Trần, yet another Mrs. Nguyễn, and Mrs. Tô, all have businesses related T. pigs. Mrs. Đỗ has a fruit business. | Chị Nguyễn Thị Xuâm 34 tuổi, có hai con còn đang đi học. Chồng chị làm chủ thầu xây dựng. Chị là chi trưởng phụ nữ thôn, tuy là cán bộ nhưng chị rất đảm đang trong công việc gia đình. Chị làm ruộng, chăn nuôi lợn và làm bánh đa nem. Tham gia chuwong trình tà chính vi mô binhminh với mức vốn 2006000 đồng trong 25 tuần, chị dùng để bổ sung vốn mua cám cho lợn. Trong nhóm chị còn có: 
Chị Nguyễn Thị Thuý vay 2006000 để chăn nuôi gà. Chị Trần Thị Tình vay 2006000 đồng để chăn nuôi lợn. Chị Đỗ Thị Hồng vay 2006000 đồng để buôn bán hoa quả. Chị Nguyễn Thị Sáu vay 2006000 đồng để chăn nuôi lợn. Chị Tô Thị Hà vay 2006000 đồng để đi chợ và mua cám lợn.

loans.use: Animal farming & vending | chăn nuôi, buôn bán

loans.name: Thi Chung's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Chung, 30 years old, has 3 children who are going to school. Her husband and she have been making rice noodles for about 5 to 6 years. She wants to borrow 2,006,000VND to buy rice in order to make noodles. Besides making noodles, she also breeds pigs and chickens. Mrs. Chung likes the microcredit program offered by TYM because with her daily income of 100,000 VN Dong she can manage to pay the weekly repayment. All of the women in her group include: Mrs. D. Thi Dinh, who want to take out 2,006,000 VNDong to buy more cloth for her tailor business. Mrs. C. Thi Bac want to take out the same amount to buy food to breed pigs. Mrs. N. Thi Lieu need the money to buy breed-chickens and gardening. Both Mrs. D. Thi Lien and N. Thi Lien want to borrow money to buy food for pigs and poultry.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong N., Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nghiêm Thị Chung, 30 tuổi, 3 con nhỏ đang đi học. Hai vợ chồng chị làm mỳ gạo từ rất lâu rồi (khoảng 5, 6 năm). Chị vay 2006000 đồng để mua gạo làm mỳ. Ngoài làm mỳ, chị còn chăn nuôi lợn, gà. Chị rất thích tham gia chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì với thu nhập hàng ngày 100000 đồng chị có thể trả góp hàng tuần dễ dàng. Các thành viên trong nhóm chị gồm: Chị Đặng Thị Dinh vay 2006000 đồng để thêm tiền mua vải làm nghề may. Chị C. Thị Bắc vay 2006000 đồng để thêm tiền mua cám lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Liệu vay 2006000 đồng để mua gà và trồng rau sạch. Chị Đỗ Thị Liên vay 2006000 đồng để mua cám lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Liên vay 2006000 đồng để mua cám nuôi gà.

loans.use: breeding animals and gardening

loans.name: Thi Thuy's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs Thuý was born in 1983. She is married and has 1 young child. She holds a small drugstore. Her husband is employed. She requests a loan of 2006000 VND to replendish her store.
Mrs Thảo sells grocery.
Mrs Hiến needs a loan to to open a wood shop at her home.
Mrs Hương sells basic goods at the market.
Mrs Loan raises pigs.
Mrs Thu needs a loan to buy feed for her chickens.
Mrs Ngân needs a loan to buy fabrics to open a tailor shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Thuý, sinh năm 1983, có chồng và một con nhỏ. Hiện nay chị mở cửa hàng bán thuốc trong thôn. Chồng chị làm công nhân. Chị vay 2006000 đồng để thêm vốn mở cửa hàng.
Chị Thảo vay 2006000 đồng để bán hàng thực phẩm.
Chị Hiến vay 2006000 đồng để thêm vốn làm xưởng mộc tại nhà.
Chị Hương vay 2006000 đồng để đi chợ sắt.
Chị Loan vay 2006000 đồng để chăn nuôi lợn.
Cô Thu vay 2006000 đồng để mua thức ăn cho gà đẻ trứng.
Chị Ngân vay 2006000 đồng để thêm vốn mua vải mở cửa hàng may đo quần áo.

loans.use: drugstore, grocery, wood shop, chicken feed, fabric

loans.name: Thi Cham's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs Châm (group leader) is an ex cadre of her hamlet. She raises poultry to make a living. Her husband passed away. She has a son who is in on assignment from the military. She requests a loan of 200600 VND to buy mash for feed for her chickens.
Mrs Ngô Thị Hà sells dried food.
Mrs Trần Thị Dung needs a loan to buy fertilizer and basic goods to resell.
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Sắc, C. Thị Tình, Nguyên Thị Tuyết and Nguyễn Thị Duyên will use the loan to raise pigs and buy basic goods to resell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Cô Châm là cán bộ cựu chiến binh của thôn. Cô vừa tham gia công tác của Hội cựu Chiến binh, vừa tham gia chăn nuôi để tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Chồng cô đã mất. Hiện nay cô có một con trai đang công tác tại quân ngũ. Cô vay 2006000 đồng để mua cám chăn nuôi gà thịt.
Cùng mức vốn vay 2006000 đồng như cô còn có:
Cô Ngô Thị Hà vay để đi chợ bán hàng khô.
Chị Trần Thị Dung vay để mua lân đạm làm nông nghiệp và thêm vốn đi chợ sắt.
Chị Nguyễn Thị Sắc, Chị C. Thị Tình, Chị Nguyên Thị Tuyết và Chị Nguyễn Thị Duyên đều vay để chăn nuôi lợn và đi chợ sắt.

loans.use: raise pigs, sell basic goods

loans.name: Abdul Raman

texts.en: Abdul Raman lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He runs a retail shop. He was in Iran for about seven years and when he came back he opened a retail shop in Kabul. After working for a year, he got married. Now he lives with his wife he wants to enlarge his shop. In order to do so, he wants to take an individual loan. He hopes to make a good monthly income in order to make a better future. He is happy now.

loans.use: To expand his store.

loans.name: Saltan Mahmood

texts.en:
Saltan Mahmood lives in district 15 of Kabul in Afghanistan. He is an educated, single man.

Saltan has a retail shop. He has been in this business for the past four years and has dedicated himself to it. Now he wants to expand the business, so he has requested an individual loan to buy more goods for his shop. He hopes to improve the economic situation for his family and make good income to help them better.

loans.use: To buy more goods for his shop

loans.name: Hafiz Allah

texts.en:
Hafiz Allah lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with one son. He has a retail shop. As a new business owner, he needs to enlarge his shop and complete his stock. To do so, he wants to take an individual loan to complete his necessary purchases, to attract more clients, and to make a good income to help his family.

He is happy and he would like to thank AFSG loan group in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To purchase necessary materials for establishing his store.

loans.name: Veronica's Tumaini. Group

texts.en:
Veronica is a married woman with 3 children, ages 12, 6 and 2 ½. She owns a small charcoal store, which she started in 2001, and is a batique designer. She works everyday from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $290 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan of $725 to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in cloth selling, chicken keeping and wholesaling.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal  for her business.

loans.name: Mariam's Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Mariam is a 49 year-old married woman with 5 children whose ages range from 12 to 30. She owns a small charcoal store which she started in 1999, and is an African articles arts dealer. Everyday, Mariam works from 9 a.m. to 8 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan of $775 to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in food vending and tailoring.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Abdul Khalaq

texts.en:
Abdul Khalaq lives in district 15 of Kabul in Afghanistan. He is married with four children.

He has a retail shop and has good experience. He is planning to increase his business, so he has requested an individual loan to buy more goods for his shop. He looks forward to increasing his income to support his family and make a better business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more goods for his store.

loans.name: Amanda's Chipukizi Group

texts.en:
Amanda, 22 years old, is a married woman with one child, age 3. Amanda is a wholesaler, a business she started in 2007. She works everyday from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $120 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan of $350 to buy more commodities for her business and to open a new business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Jesca, who has a business in cloth selling.

loans.use: To buy more comodities for her business.

loans.name: Naila

texts.en: Naila lives with her husband and child in the Khachmaz region (her husband is pictured here). They have had a general store for 6 years. Now they are requesting a loan of $850 to buy goods for improving their business.

loans.use: Buy goods to sell in the store

loans.name: Ruth Esther

texts.en: Ruth Esther is a very active and untiring businesswoman of the Doña Ana community of San Cristobal. She is thirty-two years old and a proud mother of two children that go to school. Ruth Esther is multifaceted entrepreneur. She owns and operates a cafeteria which offers a wiD. variety of typical Dominican foods.  Each day, she attends to thousands of people of the close-by neighborhood that visit her regularly to consume her tasty dishes. Ruth Esther also sells women’s clothing in the same community.  She runs that business mostly on the weekends. The entrepreneur explains that her businesses are very profitable. With incomes from her activities, she covers the expenses of her children’s studies and she pays the rental of her house. Ruth wants to expand her business and add new kinds of clothing to her store. She will use her loan to buy clothing in bulk (including men’s clothing) in order to attract more people and increase her sales volume.  That will allow the entrepreneur improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To replenish a small clothing store. Also to buy raw materials for a cafeteria.

location.town: Doña Ana community of San Cristobal

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en: Shahin was born in 1972, is single, and he lives in Khachmaz town. He has 5 years of experience selling flour wholesale. Now he is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy flour to sell.

loans.use: To buy flour to sell wholesale

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en: Bibiana is a single mother of a twenty-year-old daughter who goes to the university. To make a living and continue supporting her daughter, Bibiana sells underwear to men and women of the Doña Ana community of San Cristobal. She has been running this business for more than ten years. Bibiana also has a stall which she sets in a public place, and the passers-by visit it to purchase the fruits and vegetables she’s selling. Bibiana explains that she has to face a hard competition in the area, but she expects that her new underwear patterns and styles will help her attract more people in the market and increase her revenue. Bibiana wants to maintain a comfortable lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: To add new styles of underwear to her store in order to attract new clients.

location.town: Doña Ana community of San Cristobal

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en: Mariana is a budding entrepreneur that lives with her father and mother in the Doña Ana community of San Cristobal. She owns and operates a small beauty salon from her parents’ home. Every afternoon, women in the close-by neighborhood invade the family’s living room, which is turned into the beauty salon. Even though she doesn’t have to pay the rental for a local shop, Mariana thinks that it’d be better if she could get her own place where she can attend to her customers comfortably. With her loan, she will buy a new hair dryer and a large quantity of materials that she needs to carry out her job and satisfy her customers’ needs. That will allow Mariana to increase her revenue and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy materials for a small beauty parlor.

location.town: Doña Ana community of San Cristobal

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is the mother of four boys and one girl, all of whom attend school. Juliana has been running a beauty parlor in the Doña Ana community of San Cristobal for ten years. Her salon offers a variety of services such as nail care and hair care and includes nail polish, acrylic nails, hair cuts, hair dying and the like. Currently, the entrepreneur has a well established clientele, and she expects it to keep growing.

Juliana is requesting a loan to buy an assortment of materials which are necessary for her to carry out her work. The entrepreneur wants to increase her revenue so as to put aside money to support her children’s education and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase a lot of materials to keep running a beauty salon.

location.town: Doña Ana community of San Cristobal

loans.name: Julia Margarita

texts.en: Julia Margarita is thirty-seven years old and mother of four children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is mechanic. To supplement her family’s income, Julia sells clothing to men, women and children of the Doña Ana community of San Cristobal. She runs her business generally from her house, but on weekends she sells the clothing in La Pulga, one of the most famous informal markets of Santo Domingo, the capital. Julia will use her loan to buy recommended clothing to add to her stock. She expects to become one of the most well-established suppliers of these goods in her community.

loans.use: To buy clothing in bulk to replenish a small store.

location.town: Doña Ana community of San Cristobal

loans.name: Rosa Lina

texts.en: Rosa Lina owns and operates a small cafeteria in the Doña Ana community of San Cristobal.  She also sells men’s and women’s underwear. Rosa Lina separated from her husband long time ago, and since then she had to work hard to support her two children (a boy and a girl) on her own. She hopes that her business's’ continuous growth will help buy a house where her children can live at ease. With her loan, the entrepreneur will buy new styles of underwear to add to her stock. She’ll also purchase raw materials to keep producing food for her cafeteria.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for a small cafeteria. Also to buy clothing in bulk.

location.town: Doña Ana community of San Cristobal

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en: Iluminada is in her late thirties, and she and her husband have three children, two girls and one boy, all of whom go to school. Her husband is mechanic. To supplement her family’s income, Iluminada sells fruits and vegetables, and she also prepares spicy sausage pork. Her business helps her support her own university studies. Actually, Iluminada studies Educational Psychology. The entrepreneur says that education is the only gate to richness. “People don’t strike it rich; anyone has to work hard to improve her living conditions," she adds. Iluminada will use her loan to buy more fruits and vegetables and raw materials for her business. She says she’ll keep working hard for the sake of her family.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits, vegetables for a small business.

location.town: Doña Ana community of San Cristobal

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is the mother of four boys and one girl, all of whom attend school. Juliana has been running a beauty parlor in the Doña Ana community of San Cristobal for ten years. Her salon offers a variety of services such as nail care and hair care, and it  includes nail polish, acrylic nails, hair cuts, hair dying and the like. Currently, the entrepreneur has a well established clientele, and she expects it keeping growing. Juliana is requesting a loan to buy an assortment of materials which are necessary for her to carry out her work. The entrepreneur wants to increase her revenue so as to put aside money to support her children’s education and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase of a lot of materials for a beauty salon.

location.town: Doña Ana community of San Cristobal

loans.name: Novruz

texts.en: Novruz was born in 1977. He is married, and has one child. The B.'s family lives in the town of Khachmaz.  Five years ago he started the butchery. Now he is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy cattle so he can increase his butchery business.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Bakhtiyar

texts.en: Bakhtiyar has 2 years experience as a taxi driver. He was born in 1985, is not married, and he lives in the Khachmaz region. Now he is requesting a loan of $600 to buy the spare parts to maintain his taxi.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en: Tarana, who was born in 1981, is single, and lives in the town of Khachmaz. She and her mother have been selling sweets for 5 years. Now they are requesting a loan of $725 to buy more sweets to sell to increase their business.

loans.use: To buy sweets to sell

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en: Fatma was born in 1956, and has 4 children. She lives in the town of Khachmaz. Two years ago, she started a pharmacy. Now she is requesting a loan of $600 to buy more medicine to sell in her pharmacy.

loans.use: To buy medicine to sell

loans.name: Mwayaya's Mshikamano Group

texts.en:
Mwayaya, 38, a married woman with two children, ages 18 and 13, is a fish seller, a business she started in 2005. She works everyday from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

Mwayaya previously had a successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan of $1300 to buy more fish, and she will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses in food vending, kiosk operating and shoe selling.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Hawa's Tunyanyuane Group

texts.en:
Hawa, 40 years old and married with 2 children, ages 18 and 13, owns a small cafe which she started in 2004. She works daily from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $65 from her sales.

Previously, Hawa took out a successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan of $1000 to buy additional items for her cafe. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Milena

texts.en:
Milena is a young entrepreneur that struggles to improve her living conditions. She sells a collection of perfumes, deodorants, hand and body lotions, hair care products and the like. She’s been running this business for a couple of years.
Milena regularly visits other women in the neighborhood to show them some catalogs of the products she sells. Currently, she offers to her customers the products lines of AVON and EBEL. She plans on using her loan to add new types of products to her stock. Milena had already taken from FSMA a loan which she used wisely, and she managed to make her business successful and she repaid the loan on time. Milena says she’ll keep working hard so that she can soon buy her own house.

loans.use: To replenish a small business of selling beauty products.

loans.name: Fatuma's Mishemishe Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, 32 years old, is a single woman who sells products from a kiosk, a business she started in 2006. She works everyday from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m.and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Fatuma previously concluded a successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan of $775 to buy more items for her retail operation. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in timber sales and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en: Andrea lives in San Cristobal where she owns and operates a small store.  She sells a collection of chic products such as perfumes, beauty products, pants and shoes.  Andrea has received from FSMA a loan with which she made the purchase of a lot of products to add to her stock.  As an experienced entrepreneur, Andrea managed to sell off the products and increase significantly her income. She repaid the loan successfully. Currently, Andrea wants to replenish her store because many products are running out there. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of those products. That will allow her satisfy her customers’ needs and increase her revenue. Andrea hopes that her business’s continuous success will help her buy her own house.

loans.use: To restock a small business of selling beauty products and clothing.

loans.name: Mercedes Dilania

texts.en: Mercedes is thirty-two years old and a single mother of three boys and one girl, all of whom attend school in San Cristobal.  Mercedes sells underwear to men and woman of her community. She started her business last year, and now she has a well-established clientele which includes friends, teachers of the public school and people of the surroundings. Twice a month, Mercedes trips outside her community to buy the goods at low prices, and she retails them in her area. Mercedes hopes to become, before long, one of the most well-known supplier of these goods in the market. With her loan, the entrepreneur will buy big quantities of underwear so that she can reduce the frequent trips outside her community and increase her revenue.

loans.use: Purchase of underwear to add to her stock and keep running her business.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma, a 45 year-old widow with 4 children, ages 22, 20, 17 and 15, owns a small food vending store which she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Salma previously took out a successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan of $275 to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Saadat

texts.en: Saadat was born in 1976. She lives in Khachmaz town, and has 2 children. Four years ago, she started a tailoring business. Now she is requesting a loan of $600 to buy cloth for her business.

loans.use: To buy cloth for tailoring business

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a 25 year-old single woman who owns a small food vending store which she started in 2007. She works everyday from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $15 from her sales.
Aisha now hopes for a loan of $100 to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha, 30, a married woman with 3 children, ages 10, 7 and 5, owns a small food vending store which she started in 2005. She works everyday from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Previously, Asha took out a successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business, and now hopes for a loan of $275 to buy more food items for her business

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Subira, a 31 year-old married woman with one child, age 12, owns a small shop which she started in 2005.  She works daily from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m.and can earn a monthly profit of about $65 from her sales.
Previously, Subira took out a successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business, and now hopes for a loan of $275 to buy more commodities for her store.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam, a 45 year-old married woman with 4 children, ages 26, 23, 20 and 18, is a timber seller. She started the business in 2005, and she works daily from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m., earning a monthly profit of about $240 from her sales.

Mariam previously had a successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business, and now hopes for a loan of $600 to buy more timber for her enterprise.

loans.use: To buy more timber for her business.

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en: Parviz was born in 1975. He is married, and has 2 children, and has settled in Baku city in Azerbijan. Parviz is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory in the Agdam region of Azebaijan. Nine years ago he started a taxi businesss. Now he is requesting a loan of $600 to buy the spare parts to maintain the taxi.

loans.use: To buy the spare parts to maintain taxi

loans.name: Mariam's Tujikwamue. Group

texts.en:
Mariam is a 42 year-old married woman with one child, age 8. She and her husband also take care of three other people, ages 33, 30 and 22. Mariam is a chips seller, a business which she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 4 a.m. to 8 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $10 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan of $900 to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses in fish sales, café operations, and shop sales.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Gabil

texts.en:
Gabil was born in 1980. He is married, has one child, and settled in the town of Khirdalan. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Zangilan region in Azerbaijan.

He has been selling fruit for 10 years. Now he is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy more fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Cesilia's Tunajiamini Group

texts.en:
Cesilia, a 31 year-old married woman with two children, ages 11 and 6, owns a small food vending store, which she started in 2006. She works daily from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan of $650 to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses in charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a 39 year-old single woman who owns a small general store, which she started in 2007. She works everyday from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $240 from her sales.

Saumu now hopes for a loan of $150 to buy more items for her store.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her business.

loans.name: Aisas

texts.en:
Mrs. Aisas M. and her husband, AM. Sen, married in 1987. They have five children; three sons and two daughters. Four of their children are in school and the youngest one stays at home.

Mrs. Aisas has been selling fish for six years. Before starting this business, Aisas and her husband fished in the Mekong River since they got married. Currently, her husband is a motor taxi driver. For this fishing season Aisas and her husband want to start their business of fishing again and they need some money to repair their fishing materials. Their house is along Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Aisas is requesting a loan for the second time in the amount of $1000 to repair her fishing materials.

loans.use: To repair their fishing materials

loans.name: Prok

texts.en:
Mrs. Prok Y. is a widow with four children: two sons and two daughters. One of their children is married and lives in a separate house. The other two children work in a garment factory, and her other son farms with her. The family lives about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Prok is a farmer. She has been growing rice and raising pigs for twenty years. Besides farming, she also sells lotus flowers. She buys lotus flowers from a farmer in her village, and uses some from her farm, for resale at the market in Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Prok is requesting a loan for the third time in the amount of $1,000 to build a pig pen and to repair her house.

loans.use: To build a pig pen and repair her house

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Mr. Nov H. and his wife, Ky Noun, married in 1983. They have six children: two sons and four daughters. Four of their children are married and live in separate houses. One child works in a garment factory and the other one is in school.

Mr. Nov has been a motor taxi driver for many years. He carries people from his village to Phnom Penh City and from Phnom Penh to his village. His wife sells vegetables in the village. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Nov is requesting a loan for the fourth time in the amount of $700 to replace an old trailer with a new passenger trailer for his motor taxi business and to buy a water pump.

loans.use: For replacing a motor taxi trailer and purchasing a new water pump

loans.name: Zainabu's Tuamke Group

texts.en:
Zainabu is a 32 year-old married woman with 2 children, ages 15 and 12. She owns a small food vending store, which she started in 2006. She works everyday from 6 a.m. to 3 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan of $400 to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in bites sales and banana sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Cesilia's Tusongembele Group

texts.en:
Cesilia is a 30 year-old married woman with 3 children, ages 10, 9 and 2. She and her husband also take care of 2 other people, ages 70 and 50. Cesilia sells clothes, a business that she started in 2000. She works everyday from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan of $875 to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling cloth, food, and operating a café.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Marmar

texts.en:
Marmar is a mother of 2 children, and she is 42 years old. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory in the Kalbadjar region of Azerbaijan. She settled in the town of Khirdalan.

Two years ago, Marmar started a scrap metal business. Now she is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy scrap metal to sell.

loans.use: To buy scrap metal to sell

loans.name: Khai

texts.en:
Mrs. Khai P. and her husband married in 1993. They have three children: two sons and one daughter. Two of their children study in primary school and the youngest one stays at home. The family lives about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Khai has been selling Tape (a Cambodian dessert made from sticky rice) and growing rice for eight years. She sells the dessert around her village. Her husband has been growing rice and fishing for ten years.

Mrs. Khai is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $800 to purchase one boat machine for her husband’s business and to pay the plowing fee for growing rice.

loans.use: For purchasing one boat machine and to pay a plowing fee

loans.name: Sokkin

texts.en:
Mr. Sokkin B. and his wife married in 1996. They have three daughters. One of their daughters studies in primary school and the other two little daughters stay at home. The family lives about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Sokkin has been fishing for four years. He fishes in his village and then sells the fish at the Prek Pnao Market. His wife stays at home to take care of their children.

Mr. Sokkin is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $400 to purchase a motorbike to use to sell fish.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to use to sell fish

loans.name: Kosol

texts.en:
Mr. Kosol P. and his wife, Narin Yin, have been married since 2000. They have two children; one daughter and one son, one of whom studies at the local school. The family lives about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Kosol has been a Motor Remoque taxi driver for seven years. He carries people and goods from his village to Phnom Penh City and back. His wife has been a garment factory worker for ten years.

Mr. Kosol is requesting a loan for the second time in the amount of $600 to replace an old trailer with a new passenger trailer for his motor taxi business and for repairing his house.

loans.use: For replacing motor taxi trailer and repairing house

loans.name: Gabil

texts.en:
Gabil, born in 1975, is married, and has one child. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory in the Agdam region of Azerbaijan. He settled in Baku city.

Gabil has run a taxi business for 4 years. Now he is requesting a loan of $600 to buy the spare parts to maintain his taxi.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to maintain the taxi

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mr. Mao E. and his wife, Sophoin Auk, have been married since 1988. They have four children; three sons and one daughter, three of whom are employed full time. The other one studies at local school. The family lives about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Mao has been a motor taxi driver for nineteen years. He carries people from his village to Phnom Penh City and from Phnom Penh to his village. His wife stays at home and takes care of their children.

Mr. Mao is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $700 to replace an old motorbike with a new motorbike for his motor taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Veasna

texts.en:
Mr. Veasna P. and his wife, Yin Sam, have been married since 1991. They have three children; two sons and one daughter, two of whom are employed full time. The other is in school. The family lives in a Phnom Penh suburb.

Mr. Veasna has been a motor taxi driver for two years. He carries people around Phnom Penh City. His wife has been a garment factory worker over ten years.

Mr. Veasna is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $1200 to repair his house.

loans.use: To repair his house

loans.name: Slamas

texts.en:
Mrs. Slamas H. is widow with one son. Her husband died when her son was young. Her son helps her to sell fish. Their house is along the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Slamas has been selling fish for eighteen years. She buys fish from fishermen in the Mekong River for resale at Prek Anchanh Market, about seven kilometers from her village. She and her son carry the fish from the fishing lot to the market in their old motorbike.

Mrs. Slamas is requesting a loan for the third time in the amount of US$600 to replace an old motorbike with a new motorbike to use to sell fish.

loans.use: To buy new motorbike for their fish business

loans.name: Kouk

texts.en:
Mr. Kouk K. and his wife, Yun Yot, have been married since 1981. They have no children. The family is about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.
