Mr. Kouk has been selling cows for two years. He buys cows from other village to resell in his village and in nearby village for growing rice and for food. Before he started this business, he was a farmer. His wife stays at home.

Mr. Kouk is requesting a loan for the third time in the amount of $500 to buys more cows to resell.

loans.use: For buying cows for resale

loans.name: Anna's Tunajiamini Group

texts.en:
Anna is a 42 year old married woman with three children, ages 24, 22, and 20. Anna is a cloth seller, a business she started in 1998. Every day she works from 10 A.M. to 4 P.M. at her business where she earns a monthly profit of about $190.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more cloth for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who sell charcoal and chickens.

loans.use: To buy more cloth  for her business

loans.name: Djalal

texts.en: Djalal has run a taxi business for 5 years. He is 38 years old, married, has 2 children, and has settled in Binagadi. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Khodjavand region in the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. Now he is requesting a loan of $850 to buy spare parts to maintain his taxi.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to maintain taxi

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 37-year-old Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Zangilan region in the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. He settled in the town of Khirdalan.

Three years ago, Iman started a taxi business. Now he is requesting a loan of $600 to buy the spare parts for maintaining his taxi.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to maintain the taxi

loans.name: Amina's Tunajiamini Group

texts.en:
Amina is a 28 year old married woman with one child, age 2. Amina is a wood seller. Every day she works from 8 A.M. to 8 P.M. at her business where she earns a monthly profit of about $190.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more wood for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who sell wood, bananas, and run a salon.

loans.use: To buy more wood for her business

loans.name: Houwayda

texts.en:
Houwayda is a 36-year-old woman who lives in Nabatieh in southern Lebanon. Houwayda is married and has five children. She makes bread, a kind of bread that is called 'saj' in Lebanon.

Houwayda is applying for a loan to buy necessary provisions such as flour for her small business.

loans.use: To buy provisions such as flour.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 22-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh in southern Lebanon. Mohamad sells mobile phones.

This is the first time Mohamad has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to buy mobile phone refill cards. Mohamad is a very ambitious young man who is striving to develop his business.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone refill cards.

loans.name: Mwanaisha's Tunajiamini Group

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a 45 year old married woman with four children, ages 26, 25, 16, and 8. Mwanaisha owns a small food vending store. Every day she works from 8 A.M. to 8 P.M. at her business where she earns a monthly profit of about $25.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Hidaya, who sells cloth.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Asha's Tujikwamue Group

texts.en:
Asha is a 39 year old married woman with three children, ages 6, 4 and 1. She and her husband also take care of two other people, ages 63 and 50. Asha is a cloth seller, a business she started in 2006. Every day she works from 8 A.M. to 7 P.M. at her business where she earns a monthly profit of about $140.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more cloth for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who sell food.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 52 years old. He lives in Nabatieh in southern Lebanon and is married with one child. Ali sells mobile phones.

This is the first time Ali has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to buy mobile phones and accessories to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 33-year-old man who lives in southern Lebanon, in Nabatieh. He is married and has two children. Ali is a police officer serving the municipality and he also owns a clothing store.

This is the third time he has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to buy new merchandise for the coming season.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Joha's Tujikwamue Group

texts.en:
Joha is a 35 year old married woman with three children, ages 15, 10 and 7. She and her husband also take care of two other people, ages 63 and 50. Joha owns a small shop, which she started in 2004. Every day she works from 8 A.M. to 6 P.M. at her business where she earns a monthly profit of about $140.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Leah, who sells cloth.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman with 2 children, ages 9 and 4. She and her husband also take care of 2 other people, ages 58 and 50. Agnes is a cloth and soap seller, a business she started in 2006. Every day she works from 8 A.M. to 6 P.M. at her business where she earns a monthly profit of about $140.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria O. is married with 4 children. She is 51 years old and sells firewood. She has been in business for 20 years and comes from Edo State, Nigeria. She spent 8 months learning her trade. She needs the loan amount of $700 to buy more firewood for sale.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for sale

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a 28 year old married woman with 2 children, ages 9 and 4. She and her husband also take care of one other child, age 4. Rehema owns a small cafe and pool table, a business she started in 2007. Every day she works from 7 A.M. to 9.30 P.M. at her business where she earns a monthly profit of about $240.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence I. is from Edo State, Nigeria, and she is married with 6 children. She is 40 years old. She sews and sells clothes. She has been in business since 1993. She needs the loan amount of $875 to buy clothing materials for sale.

loans.use: To buy clothing materials for sale

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a married woman with 4 children, ages 8, 5 and 4. Safia is a cloth seller. She started her business in 2006. Every day Safia works from 10 A.M. to 3 P.M. at her business where she earns a monthly profit of about $40.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more cloth for her business.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her business

loans.name: Ashura

texts.en:
Ashura is a 32 year old married woman with 2 children, ages 15 and 12. Ashura is a tailor, a business she started in 2005. Every day she works from 8 A.M. to 5 P.M. at her business where she earns a monthly profit of about $30.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Hayel

texts.en:
Hayel is a 29-year-old man who lives in southern Lebanon, in Nabatieh. Hayel is a car mechanic.

This is the first time Hayel has applied for a loan at A. Majmoua. He wants to buy tools for his business and with the increased income generated from the investment, he plans to open a store specializing in car decoration.

Hayel is a very ambitious man striving to seize every opportunity he gets to grow professionally.

loans.use: To buy tools for his business.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
The client, who has asked that his name not be released, is a 41-year-old man who lives in southern Lebanon. He is married and has three children. He is in the printing business.

This is the first time that the client has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to buy paper and ink to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy paper and ink for his printing business.

loans.name: Wanyange Lake F F Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Esther Maitekyalo. She is currently in the business of sewing clothes and handicrafts making and is requesting a loan to purchase a designing sewing machine. Esther is 38 years old and is married with a husband. She has 4 children ranging from age 7 to 17 and her children go to school. Each week, Esther makes approximately UGX 91000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children Esther has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to add in business and the loan was paid back on time.

Esther is joined in her small group by Christine N., Tapensi M., Milly K., and Nubuwat K.. Christine N. has a business in selling new shoes and wants to buy more stock and start broiler poultry business. Tapensi M. is currently operating a business in charcoal selling and wants a loan to start matooke business. Milly K. operates a business of bar and wants to buy a fridge and more equipment. Nubuwat K. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs and is requesting a loan to increase purchases.

loans.use: To add in tailoring business

loans.name: Paulina's Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Paulina is a 22 year old single woman. She is a cloth seller, a business she started in 2005. Every day she works from 6 A.M. to 10 P.M. at her business where she earns a monthly profit of about $230.

In the past, Paulina has already taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more cloth for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who sell cloth and food.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her business

loans.name: Wanyange Lake K A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Fida B.. She is currently in the business of milling and selling maize and is requesting a loan to purchase more maize. Fida is 47 years old and is a widow. She has 6 children ranging from ages 18 to 27 and three of her children go to school. Each week, Fida makes approximately UGX 70000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house and cater for her family's basic needs. Fida has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to her milling business and the loan was paid back on time.

Fida is joined in her small group by Betty N., and Aziza K.. Betty N. has a business running a restaurant and wants to purchase a fridge. Aziza K. is currently operating a business selling charcoal and wants a loan to purchase in bulk.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of maize

loans.name: Wanyange Lake K B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Christine M.. She is currently in the business of selling used clothing and is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to sell. Chirsitne is 22 years old and is married with a husband who is a builder for work. She has 3 children ranging from age 5 months to 4 years old. Each week, Christine makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to meet the basic needs of her family. Christine has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy more sacks of charcoal and the loan was paid back on time.

Christine is joined in her small group by Fatuma N., Hasifah N., Prossy A., and Hellen A.. Fatuma N. has a business in clothing sales and wants to boost business. Hasifah N. is currently operating a tailoring business and wants a loan to purchase a bicycle and more fabric. Prossy A. operates a business selling beer and wants to add more stock. Hellen A. is currently in the business of selling beer and is requesting a loan to add more capital.

loans.use: To increase clothing purchases

loans.name: Masasi Group

texts.en:
Sabra B., age 36, is married and has an 11 year old son. She opened a charcoal business two years ago and works from 7am to 8pm daily selling charcoal. This business nets a monthly profit of about $75.

Sabra is the chairwoman for loan group Masasi, which has 16 members (see the photo). Sabra and her loan group hope for a loan to expand and develop their various small businesses. This is the group’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. The group as a whole guarantees the loan of any member who defaults.

Sabra will use her share of the loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy charcoal for resale

loans.name: Saumu's Mapatano Group

texts.en:
Saumu is a 30 year old single woman. She takes care of 2 children, ages 13 and 12. Saumu is a cosmetics seller, a business she started in 2007. Every day she works from 9 A.M to 10 P.M. at her business where she earns a monthly profit of about $380.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have businesses selling cloth and food.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Anna's M/chai Group

texts.en:
Anna is a 32 year old married woman with one 7 year old child. Anna owns a small food vendor store, a business she started in 2002. Every day she works from 5 A.M. to 8 P.M. at her business where she earns a monthly profit of about $280.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mwamvita, who sells charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Wanyange Lake K C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Shallot K.. She is currently in the business of selling new clothes and is requesting a loan to increase her capital stock. Shallot is 48 years old and is married with a husband who is a driver for work. She has 5 children ranging from ages 9 to 23 and her children go to school. Each week, Shallot makes approximately UGX 49000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to add to her business. Shallot has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy new clothes and the loan was paid back on time.

Shallot is joined in her small group by Florence N. and Jenifer K.. Florence N. has a business selling clothes and wants to expand the business. Jenifer K. is currently operating a retail shop business and sewing business and wants a loan to add more stock and also purchase a bicycle.

loans.use: To add working capital to clothing business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 50 year old married woman with 5 children, ages 25, 23, 20, 18 and 14. She and her husband also take care of 2 other children, ages 26 and 25. Evelyn sells cloth and alcoholic beverages, a business she started in 2000. Every day she works from 8 A.M. to 8 P.M. at her business where she earns a monthly profit of about $480.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Toukan

texts.fr:
Toukan Mané is 42 years old, married and a mother of 4 children. She has been a member of the Tilène Daraal village bank for the past 6 and a half years. She has always refunded her loans. She buys rolls of embroidered fabric, wax and starch to make clothes for sale. The income helps her take care of her children, improve her standard of living and build her business. Toukan is asking for this 14th loan which she plans to reimburse in 6 months in only one installment.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Toukan Mané, 42 ans, mariée et mère de 04 enfants à sa charge est membre du banc villageois de Tilène Daraal depuis six ans et demie.Elle a toujours remboursé ses prêts. Elle achète des rouleaux de tissus brodé, des Wax et du Bazin pour confectionner des habits pour vendre. Ses revenus lui permettent d'entretenir ses enfants, d'améliorer son niveau de vie et celui de son activité. Toukan sollicite ce 14 ème prêt qu'elle compte rembouser au bout de 6 mois avec une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase of embroidered fabrics , wax and starch

loans.name: Kavuga Group

texts.en:
The Kavuga Group has been together for six years and comprises 16 men and women who each have businesses in the area. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, who will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible

Anet L., the group’s chairperson, is seeking a loan to purchase a refrigerator, some chairs, and drinks to sell in her bar.

Anet runs a bar from which she serves beer and non-alcoholic beverages to the locals in her town of Mpigi. The bar is open every day of the week from 7am to midnight, and Anet works alone, caring for her youngest child during the day. The bar has been in operation since 2005, and sales have steadily increased over time.

Anet is 28 years old. She is married and has two daughters aged nine and four years. Her husband is a forest ranger. They value education highly and hope that their children become accountants or engineers.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator, some chairs, and inventory for her pub.

loans.name: Wanyange Lake K D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Miriam N.. She is currently in the business of selling raw food and is requesting a loan to purchase a bicycle to transport the food from the villages to her stall. Miriam is 31 years old and is married with a husband who is an egg supplier for work. She has 6 children ranging from ages 4 to 16 and her children go to school. Each week, Miriam makes approximately UGX 45000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children. Miriam has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 350000 in order to buy more raw food and the loan was paid back on time.

Miriam is joined in her small group by Ester N., Robina T. and Muselina M.. Ester N. has a business selling raw food and wants to rent bigger business premises. Robina T. is currently operating a grocery store business and wants a loan to purchase more groceries. Muselina M. operates a charcoal and scrap selling business and wants to buy more scrap to sell.

loans.use: To add to raw food business

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa B. is seamstress and a trader who sells materials, lining, and other items. She is married to a commercial driver and has two children. Customers are increasing but she lacks the tools and materials to enable her meet their demand.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital with which to buy needles, thread, pins, and lining to sew clothing.

loans.use: To buy needles, thread, pins, and lining

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Kulwa

texts.en:
Kulwa is a 33 year old married woman with two children, ages 12 and 8. Kulwa is a cloth seller, a business she started in 1999. Every day she works from 5 A.M. to 4 P.M. at her business where she earns a monthly profit of about $ 330.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more cloth for her business.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her business

loans.name: Budumbuli West F B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Annet K.. She is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to add more clothing stock and invest in a farming business. Annet is 32 years old and is married with a husband who is a business man for work. She has 3 children ranging from ages 3.5 to 11 and her children go to school. Each week, Annet makes approximately UGX 200000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children and save the rest.

Annet is joined in her small group by Betty N. and Kasifah N.. Betty N. has a business in used clothing sales and wants to expand her business. Kasifah N. is currently operating a business selling fish and milling and selling maize and wants a loan to buy more stock.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell and venture into a farming business

loans.name: Endurance

texts.en: Endurance O. is married with 4 children. She is 43 years old and hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She sells fish and has been in business since 2002. She needs the loan amount of $875 to buy more fish for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more fish for sale

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is single woman. She owns a small salon and shop, a business she started in 2000. Every day she works from 7 A.M. to 10 P.M. at her business where she earns a monthly profit of about $280.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Budumbuli West F C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Zelidah N.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more shop items. Zelidah is 39 years old and is divorced. She has 5 children ranging from ages 8 to 17 and her children go to school. Each week, Zelidah makes approximately UGX 70000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children and save the rest. Zelidah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to her retail shop and the loan was paid back on time.

Zelidah is joined in her small group by Beth N. and Halimah N.. Beth N. has a business running a retail shop and wants to add more stock. Halimah N. is currently operating a business in used clothing sales and dairy sales and wants a loan to buy a commercial motorcycle.

loans.use: To increase stock in retail shop

loans.name: Osaretin

texts.en: Osaretin H. is married with 2 children. She is 26 years old and hails from Edo State. She sews and sells clothing materials. She has been a LAPO client for over 5 years now. She needs the loan amount of $700 to buy more clothing materials for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials for sale

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 28 year old married woman with one 8 year old child. Salma is a cloth and wood seller, a business she started in 1998. Every day she works from 5 A.M. to 8 P.M. at her business where she earns a monthly profit of about $330.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Mpigi Loan Group

texts.en:
The Mpigi Loan Group has been together for six years and comprises 20 men and women who each have businesses in the area. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, who will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Benna M., the group representative, is seeking a loan to purchase raw materials in order to increase her cake sales. Benna has been baking cakes and selling them at her shop in Tugamo market for 20 years. During this time, she has expanded her business from selling cakes by the slice to making special cakes to order for weddings and other functions. She has also improved her cake shop with the recent addition of a refrigerator and more serving platters. Next, Benna hopes to buy a new cooker and then eventually a warmer and a deep fryer.

Benna is 50 years old and is the sole support of four children, ranging in age from three to 21 years. They all live with her at home and still attend school.

loans.use: Benna Mantale, the group representative, is seeking a loan to purchase raw materials for her bakery.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence I. is married with 9 children and lives in Benin City. She is 57 years old and sells provisions and foodstuffs. She started her business in 2003. She needs the loan amount of $875 to buy provisions and foodstuffs for sale.

loans.use: To buy provisions and foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Blansia

texts.en:
Blansia is a 35 year old married woman. She owns a small shop, which she started in 1999. Every day she works from 7 A.M. to 6 P.M. at her business where she earns a monthly profit of about $380.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Nakanyonyi Da Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Christine K.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add more shelves and stock. Christine is 25 years old and is married. She has 2 children aged 3 and 6, and both of her children go to school. Each week, Christine makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save for future use. Christine has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to add to her retail shop and the loan was paid back on time.

Christine is joined in her small group by Faith N. and Cleofasi A.. Faith N. has a business in used clothing sales and wants to expand to wholesale. Cleofasi A. is currently operating a business in used clothing sales and wants a loan to increase her purchases.

loans.use: To add more commodities to shop

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam I. is married with 2 children. She is 37 years old and has been in business since 2004. She sells building materials and spent years learning the trade. She is from Edo State. She needs the loan amount of $875 to buy more building materials for sale.

loans.use: To buy building materials for sale

loans.name: Budumbuli West F A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rebecca K.. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal. Rebecca is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a driver for work. She has 4 children ranging from ages 3 months to 12 years old and most of her children go to school. Each week, Rebecca makes approximately UGX 160000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children. Rebecca has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Rebecca is joined in her small group by Beat N., Justine N. and Afuwa W.. Beat N. has a business selling raw food and wants to add more stock. Justine N. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to purchase more commodities. Afuwa W. operates a business selling charcoal and wants to purchase more sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: To increase charcoal purchases

loans.name: Zainabu's Ari Mpya Group

texts.en:
Zainabu, age 45, is married and has 5 sons. She runs a wholesale fruit business, which she started in 1990. She works daily from 6am to 6pm selling fruit. She makes a monthly profit of about $55.

In the past, Zainabu took out two loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her stock of fruit for resale. She paid these back successfully and now hopes for a new loan to open a shop. She has yet to decide what items to sell there, but she has many dreams.

She will share this loan with her group, who have businesses dealing in clothing, fish, charcoal, and food sales. The group members are guarantors of each other's loans.

In the picture, Zainabu is in the back row, second from the left.

loans.use: To open a shop

loans.name: Winfrida's Sisikwasisi Group

texts.en:
Winfrida is 38 years old and is a married woman with three children, ages 9-25. Winfrida is a clothes seller; she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 9:30 AM to 6 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $240 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in clothing sales and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Daudu

texts.en: Daudu M. is married with 4 children. He is 40 years old. He is from Edo State. He has been in business since 1993. He spent 3 years learning his trade. He needs the loan amount of $350 to enable him buy spare parts for fridges in bulk.

loans.use: To buy parts in bulk for repairing fridges

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 34 years old and is a married woman with four children, ages 12-14 years. Amina owns a small shop, which she started in 2000. Every day, she works from 6:30 AM to 10 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

Mayi has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Mayi is joined in her small group by Janet N.. Janet N. has a business milling and selling maize and wants to purchase more sacks of maize.

Each week, Cissy makes approximately UGX 42000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to cater for her personal needs and save the rest Cissy has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 150000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Cissy is joined in her small group by Prossy Wesogna and Fatuma N.. Prossy Wesogna has a business selling used shoes and wants to stock more shoes. Fatuma N. is currently operating a business selling used clothes and wants a loan to increase stock.

Fatuma is 44 years old and is a married woman with four children, ages 27, 25, 24 and 15. Fatuma owns a small charcoal store, which she started in 2000. Every day, she works from 8 AM to 6 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $170 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Nuru and Queen, who have businesess dealing in food vending.

Hazidah is joined in her small group by Aisha N., Muhammed S. and Lukia N.. Aisha N. has a business selling vegetables and wants to buy a goat for rearing. Muhammed S. is currently operating a business selling new shoes and wants a loan to add more stock. Lukia N. operates a business milling and selling maize and wants to buy more sacks of maize.

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Hazidah M.. She is currently in the business of selling matooke and is requesting a loan to expand to bulk selling. Hazidah is 38 years old and is a widow. She has 4 children ranging from age 9 to 17 and her children go to school. Each week, Hazidah makes approximately UGX 140000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to cater for home neccesities Hazidah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to buy cattle and the loan was paid back on time.

Hazidah is joined in her small group by Aisha N., Muhammed S. and Lukia N.. Aisha N. has a business in vegetable selling and wants to buy a goat for rearing. loans.name: Diariétou

texts.fr:
Diariétou D. is a 40 year-old mother of 4 children and has been a member of the Tilène Daraal village bank in Ziguinchor for 5 and a half years. She has always respected her engagements with the bank. She would like to buy bags of rice, oil cans and soap bars to re-stock her shop. The income from this business helps her take care of the needs of her family. Diariétou is asking for this loan which she plans to reimburse in 6 months in only one installment.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Diariétou D., 40 ans, mariée, mère de 04 enfants à sa charge est membre du banc villageois de Tilène Daraal à Ziguinchor depuis 5 ans et demie.Elle a toujours respecté ses engagements.Elle veut achèter des sacs de riz, des bidons d'huile, des paquets de savon pour renforcer sa boutique. loans.name: Victoria

loans.name: Budumbuli West G A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rose T.. She is currently in the business of selling motor cycle spare parts and is requesting a loan to increase her capital stock. Rose is 35 years old and is married with a husband who is a mechanic for work. She has 4 children ranging from ages 8 to 19 and her children go to school. Each week, Rose makes approximately UGX 120000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children and cater for the household necessities. Rose has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Rose is joined in her small group by Betty K., Martha K., Mariam N., and Robinah N.. Betty K. has a business selling edibles and wants to put up a kiosk. Martha K. is currently operating a beauty salon business and wants a loan to purchase a hair dryer and a public pay phone. Mariam N. operates a salon business and wants to purchase more salon equipment. Robinah N. is currently in the business of selling vegetables and is requesting a loan to start a business selling matooke.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts to sell

loans.name: Asia's Utulivu Group

texts.en:
Asia is 46 years old and is a married woman with four children, ages 22, 18, 14, and 10. She and her husband also take care of two other children, ages 14 and 10. Asia is a tailor; she started in 1981. Every day, she works from 9 AM to 6 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in trading and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Budumbuli West G B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Juliana K.. She is currently in the business of running a grocery store and is requesting a loan to purchase a fridge and add more stock. Juliana is 23 years old and is single. She has 1 daughter aged 10 months. Each week, Juliana makes approximately UGX 105000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to cater for her personal needs and save the rest. Juliana has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add stock to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Juliana is joined in her small group by Cissy N., Fatuma K. and Ruth K.. Cissy N. has a business running a beauty salon and wants to buy a hair dryer and more braids. Fatuma K. is currently operating a business selling charcoal and wants a loan to increase her purchases. Ruth K. operates a business selling milk and wants to purchase a fridge and increase the quantity of milk available for purchase.

loans.use: To expand grocery business and make more profits

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace O. is married with 3 children. She hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She is into tailoring and spent 3 years learning her trade. She has been in business for 9 years and needs the loan amount of $450 to buy cloth for sale.

loans.use: To buy cloth for sale

loans.name: Haadija's Utulivu Group

texts.en:
Hadija is 38 years old and is a married woman with one child, age 21. Hadija owns a small grocery, which she started in 2005. Every day, she works from 9:30 AM to 5 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $240 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have food vending and salon businesses.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Budumbuli West G C Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Aisha M..  She is currently in the business of selling new clothes and is requesting a loan to increase her purchases.  Aisha is 48 years old and is a widow.  She has 8 children ranging from ages 7 to 30 and some of her children go to school.  Each week, Aisha makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to cater for her household needs.  Aisha has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.  Aisha is joined in her small group by Eseza K. and Madinah M..  Eseza K. has a business running a restaurant and wants to add more equipment.  Madinah M. is currently operating a farming business and wants a loan to buy insecticides.

loans.use: To increase the stock of shoes

loans.name: Wanyama West A (I) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Deziranta M.. She is currently in the business of farming and selling clothes and is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers. Deziranta is 49 years old and is married with a husband who is a farmer for work. She has 10 children ranging from ages 15 to 31 and some of them go to school. Each week, Deziranta makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land. Deziranta has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Deziranta is joined in her small group by Jane A., Ida I. and Hamidah B.. Jane A. has a business operating a kiosk and wants to add more stock and purchase a fridge. Ida I. is currently operating a business in used clothing sales and wants a loan to increase inventory. Hamidah B. operates a business of selling local herbs and wants to boost business.

loans.use: To add to farming business and boost it

loans.name: Hanzeran's Ari Mpya Group

texts.en:
Hanzeran, age 40, is a single parent of three children (ages 20, 17, and 12). She has a cosmetics business and she also sells clothing door-to-door to make a living. She travels to the island Zanzibar to purchase her goods. She started this work five years ago and now makes a monthly profit of about $90. She works from 2:00 in the afternoon to 8:00 each evening.

In the past, Hanzeran took out two loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to make trips to Zanzibar, pay school fees for her kids, and expand her line of products. She now hopes for a new loan to travel to Zanzibar once again to buy cosmetics and clothing. She will also use the loan to pay the examination fees for her child who is in Form 2 (second year of secondary school).

Hanzeran will share this loan with her subgroup who have businesses dealing in charcoal, clothing, food, and fabric sales.

In the picture, Hanzeran is in the back row, first on the left.

loans.use: To expand the various businesses of the group members

loans.name: Wanyama West A (Ii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Cathy M.. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal. Cathy is 39 years old and is a widow. She has 6 children ranging from ages 8 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Cathy makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save for future use. Cathy has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 350000 in order to add to her charcoal business and the loan was paid back on time.

Cathy is joined in her small group by Joweria N., Joy M. and Sarah T.. Joweria N. has a business selling shoes and charcoal and wants to add to her shoe business and increase stock. Joy M. is currently operating a business selling vegetables and charcoal and wants a loan to buy more vegetables. Sarah T. operates a business selling used shoes and wants to stock more shoes.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Wanyama West C (I) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Betty M.. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to start a business selling clothes. Betty is 39 years old and is a widow. She has 6 children ranging from ages 12 to 19 and her children go to school. Each week, Betty makes approximately UGX 35000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save for future use. Betty has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to add to her charcoal business and the loan was paid back on time.

Betty is joined in her small group by Mugabi B. and Jennifer K.. Mugabi B. has a business running a retail shop and wants to purchase a fridge and add stock. Jennifer K. is currently operating a business selling beer and wants a loan to add to her business.

loans.use: To venture into a business selling clothes

loans.name: Winni

texts.en:
Winni is 30 years old and is a married woman with three children, ages 10-25. Winni owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 6:30 AM to 6 PM at her business.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Wanyama West C (Ii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Annet N.. She is currently in the business of used clothing sales and is requesting a loan to add capital stock. Annet is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a mechanic for work. She has 2 children aged 6 and 8, and both of her children go to school. Each week, Annet makes approximately UGX 36000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children. Annet has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Annet is joined in her small group by Prossy N., Sarah M. and Monica B.. Prossy N. has a business running a restaurant and wants to add more equipment. Sarah M. is currently operating a local brewery business and wants a loan to buy more brewing ingredients. Monica B. operates a business selling used clothing and charcoal and wants to add more stock.

loans.use: To increase the volume of clothes purchased

loans.name: Tusooka Kkayula Women's Group

texts.en:
K. (age 32) is one member of the group. She has owned a restaurant for 8 years, from which she serves breakfast, lunch, and supper to the locals. She would use the loan to buy chairs and a table, and also to pay the salaries of her two employees. She cooks and prepares a range of meals including bananas, sweet potatoes, rice, meat, chicken, fish, and greens. She works from 5am to 9pm, then returns home to her husband and three children. Her eldest child is ten, and K. hopes that her daughter will become a nurse when she finishes school. Her husband works as a driver.

Sarah (age 33) has been purchasing scrap metal from the locals for 12 months now. Each month she hires three workers and a driver and his truck to take her the 40 miles to the nearest town, where she sells the scrap to a large merchant. She sells between five and seven tons of scrap metal each week. She also has a small sugar cane farm and employs one worker to run it. She would use the loan to pay the salary of her farm worker, and in this way she could keep both businesses afloat. Sarah is married and has eight children ranging in age from 17 to 2 years old. Her husband owns a general store. She hopes to pay for her eldest child's tuition in a business course. She would like him to become a tailor.

loans.use: The group is made up of 20 women from the local community and has been borrowing for ten years for the women’s various business enterprises.  They are hardworking women who, as a group, are responsible for the timely repayment of their loans.  The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, who will invest in their own businesses. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 40 years old and is a married woman with three children, ages 12-26. Asha is a food seller; she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 8 AM to 10 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $280 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Elsi

texts.en: Elsi is a teacher who earns only $50 a month, and her husband, who is also a teacher earns $80.  With two children all in school, the couple’s income does not meet family expenses.  Elsi started a utensils-selling business to supplement their salaries.  She operates her business in the afternoon after classes.  Elsi is requesting a loan of $150 so she can invest in her business and earn more income.  Elsi is 29 years old and married with 2 children.

loans.use: To invest in her small business.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 28 years old, a teacher, and separated and with 2 children.  She runs her business in one of the smallest town markets of Makeni in Sierra Leone.  With her small income of Le.197, 000 per month, Marie found it difficult to meet family expenses.   So with her first loan, she started a business and assigned her grown nephew to manage it. She takes over the management in the afternoons after she finishes teaching.  Marie  is requesting a loan of Le.700, 000 ($250).  She wishes to expand her business and increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her business

loans.name: Emanuel K.

texts.en: Emanuel is 32-years old and married.   His salary does not meet the family expenses and he can not save enough to assist his wife to expand her business.  Emanuel therefore requesting a loan of $175 to expand his wife’s shoe-selling business and will pay the loan installments from his monthly salary to enable the business to grow.

loans.use: To expand shoe-selling business

loans.name: Paz P.

texts.es:
Paz owns a public transportation “Inter Provincial” minibus. He also works as a bricklayer. With these two jobs, he generates enough income to support his wife and child. He lives in the Los Andes zone in the city of El Alto.

The loan that he is requesting will be used to give maintenance to his minibus (engine replacement) so that he can continue to work, offering his family better living conditions.

This is his second loan with IMPRO; his excellent payment history allows him to request another loan. He has been our customer since 2006.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Paz tiene un minibús que trabaja de transporte público Inter provincial; también trabaja como albañil y de estas sus principales actividades genera sus ingresos económicos para la manutención de su pequeño hijo y esposa; vive en la Zona Los Andes de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito requiere para el mantenimiento de su minibús (cambio de motor) para continuar trabajando y ofrecer mejores condiciones de vida de su familia.

Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO, el buen comportamiento de pago le faculta acceder a otro préstamo. Es cliente nuestro desde el año 2006.

loans.use: Minibus maintenance and engine replacement

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Epifania is a street vendor who sells pork and chicken rinds in her stand at the 16 de Juilio market in the city of El Alto. Her husband is currently unemployed, so he helps her with the business. They have 3 school age children and live in the Villa Ingenio zone in the city of El Alto.

The loan is needed for the purchase of products (papa, chuño) in order to restock for a period of time, since the prices for these products are rising because of the high inflation that the country is experiencing. If she manages to buy these products at a good price, then her meal prices will not increase, so she will sell as much as usual.

This is her second loan request via Kiva. Her excellent payment history allows her to request another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Epifania es vivandera tiene su puesto de venta en la feria 16 de Julio de la Ciudad de El Alto; el producto que comercializa es chicharrón de pollo y cerdo; su esposo es desempleado actualmente y esta ayudando a la esposa; tienen tres hijos que están en edad escolar y vive en la Zona Villa Ingenio de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito requiere para comprar mercadería (papa, chuño) para poder abastecer por un determinado tiempo ya que estos insumos están subiendo de precio, debido a la inflación que actualmente se vive en el País. Si logra comprar los productos a buenos precios, entonces el precio de sus platos de comida no se incrementará y podrá seguir vendiendo como hasta ahora.

Es el segundo crédito vía Kiva, el buen comportamiento de pago que demostró le faculta para otorgarle otro préstamo.

loans.use: Purhcase of potatoes, chuños (freeze-dried potatoes) and other products before prices increase

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a 29-year-old married woman who lives with her husband in a house they recently bought. From the time she was young, she helped her mother run a small family convenience store. Now that she is living with her husband, she too decided to open a similar store. While her husband works for the city, she works in the small convenience store.

Today she is seeking funds to buy more merchandise in bulk for her store. In particular, she feels that if she is can purchase goods in bulk (e.g., sugar, flour, and oil), then she would be able to sell her goods at more affordable prices.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise (e.g., sugar, meat, bread, and milk) for her convenience store

loans.name: German

texts.es:
German is a tailor; he makes men's suits that are sold in Bolivia Santa Cruz and Cochabamba. His wife helps him to sell the suits during the feria on July 16th in the city of El Alto. In this way he earns the income with which he supports their two children. He lives in the Las Nieves area of the city of La Paz.

The requested loan will be used to buy a sewing machine which will help him to meet the demand in his market.

This is his fifth loan with Impro. His good loan history qualifies German for another loan. German has been a client of ours since 2001.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer.

German es costurero; confecciona trajes para varón los cuales son comercializados en el interior de Bolivia Santa Cruz y Cochabamba; la esposa ayuda comercializando los trajes en la feria 16 de julio de la Ciudad de El Alto. De esta manera logran sus ingresos con los que cubre la manutención de sus dos hijos; vive en la Zona Las Nieves de la Ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito solicitado será utilizado para comprar una maquina recta de coser misma que le ayudara para satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que tiene en su mercado.

Es el quinto crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite aprobarlo otro préstamo. German es cliente nuestro desde el año 2001.

loans.use: Sewing machine for tailor’s shop

loans.name: Maximina's Group

texts.es:
Elizabeth, Mercedes and Maximina have belonged to the Workers Communal Bank for 8, 3, and 14 years respectively.

Elizabeth is 28 years old and has 1 daughter of 8 years. Elizabeth sells fruits in the Nery Garcia market. She buys the fruit wholesale from the province of San Miguel.

On the other hand, Mercedes is married, is 33 years old and has 3 children. Mercedes has a grocery store in her house. In addition, Mercedes has a bakery where she makes typical loaves of bread such as "chapla" that she distributes to all the stores of her area.

Maximina is married, is 60 years old and has 6 children. Maximina has a restaurant in her house, an activity that she started 4 years ago.

Elizabeth, Mercedes and Maximina need loans of 600 soles, 1400 soles, and 600 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of oranges, flour, firewood, rice, milk, meat and cheese.

The dreams of Elizabeth, Mercedes and Maximina are to improve their business, that their children study and become professionals, and to initiate new business.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Elizabeth, Mercedes y Maximina pertenecen al Banco Comunal Obreras hace 8, 3, 14 años respectivamente.

Elizabeth es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 1 hija D. 8 años, Elizabeth venD. frutas en el mercado Nery García, la fruta lo compra al por mayor D. la provincia D. San Miguel.

Por otro lado Mercedes es casada, tiene 33 años y 3 hijos, Mercedes tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa. Además Mercedes tiene su panadería donD. elabora panes típicos como la “chapla” y lo reparte a todas las tiendas D. su zona.

Mientras que Maximina es casada, tiene 60 años y 6 hijos, Maximina tiene un restaurante en su casa, actividad que realiza hace 4 años.

Elizabeth, Mercedes y Maximina necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles, 1400 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. naranja, harina, leña, arroz, leche, carne y queso.

Los sueños D. Elizabeth, Mercedes y Maximina son mejorar su negocio, que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales, iniciar nuevos negocios.

loans.use: To buy oranges, flour, firewood, rice, milk, meat and cheese.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose O. is married with 2 children and is 26 years old. She is a hair stylist by profession. She spent 2 years learning the job and has been in it for 9 years. She needs the loan amount of $450 to buy hair weaves and other hair accessories for sale.

loans.use: To buy hair weaves and other hair accessories for sale

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica D. is married with two children. To help support her family, she works as a fishmonger. She buys fish from the local fishermen, smokes them, and then travels to villages to sell the fish.

She is asking for $525.00 to have enough capital to buy fish in bulk. Monica is also a member of a lending group called “Mawunyo Traders” that consists of 13 borrowers in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Mama

texts.en:
Mama K. is a fishmonger. She is married to an electrician and has one child. She buys fish fresh from the fishermen, brings it home for processing, and then sells it to her customers. She wants to increase sales to meet the demand of her costumers.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more fish for processing and sale.

loans.use: To buy more fish to process and sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace T. is married with 5 children. She is 52 years old and owns a rental business. She is from Edo State, Nigeria, and has been in business since 2001. She needs the loan of $450 to buy more canopies for renting.

loans.use: To buy canopies

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo is a young, 21-year-old man who lives at home with his parents. He started his business of selling household goods with his uncle when he was very young, and he continues to work in sales because it brings in a good amount of income.

With the income he generates from the business, he is able to pay for his night school. At school, he is majoring in accounting and is working hard to graduate on time. Leonardo is seeking a loan in order to buy more goods in bulk so that he can sell them for less money, thereby making his business more competitive in the market.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise (e.g., saucepans, thermoses, sheets, etc.) in bulk.

loans.name: Favour

texts.en: Favour A. is married with 5 children. She is 44 years old and has been in business since 1990. She sells fish and hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She spent a year learning the trade. Favour buys river fish and sells them; but because some of her customers want it dried, she goes the extra length to smoke some on the fire for them, and her customers really appreciate it. She needs the loan amount of $600 to buy river fish for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish for sale

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.en:
Enyonam B. has been smoking and selling fish for three years. She buys the fish on the docks of Elmina (a small fishing village 5 km from Cape Coast) and then sells them to local villagers. She is married and has two children. She is currently buying fish on credit, which cuts into her profits.

She is requesting $525.00 so that she has enough capital to buy fish in bulk. Enyonam is also a member of a lending group called “Mawunyo Traders" that consists of 13 borrowers in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Nanfiou

texts.fr:
Born on 11 May 1979 in Sakete in the Benin plateau, Mr. Nanfiou A. is married and has one child. A tailor by profession, several years ago he began selling traditional ready-to-wear clothes, which he sends to other countries in the region, notably Mali and Burkina Faso, where the quality of his work is highly appreciated. The demand inside as well as outside the country is becoming increasingly large, but the means to obtain a supply of fabric and printed cloth for production is insufficient. For this reason, he is asking for a third loan to finance and strengthen his business so as to satisfy the demands of his current clientele and future customers who would like to seek his services.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Né le 11 mai 1979 à SAKETE dans le plateau du BENIN, monsieur A. Nanfiou est marié et père d’un enfant. Brodeur de profession, il s’est lancé depuis quelques années dans la vente des tenues traditionnelles prêt-à-porter qu’il envoie dans les pays de la sous région notamment au Mali et au Burkina Faso où la qualité de son travail est bien appréciée. La demande à l’intérieur comme à l’extérieur du pays devient de plus en plus grandissante mais les moyens de s’approvisionner en tissus et pagne suffisants pour la confession ne répondent pas. Pour cette raison, il sollicite son troisième prêt pour financer et renforcer son activité afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle et de ses futurs clients qui aimeraient solliciter ses services.

loans.use: To buy 25 bolts of fabric

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: Fatu sells tie-dye materials, pans and other essential goods.  Family members also help her sell some of the goods in the villages and collect the cash on a weekly basis.  With her previous loans from SMT, she diversified her business and would like to expand it further.  She is therefore requesting for a loan of $675 for so her business can continue to grow.

loans.use: To further expand a successful small business

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Salamatu is 38-years old and married with 5 children.  Like many Sierra Leonean women, she runs her business to earn income to support the family expenses.  She owns a grocery store in the town of Makeni and would like to expand her business.  She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to grow her grocery business.

loans.use: To grow grocery business

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity T. owns a shop where she makes hair for people living in her community; she also sells cloth. She is married with a child and is 27 years old. She has been in business since 2004 and hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She spent 1 year and 6 months learning the business. She needs the loan of $450 to buy cloth in bulk for sale.

loans.use: To buy cloth for sale

loans.name: Sherry

texts.en:
Sherry K. is married to a fisherman and has three children. Like her husband, she is in the fishing business. She is a fishmonger who buys fish, smokes them, and then sells them to local villagers in Elmina (a small fishing village 5 km from Cape Coast).

She is requesting a loan of $525.00 so that she has enough capital to buy fish in bulk. Sherry is also a member of a lending group called “Mawunyo Traders” that consists of 13 borrowers in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
M. Agnes is a fishmonger. Her husband is also a fishmonger and they have two children together. Her business is doing well but her problem is insufficient capital to buy more fish.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more fish for processing and sale.

loans.use: To buy more fish to process and sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence I. sells clothing and also sews for people. She is married with 5 children and is 44 years old. She spent 3 years learning her business and has been in business since 1995. She needs the loan amount of $450 to buy wrapper for sale.

loans.use: To buy wrapper for sale

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr:
Amy Cissé is 51 years old, is married and a mother of 3 children. She is a member of the Tiléne Daraal village bank in the Ziguinchor area. She has always respected her engagements with the bank. Amy would like to buy rice bags and oil cans to restock her canteen and to diversify her products in order to satisfy her clients. The income drawn from this trade helps her take care of her 3 children and 2 grandchildren. She is asking for a 14th loan which will be refunded in 6 months in only one installment.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Amy Cissé, 51ans, mariée et mère de 03 enfants est membre du banc villageois de Tiléne Daraal à Ziguinchor.Elle a toujours respecté ses engagements. Amy veut acheter des sacs de riz et des bidons d'huile pour renforcer sa cantine et diversifier ses produits afin de satisfaire sa clientèle.Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d'entretenir ses 03 enfants et ses 02 petits fils qui sont à sa charge. Elle sollicite un 14ème prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de 06 mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy rice and oil to restock her canteen.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo renovates, repairs, and sells car batteries. He started working with batteries at a very young age when he was working for another individual's business. After much time and sacrifice working for that business, he started his own business. Now, he works to support his small family: his wife and their two elementary school-age children.

Thanks to the help of his faithful and hardworking wife, he has been able to raise a family, buy a house, and now has a successful business. He is asking for a loan today so that he may buy batteries, both new and used, to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase car batteries.

loans.name: Block A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Lucia P.. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Lucia is 37 years old and is married with a husband who is a soldier. She has 5 children ranging from age 4 to 15 and her children go to school. Each week, Lucia makes approximately 150 Sudanese pounds in profits. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay for school fees and construction.

Lucia is joined in her small group by Mary J., Susan P., Grace C., and Jackline J.. Mary J. has a business selling beer and wants to expand the business. Susan P. is currently operating a business selling bread and wants a loan to construct an oven for the bread. Grace C. operates a business selling bread and wants to stock more wheat and cooking oil. Jackline J. is currently selling vegetables and is requesting a loan for cultivation.

loans.use: Expand their businesses.

loans.name: Nanah

texts.en: Nanah is a widow with 4 children.  She has been running her business in Makeni town of Sierra Leone for the last 4 years.  With her previous loans, she diversified her business and began selling shoes and other ladies wear by hawking them on the street  Nanah would like to rent a stall in the market for her business and is requesting a loan of $675 for that purpose. She is working very hard to be successful, and having a permanent location will improve her business.

loans.use: To rent a stall in the market

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy F. is married and has four children. He buys fish on the docks of Elmina (a small fishing village 5 km from Cape Coast) and then travels to the Volta and Ashanty regions to sell his smoked fish. He is requesting a loan of $525.00 to buy fish in bulk so he can get a discounted price and stop using credit to buy his supplies. Sammy is hoping this will increase his profits and he’ll be better able to provide for his family.

Sammy is also a member of a lending group called, “Mawunyo Traders”, which consists of 13 borrowers in Cape Coast, Ghana

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk at a discount and stop using credit to buy his supplies

loans.name: Sorie

texts.en: Sorie C. is 52-years old and a school headmaster. Even though he has logged many years of teaching, he earns less than $100 a month and it could take him a long time to save enough to invest in a business.  Sorie is requesting a loan of $275 to purchase a plot of land to build a family house from mud bricks, and part of the loan will be given to his wife to start a business selling rice and palm oil.  Sorie will pay the installments from his monthly salary.  His aim is to build a family house instead of renting, which is very expensive for the family.

loans.use: To buy a small plot of land and help his wife with her business

loans.name: Joseph K.

texts.en: Joseph is 36-years old and married, and is living in a rented house.  As a teacher, his salary is less than $100 per month.  It took 3 years for Joseph to save money to start the foundation of their house.  With his wife’s small business, they do not earn enough to invest in the building.  Joseph is requesting for a loan of $275 to his monthly salary.

loans.use: For additional capital to complete a house

loans.name: Sorie O.k.

texts.en: Mr. T. is a Headmaster and has been working in Education for 35 years.  He is 53-years old and is married with five children, two of which are married.  With 35 years earning a teaching salary, Sorie could not purchase or build a house for the family.  He has bought a plot to build the family house, but cannot do so as the government needs him to get a house plan and legalize the land by April.  He is requesting a loan of $350  to process the land title, develop a house plan, and purchase one-dozen zinc sheets.  He will repay the loan from his monthly salary.

loans.use: For additional funding to begin building a family home

loans.name: Paul S.

texts.en: Paul is a retired school headmaster who was later recalled by the school to be a counselor.  With his retirement package, he purchased land but could not meet the government requirement for a land title and house plan due to lack of money.  As a counselor, he earns less than $100 per month.  He is requesting a loan of $175 to process the land title and make mud bricks.  He is able to pay the installments from his monthly salary. Paul is 60-years old.

loans.use: For money to begin constructing his home

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
A. Silvia is a fishmonger. She is married and has three children. She buys fresh fish from the fishermen, brings it home for processing, and then sells the it to her customers.

She wants to expand her business and is asking for $525.00 so that she can buy more fresh fish for processing and sale.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to process and sell

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr:
Born in Cotonou in 1963, Mrs. Julienne A. is from Grand Popo, a village in the department of Mono, of Plah ethnicity. She currently lives in a shanty town in Cotonou with her fisherman husband and 4 children. She is a retailer of smoked shrimp in the largest markets in Benin, notably in Dantokpa, which is the largest market in the southwestern part of Africa. The demand for her goods is clearly increasing, whereas the means she has at her disposal to create a supply are very limited. She is thus asking for this loan to increase her stock in order to respond to the demands of her current and future customers.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Née à COTONOU dans les années 1963, dame A. Julienne est originaire de Grand Popo un village du département du Mono, de l’ethnie Plah. Actuellement elle vit dans un bidonville de Cotonou avec son mari pêcheur et ses 4 enfants. Elle est une revendeuse de crevettes fumées dans les plus grands marchés du BENIN notamment à DANTOKPA qui est l'un des plus grand marché de la sous région ouest africaine. La demande est en nette progression alors que les moyens dont elle dispose pour s’approvisionner sont très limités. Elle sollicite alors ce prêt pour augmenter son stock afin de répondre aux attentes de la clientèle actuelle et future.

loans.use: To buy 45 baskets of fresh shrimp

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica G. is a fishmonger. Her husband is a carpenter and together they have two children. Her business is doing well but her problem is insufficient capital to buy more fish for processing and sale.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more fish.

loans.use: To buy more fish to process and sell

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana D. is married and has four children. She has been a fishmonger for the past eleven years. She buys the fish on the docks of Elmina (a small fishing village 5 km from Cape Coast) and sells them to local villagers. She is requesting a loan of $525.00 to have enough capital to buy fish in bulk.

Juliana is also the leader of a lending group called “Mawunyo Traders” that consists of 13 borrowers in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen T. is a fishmonger. He buys fish fresh from the fishermen, brings it home for processing, and then sells the fish to his customers in a distant town. His problem is the cost of transferring the fish but he has many clients to satisfy.

He is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more fish and also to help him with transportation.

loans.use: To buy more fish and help with transportation

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Toulaye

texts.fr:
Toulaye C. is 39 years old, is married a has been member of the Tilène Daraal village bank in Ziguinchor for the past 6 years. She would like to buy and resell "crinting", an artisanal material for building fences. In order to be able to provide for her needs, Toulaye would like to grow her trade and is asking for a loan which she intends to refund in 6 months in only one installment.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Toulaye C., 39 ans, mariée est membre du banc villageois de Tilène Daraal à Ziguinchor depuis 6 ans . Elle veut acheter et revendre des crinting, un matériel de fabrication artisanale utilisé pour la construction de clôture. Afin de pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins, Toulaye souhaite renforcer son commerce et sollicite un prêt qu'elle compte rembourser au bout de 6 mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase of "crinting" - a building material

loans.name: Dede

texts.en:
Dede T. buys fish on the docks of Elmina (a small fishing village 5 km from Cape Coast) and sells them to local villagers. She is married and has four children. She is requesting a loan of $525.00 to have enough capital to buy fish in bulk. Fishmongers often have to use credit to buy fish, which really hurts their profits.

Dede is also the leader of a lending group called “Mawunyo Traders” that consists of 13 borrowers in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta A. has been a fishmonger for the past two years. She is married to a cement contractor and has two children. Benedicta buys fish on the docks of Elmina (a small fishing village 5 km from Cape Coast), and sells them to local villagers. She is requesting a loan of $525.00 to have enough capital to buy fish in bulk.

Benedicta is also the leader of a lending group called “Mawunyo Traders” that consists of 13 borrowers in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Solange

texts.fr:
Born on 30 April 1969 in Cotonou, Mrs. Solange S. is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. An upstanding woman, she knows how to read and write in French, having attended school until the 4th class at the secondary level (equivalent to 8th grade, typically taken at age 13-14). She excels in selling various products such as eggs, milk, and rice, having done only this for the past ten years. Currently, the demand for her goods greatly exceeds her existing stock, leading her to ask for this loan in order to increase her supply to satisfy her clientele.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 30 avril 1969 à COTONOU, dame S. Solange est mariée et mère de 4 enfants tous scolarisés. De bonne moralité, elle sait lire et écrire le Français puisqu'elle a fréquenté jusqu’à avoir le niveau de la classe de quatrième du premier cycle de l'enseignement secondaire. Elle excelle dans la vente de produits divers tels que les œufs, le lait, du riz pour ne citer que ceux là depuis une dizaine d’année. Actuellement la demande de ses articles dépasse largement le stock existant d’où la sollicitation de ce crédit pour s’approvisionner afin de satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy 5 cartons of milk, 5 bags of rice, and 18 trays of eggs

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou Mang is a 38 year-old mother and has been member of the Hathioume village bank in Ziguinchor for the past six and a half years. She has always respected her engagements with the bank. She buys cans of palm oil, lemons and brooms which she then resells. The income from the sales make it possible for her to help with the family's needs. Fatou is requesting a loan which will be refunded in 6 months in only one installment.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Fatou M., 38 ans, mère de famille est membre du banc villageois de Hathioume à Ziguinchor depuis six ans et demie et a toujours respecté ses engagements.Elle achète des bidons d'huile de palme, de citron et des balaies qu'elle revend. Les revenus tirés du commerce permettent d'aider à l'entretien de la famille. Fatou sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de 6 mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase of lemons, palm oil and brooms

loans.name: Hélène

texts.fr:
Mrs. Hélène V. was born around 1967 in Cotonou. She is married to Prospère HOUNKPE, with whom she has 4 children. During her youth, Mrs. V. grew up next to her maternal grandmother, where she stayed until adulthood. Her grandmother was a traditional pharmacist. There, Mrs. V. learned the techniques to prepare traditional medicine and herbs. Currently, she lives with her husband in a shanty town in Cotonou, where she sells various herbs with medicinal properties. She is asking for this loan to diversify her range of herbs and roots, and to respond to the demands of her clientele, who are devoted to the medicinal virtues of the leaves and roots of the plants of Benin.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Dame V. Hélène est née vers les années 1968 à Cotonou. Elle est mariée à HOUNKPE Prospère avec qui elle a eu 4 enfants. Dès son jeune âge, dame V. Hélène est placée au côté de sa grande mère maternelle où elle est restée jusqu’à l’âge adulte. Sa grande mère était une pharmacienne traditionnelle. Là, dame V. Hélène a appris les techniques de composition des médicaments et feuilles traditionnels. Actuellement elle vit avec son mari dans un bidonville de Cotonou où elle vend diverses feuilles aux vertus médicinales. Elle demande ce prêt pour diversifier sa gamme de feuilles et racines et pour répondre aux sollicitation de sa clientèle trop accrochée aux vertus médicinales des feuilles et racines de plantes du Bénin.

loans.use: To buy various medicinal herbs

loans.name: Teolina

texts.en:
Teolina and Carlos are the proud parents of two grown children. Together they own a bar that was passed on to Teolina by her mother and that is strategically located near a large school. Teolina’s tavern is known throughout the town for its excellent and attentive service, as well as its great food.

Teolina is looking to invest in her business and buy a refrigerator to keep her food and drinks fresh and cool. She is asking for a loan to keep her business running and successful.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Tida

texts.fr:
Tida Sané is married and is the bank treasurer of the Santack village in the Ziguinchor area where she has been living for the past 6 and a half years. She has always reimbursed her loans without difficulty. She buys and sells dead wood, and fruit such as mangos. Tida would like to build her business in order to provide for her needs. She is therefore asking for a 14th loan that she plans to reimburse in 6 months in a single installment.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Tida Sané, mariée est trésorière du banc villageois de Santack à Ziguinchor ou elle est membre depuis 6 ans et demie. Elle a toujours remboursé ses prêts sans difficulté.Elle achète et revend du bois mort, et des fruits ( mangues et mades ).Tida souhaite renforcer ses activités pour parvenir à subvenir à ses besoins . Elle sollicite ce 14ème prêt qu'elle compte rembourser au bout de 6 mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase of wood and fruits

loans.name: Alma Delia

texts.es:
Alma Delia Hernández is a married mother of a 7-year-old son. Her husband works as a crane operator. Looking for an additional source of income, she started selling shoes by catalogue a year ago. Little by little, her clientele has been increasing, which is why she now needs a loan in order to purchase more merchandise.

She needs $300.00 USD, which she is willing to repay in 3 months. With your help, Alma and her family will be able to aspire to obtain a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Alma Delia Hernández es una mujer casada con un hijo de 7 años, su esposo trabaja como operador de grúa y hace 1 año buscando una fuente de ingresos adicional para su hogar empezó a vender calzado por catalogo entre sus amistades poco a poco se fue haciendo de mas clientes, es por esto que requiere un crédito para comprar mercancía.

Ella necesita US $300, cantidad que esta dispuesta a pagar en 3 meses. Con tu ayuda Alma y su familia podrán aspirar a una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina S. is an enterprising woman, like many others in Mexico, who started selling shoes and apparel by catalogue three years ago. This job appealed to her because one of her friends sold products by catalogue and earned a good salary.

Looking for bigger profits, she needs a loan of $475.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to invest it in the purchase of new merchandise, thus catering to a larger number of customers. With your help, Guille will have a prosperous business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Guillermina S. es una mujer emprendedora como muchas en México que hace 3 años inicio su carrera en las ventas por catalogo específicamente ropa y zapatos motivada por una de sus amigas quien se dedicaba a esto y le generaba buenos ingresos.

Buscando una mayor entrada de dinero a su hogar ahora ella necesita un capital de US $475 que liquidara en 6 meses para invertirlos en nueva mercancía y así poder abarcar un mayor numero de clientes. Con tu ayuda Guille podrá hacer prosperar su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
