Juliet is joined in her small group by Rose N., Betty N. and Sumayiya M.. Rose N. has a business running a bar and wants to purchase more brew and beer. Betty N. is currently operating a business selling fish and charcoal and wants a loan to buy more charcoal. Sumayiya M. operates a retail shop business and wants to add more commodities.

loans.use: To purchase more trucks of firewood

loans.name: Safarkul

texts.ru:
Safarkul B. lives in the Khuroson region. He is 41 years old , married and has four children. He has secondary education. His is in agriculture and has his own piece of land where he cultivates wheat, flax and other crops. He sells the crops to wholesalers which use the wheat for flour. He keeps the smaller part of a yearly supply of wheat for his family's use. Because wheat is a very important dietary product it is in very high demand. This helps develop the business with full confidence and sow large areas of land with wheat. Safarkul has been in the agriculture for the past three years. He now needs financing for buying of seeds, fertilizer and ploughing (the use of fuel and renting of equipment). He plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Бобоеров Сафаркул проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст 41 лет , женат, имеет 4 детей.Образование среднее. Занимается земледелием . Имеет участок земли , засеивает который пшеницей , льном и другими сельхоз культурами.Получаемый урожай продает оптовикам, которые используют пшеницу под муку. Меньшую часть пшеницы оставляет для своей семьи запасом на один год. Так как мука является важным продуктом питания у населения , она пользуется большим спросом. Это позволяет развивать данный бизнес и с уверенностью засеивать большие участки земли пшеницей. Занимается земледелием клиент около 3 лет.Клиент нуждается в дополнительном финансировании для покупки зерна, удобрений и для вспашки земли( топливо, аренда трактора) . Погасить кредит клиент плнирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy wheat seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Budumbuli West A (Ii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Jane N.. She is currently in the business of selling firewood and local brew and is requesting a loan to buy more brew drums. Jane is 30 years old and is a widow. She has 6 children ranging from age 3 months to 12 years old and most of her children go to school. Each week, Jane makes approximately UGX 450000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children. Jane has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Jane is joined in her small group by Aisha N. and Lukia N.. Aisha N. has a business selling matooke and wants to buy more matooke from the surrounding villages. Lukia N. is currently operating a business milling and selling maize and wants a loan to purchase more sacks of maize.

loans.use: To add capital to brewery business

loans.name: Adzedzi

texts.en:
Adzedzi M. is 37 years old and the married mother of 5 children, all enrolled in school. Her husband is a farmer, and it is therefore difficult for him to meet the needs of his family, as cultivable land is becoming more and more rare and less fertile. Mrs. M. has been specializing in the sale of insecticides for the last 3 years. Her shop is located in Avetonou, a small village located about 120 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She hopes that with her loans she can increase the capacity of her business by buying 20 cartons of insecticide. This will help her to participate in meeting the needs of her family from the profits that she will earn from the sale of her merchandise. Mrs. M. is a good client, as she has already benefited from 1 loan, on which she made payments regularly.

Adzedzi M. est âgée de 37 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants tous à l’école. Son mari est un cultivateur et subvient difficilement aux besoins de la famille puisque les terres cultivables deviennent de plus en plus rares et moins fertiles. Madame M. était specialisée dans la vente des insecticides depuis 3 années. Elle vend ses produits dans une baraque qu’elle a installé à Avetonou, un petit village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle souhaite avec les fonds augmenter la capacité de son entreprise en achetant 20 cartons d’insecticides et par là participer à la prise en charges des besoins de la famille par les profits qu’elle va dégager dans la vente de ses marchandises. M. est un bon client puisqu’elle a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit et les remboursements ont été réguliers.

loans.use: To buy 20 cartons of insecticide

loans.name: Mary's Umoja Group

texts.en:
Mary J. is a 33-year-old married mother of two young children living in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. To help support her family, Mary holds two jobs. Not only is she a nursery teacher, but she also has her own business selling cloth. Each month, she earns about $90.

Mary hopes to grow her business, which is why she's applied for a group loan of $625 U.S. dollars. Her three other partners, Blandina K., Mwanaisha S., and Mariam H., each have their own businesses, selling food, cloth, and chips. Mary has taken out one loan previously and paid it back on time, so she is confident that she will be able repay this loan as well.

loans.use: To buy more fabric for a cloth-selling business

loans.name: Hudoyberdy

texts.ru:
Hudoyberdy B. lives in the Khurson region. He is 48 years old, married and has 5 children. He has a high school degree and is a farmer. Hudoyberdy owns a plot of land where he grows wheat, flax and other agricultural crops. He sells his crops to wholesalers who grind the wheat into flower. A small part of his harvest Hudoyberdy saves for one year for his family. Since wheat flower is a main staple of the local diet, it is always in high demand. This gives Hudoyberdy confidence in his business and he wants to grow wheat in large amounts. He now needs additional funding to purchase more seeds and fertilizer as well as fuel and tractor rent to plant his fields. Hudoyberdy is planning to pay back the loan in the next 10 months

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Бобоеров Худойберды Проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст 48 лет , женат, имеет 5 детей.Образование среднее. Занимается земледелием . Имеет участок земли , засеивает который пшеницей , льном и другими сельхоз культурами.Получаемый урожай продает оптовикам, которые используют пшеницу под муку. Меньшую часть пшеницы оставляет для своей семьи запасом на один год. Так как мука является важным продуктом питания у населения , она пользуется большим спросом. Это позволяет развивать данный бизнес и с уверенностью засеивать большие участки земли пшеницей. Клиент нуждается в дополнительном финансировании для покупки зерна, удобрений и для вспашки земли( топливо, аренда трактора) . Погасить кредит клиент плнирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of wheat seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Budumbuli West A (Iii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Justine B.. She is currently in the business of running a bar and is requesting a loan to add more furniture. Justine is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a fisherman for work. She has 4 children ranging from ages 1 to 12 and her children go to school. Each week, Justine makes approximately UGX 70000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to cater for her household's needs. Justine has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to invest in her bar business and the loan was paid back on time.

Justine is joined in her small group by Joy B., Sarah N. and Monica B.. Joy B. has a business running a restaurant and wants to purchase a fridge and add more equipment. Sarah N. is currently operating a cosmetic shop business and wants a loan to purchase more cosmetics and buy a sewing machine. Monica B. operates a business selling charcoal and wants to add more stock.

loans.use: To purchase more chairs and tables to add to the bar

loans.name: Osman

texts.en: Osman was born in 1958. He is married, has 3 children, and is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town. He is settled in the Fuzuli region of Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs. Three years ago he started this business. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy a cow, which he hopes will improve his dairy business.

loans.use: To buy a cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Budumbuli West A (Iv) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Muyinda N.. She is currently in the business of maize milling and is requesting a loan to buy more maize and a fridge. Muyinda is 31 years old and is married with a husband that engineer for work. She has 5 children ranging from age 5 to 2 and her children go to school. Each week, Muyinda makes approximately UGX 120000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save it for future needs Muyinda has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy more maize and the loan was paid back on time.

Muyinda is joined in her small group by Hadijja N., Robinah Kavuma and Sarah N.. Hadijja N. has a business in used clothing sales and wants to expand to bulk selling. Robinah Kavuma is currently operating a business in used clothing sales and wants a loan to increase cloth purchases. Sarah N. operates a business of milk selling and wants to buy a fridge.

loans.use: To boost and expand maize milling business

loans.name: Aklamanou Yao And Sedeka Koffi Group

texts.en:
Aklamanou Y. and Sedeka K. are 2 young men, 33 years old and 30 years old, respectively. Mr. Y. is married and the father of 3 children, 2 of whom are in primary school and the third of whom is in high school. Mr. K. is married and the father of 1 child. These 2 men created their business, which is a general store, in 2003. They hope that with their loans they will be able to buy 20 sacks of rice, 15 1-pound sacks of sugar, 25 cartons of milk, and 20 cartons of canned goods. This will permit them to increase the capacity of their store, to respond to the needs of their clients, and to use their profits to better the lives of their respective families. These young entrepreneurs’ store is located in Avetonou, a small village located about 120 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. This location shows their necessity to be close to Lomé in order to buy goods to resell in Avetonou. Aklamanou Y. and Sedeka K. are good clients, as they have already benefited from 1 loan and made payments regularly.

Aklamanou Y. et Sedeka K. sont deux jeunes hommes âgés de 33 ans et 30 ans respectivement. Le premier est marié et père de 3 enfants dont 2 sont à l’école primaire et le troisième au collège tandis que le second est marié et père de 1 enfant. Ces deux personnes ont créé leur propre entreprise depuis 2003 et sont spécialisées en alimentation générale. Ils souhaitent avec les fonds qui seront mis à leur disposition acheter 20 sacs de riz, 15 sacs de sucres en poudre, 25 cartons de laits et 20 cartons de boîtes de conserves. Ce qui leur permettra d’augmenter la capacité de leur boutique pour répondre aux besoins de la clientèle et par là dégager plus de profits pour améliorer les conditions de leur famille respective. La boutique de nos jeunes entrepreneurs est située à Avetonou, un petit village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. D’où l’alimentation de leur boutique nécessite un déplacement sur Lomé. Aklamanou Y. et Sedeka K. sont de bon client puisqu’ils ont déjà bénéficié d’un crédit et les remboursements ont été réguliers.

loans.use: To buy 20 sacks of rice, 15 1-pound sacks of sugar, 25 cartons of milk, and 20 cartons of canned goods

loans.name: Sharif

texts.ru:
Sharif Safarovich S. lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube in Tajikistan. He is 44 years old, married and has three children. He has a professional degree as a chef. Sharif has been managing a cafe at the central market of the city for the last 4 years. He is planning to use the loan money to purchase additional equipment for his cafe, so that he can improve the quality of service, expand his menu and increase his profits. New equipment will allow the patrons of the cafe to dine there more often as well. Sharif is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Салиев Шариф сафарович проживает в городе Курган-тюбе . Возраст 44 года , женат имеет 3 детей.Образование средне-специальное. По профессии повар. Имеет частную столовую на центральном рынке города. Занимается этим видом бизнеса около 4 лет. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы купить новое оборудование.Это необходимо для того чтобы улучшить качество обслуживания, увеличить меню , тем самым увеличивая свой доход. Кроме того, улучшение качества обслуживания даст возможность клиентам пользоваться данной столовой чаще.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of equipment

loans.name: Budumbuli West B (I) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Zayida N.. She is currently in the business of selling new clothes and is requesting a loan to increase her stock purchases. Zayida is 22 years old and married. She has 2 children aged 1.5 and 3, and one child goes to school. Each week, Zayida makes approximately UGX 280000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save. Zayida has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Zayida is joined in her small group by Mary K., Florence K. and Halima M.. Mary K. has a business selling clothes and wants to expand her business. Florence K. is currently operating a business selling new clothes and wants a loan to increase her purchases. Halima M. operates a welding business and wants to purchase welding materials.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Heyran

texts.en: Heyran (her father is pictured ) was born in 1968. She is single, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, settled in Fuzuli region Dilagarda village. She has raised sheep for 10 years. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy 20 sheep, to improve her profits and grow her business.

loans.use: To buy 20 sheep

loans.name: Assi

texts.en:
Assi A. is 36 years old and the married mother of 3 children, the oldest of whom is enrolled in primary school. With difficulty she supports the needs of her children and gives what is left to her husband, who is a night guard and cannot cover the expenses of his family. Mrs. A. sells peanuts, manioc flour (an underground plant that is indigenous to Togo), and sugar from a stall that she opened in Avetonou, a village located 120 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With her loan, Mrs. A. would like to buy 10 bags of peanuts, 5 sacks of powdered sugar, and 2 sacks of manioc flour. These purchases will permit her to increase her sales, earn more money, and respond to the needs of her children.

Assi A. est âgée de 36 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont la première sur les bancs de l’école primaire. Elle supporte difficilement les besoins de ses enfants étant donné que la rémunération de son mari qui est gardien de nuit n’arrive pas à couvrir les charges de la famille. Madame A. est revendeuse des arachides, de la farine du manioc (une plante à tubercule qui est indigène au Togo) et du sucre qu’elle installe sous une baraque à Avetonou, un village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle désire acheter avec ce crédit 10 bols d’arachides, 5 sacs de sucres en poudre et 2 sacs de farines de maniocs. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses ventes, gagner plus et répondre aux besoins de ses enfants.

loans.use: To buy 10 bags of peanuts, 5 sacks of powdered sugar, and 2 sacks of manioc flour

loans.name: Mahmadisso

texts.ru:
Mahmadisso G. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi. He is 43 years old, married and has three children. Mahmadisso has a high school degree. For the last 9 years he has been raising cattle for meat sales. He purchases calves at the market, feeds the animals for 40-45 days to fatten them up then sells at the same market for a higher price.This business is the sole source of income for the family and expanding his business will allow Mahmadisso to increase his profits and improve the living conditions of his family. Mahmadisso's business also provides the local market with a source of fresh meat. Mahmadisso is planning to use the loan money to purchase several young bulls and he is hoping to pay back the money in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Гуломов Махмадиссо Чайдарович проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 43 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается животноводством. Разводит крупно-рогатый скот для перепродажи их на мясо . Покупает товар на рынке района, откармливает около 40-45 дней , а затем перепродает по более выгодной цене. Занимается этим видом бизнеса клиент уже 9 лет. Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода его семьи, поэтому развитие его бизнеса поможет ему увеличить доходы , тем самым улучшив условия жизни. Кроме того развитие данного сектора позволяет обеспечивать рынки свежим мясом. Клиент хочет получить кредит для того чтобы закупить молодых бычков. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Budumbuli West B (Ii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Fatuma N.. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to increase her stock purchases. Fatuma is 48 years old and is married with a husband who is a driver for work. She has 5 children ranging from ages 10 to 30 and her children go to school. Each week, Fatuma makes approximately UGX 210000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children and to cater for her household needs. Fatuma has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to put capital into her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Fatuma is joined in her small group by Aidah N., Rose B. and Mariam K.. Aidah N. has a business in poultry farming and selling charcoal and wants to purchase more broiler chicks and charcoal. Rose B. is currently operating a business in education and wants a loan to invest in her school. Mariam K. operates a business selling used clothes and wants to add more stock.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Assiki

texts.en:
Mrs. A. is 45 years old, married, and the mother of 7 children. From the revenue of her business, she is in charge of incurring all expenses for her children. She is a seller of smoked fish in the market of Avetonou, a small village situated about 120 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Assiki A. has been in this business sector for 6 years. She wishes to use this loan to buy 10 cartons of fish and to bring her youngest daughter on board in the family business. With the help of her daughter, she will be better able to respond to the needs of her clientele, which never ceases to increase due to the fact that fish are consumed by all of the local population. She will use her profits to better the conditions of her large family. Mrs. A. has already benefited from 1 loan, which she paid back promptly and regularly.

Madame A. est âgée de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Par les revenus de son activité elle participe aux charges du foyer. Elle est revendeuse de poissons fumés dans le marché d'Avetonou, un village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Assiki A. tient ce secteur d’activité depuis 6 ans. Elle désire par ce crédit acheter 10 cartons de poissons et engager une petite fille pour l’aider dans ses tâches. Ce qui lui permettra de répondre plus aux besoins de la clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter puisque les poissons sont consommés par toute la population locale et aussi améliorer les conditions de sa famille pour les profits issus de ses ventes. A. avait bénéficié d’un crédit et les remboursements ont été promptement faits.

loans.use: To buy 10 cartons of fish and to bring her youngest daughter on board in the family business

loans.name: Tavarali

texts.ru:
Tavarali S. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi. He is 48 years old, married and has eight children. Tavarali has a high school degree. For the last 15 years he has been raising cattle for meat sales. He purchases calves at the market, feeds the animals for 40-45 days to fatten them up then sells at the same market for a higher price.This business is the sole source of income for the family and expanding his business will allow Tavarali to increase his profits and improve the living conditions of his family. Tavarali's business also provides the local market with a source of fresh meat. Tavarali is planning to use the loan money to purchase several young bulls and he is hoping to pay back the money in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Шомахмадов Таварали Сафаралиевич проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 48 лет. Женат, имеет 8 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается животноводством. Разводит крупно-рогатый скот для перепродажи их на мясо . Покупает товар на рынке района, откармливает около 40-45 дней , а затем перепродает по более выгодной цене. Занимается этим видом бизнеса клиент уже 15 лет. Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода его семьи, поэтому развитие его бизнеса поможет ему увеличить доходы , тем самым улучшив условия жизни. Кроме того развитие данного сектора позволяет обеспечивать рынки свежим мясом. Клиент хочет получить кредит для того чтобы закупить молодых бычков. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Hikmatullo

texts.ru:
Hikmatullo Abdulloev H. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region of Tajikistan. He is 25 years old, married and has four children. Hikmatullo has a high school degree. For the last 6 years he has been raising cattle for meat sale at the market. He purchases animals at the local market, fattens them for 40-45 days and sells the animals at a higher price. This business is the sole source of income for the family and developing and expanding his business will allow Hikmatullo to increase his income and better the living conditions for the whole family. This business also provides local market with a source of fresh meat. Hikmatullo is planning to use the credit to purchase additional calves for his herd. He is hoping to pay back the credit in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Халимов Хикматулло Абдуллоев проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми.Возраст 25 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается животноводством. Разводит крупно-рогатый скот для перепродажи их на мясо. Покупает товар на рынке района, откармливает около 40-45 дней , а затем перепродает по более выгодной цене. Занимается этим видом бизнеса клиент уже 6 года. Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода его семьи, поэтому развитие его бизнеса поможет ему увеличить доходы тем самым улучшив условия жизни. Кроме того развитие данного сектора позволяет обеспечивать рынки свежим мясом. Клиент хочет получить кредит для того чтобы закупить молодых бычков. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12месяцев

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Azama

texts.en:
Mr. Azama K. is 28 years old, married, and the father of 1 child. He has been selling cement since 2004. His store is located in the central market of Aventonou, a small village located about 120 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Mr. Azama hopes to use his loan to buy 10 tons of cement to satisfy the needs of his clientele, which is increasing, as the popularity of the market in Aventonou brings more tourists and therefore more vendors to the small village. His sales of new concrete will allow him to increase his profits and to take care of his family. Mr. Azama is a good client, as he paid back his previous loan regularly and on time.

Monsieur Azama K. est âgé de 28 ans, marié et père d’un enfant. Il est revendeur de ciment depuis 2004. Son magasin est situé au grand marché d'Avetonou, un village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Monsieur Azama souhaite, avec ce crédit, acheter 10 tonnes de ciments pour satisfaire aux besoins de la clientèle étant donné que ce village est une zone touristique qui attire plusieurs personnes à y construire d’où la demande très forte en ciments. Ces ventes lui permettront d’augmenter ses profits et de subvenir décemment aux charges de sa famille. Monsieur Azama est un bon client puisqu’il a pu remboursé à temps l’emprunt qu’il a contracté.

loans.use: To buy 10 tons of cement

loans.name: Shukurov

texts.ru:
D. Tagaibaevich Shukurov lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 22 years old and is married. He has a secondary education. He is involved in animal husbandry. He raises cattle and then sells them. He buys young calves at the regional market, feeds then for 40-45 days and then resells them at more profitable price. He has been in this business for 3 years and it is the main source of income for his family. The development of his business allows him to provide local markets with fresh meat. D. wants to use his loan to purchase calves. He plans to repay his loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Шукуров Дустмурод Тагайбаевич проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми.Возраст 22 года. Женат, детей не имеет. Образование среднее. Занимается животноводством. Разводит крупно-рогатый скот для перепродажи их на мясо. Покупает товар на рынке района, откармливает около 40-45 дней , а затем перепродает по более выгодной цене. Занимается этим видом бизнеса клиент уже 3 года. Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода его семьи. Кроме того развитие данного сектора позволяет обеспечивать рынки свежим мясом. Клиент хочет получить кредит для того чтобы закупить молодых бычков. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Couture Makafui Group

texts.en:
Makafui is a traditional Togolese word for "glorification of God" and is the name that 2 young women, Sossa E., 27, and Atodogla A., 29, decided to name their garment-making company. They are both married and are the mothers of 2 and 3 children, respectively. Both women have been in the sewing and garment-making business for 3 years and are recognized among the best in their trade in the region. The young womens’ shop is located in Aventonou, a small village about 120 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With their loan, Sossa and Atodogla hope to buy 3 sewing machines and also to buy more fabrics to sell to their customers. These purchases will permit them to work more in order to earn more money to better their living conditions.

La Couture Makafui est créée par deux jeunes filles appelées Sossa E. et Atodogla A.. Elles sont âgées de 27 ans et 29 ans respectivement. Les deux sont mariées et ont respectivement 2 et 3 enfants. Sossa et Atodogla opère dans la couture depuis plus de 3 ans et sont comptées parmi les couturières les plus dévouées du milieu. L’atelier de nos jeunes femmes est situé à Avetonou, un petit village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elles souhaitent avec ce crédit acheter 3 machines à coudre et aussi des tissus afin de les revendre aux clients. Ceci leur permettra de travailler plus et par là gagner plus afin d’améliorer leurs conditions de vie.

loans.use: To buy 3 sewing machines and also to buy more fabrics to sell to their customers

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru:
Dilshod T. lives in the Rudaki region. He is 29, is married and has two children. Dilshod has a higher education and is trained as an economist. Dilshod runs a business that produces flax oil. He purchases flax grain, processes it in a vat and then sells the oil wholesale. Flax oil is a popular product so Dilshod’s business is profitable and at the same time, his business provides people with this popular product. Dilshod has been in this business for 6 years. He plans to use his loan to stock up with flax grain, since the prices are rising, as the supply of flax is limited. He needs to purchase enough flax grain until the next flax harvest so his business can run non-stop. Dilshod is planning to repay his loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Таваралиев Дильшод проживает в районе Рудаки. Женат, возраст 29 лет. Имеет двоих детей. Образование высшее. По специальности экономист. Занимается частным предпринимательством в сфере производства льняного масла. Закупает сырье в виде зерен льна ,перерабатывает на своей маслобойке и полученное масло сдает оптовым покуптелям. Льняное масло пользуется большим спросом у населения , поэтому его бизнес имеет неплохой доход, а также позволяет обеспечить население данным видом продукции.Занимается этим бизнесом клиент уже около 6 лет. Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы запастись сырьем, так как цены на зерна растут в связи с тем . что запасы льна закакнчиваются . И необходимо до нового урожая запастись зерном иобеспечить свой бизнес бесперебойным выпуском продукции. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy flax

loans.name: Nuru's Faith Group

texts.en:
Nuru A. is a 28-year-old married woman living in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. To her support her children, ages 3, 7, and 10, Nuru works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day selling food at a local stall. Each month, she earns about $50 in profit.

Nuru hopes to expand her business, which is why she's applied for a group loan of $400 U.S. dollars. Nuru completely trusts her two other loan partners, Ester E. and Fatuma F.. Both of these women have their own businesses, selling supplies and cloth.

loans.use: To buy more food and supplies for a vending business

loans.name: Isabela's Faith Group

texts.en:
Isabela C. is a 26-year-old woman living in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. In addition to herself, Isabela cares for two other people, ages 23 and 14. To support her houshold, she works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day selling food. Isabela earns about $90 in profit every month.

Isabela hopes to grow her business, which is why she's applied for a group loan of $275 U.S. dollars. Her loan partner is Assumpta T., who has a business selling arts and crafts. Both women are extremely responsible and determined, and Isabela is confident that they will be able to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for food vending stall

loans.name: Nazar

texts.ru:
Nazar B. lives in the Khuroson region. He is married and has 4 children. He is 48 years old and has a secondary education. Nazar grows wheat, flax and other crops. He also grows vegetables. After harvesting his crops, he sells them at different Huronos’s markets as well as to customers from other regions wholesale. He keeps a portion of the produce for his family to use during the year. His business helps to provide local people with weat and flour since bread is the most popular product among population. Nazar has been in this business for 3 years. Nazar plans to use his loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer as well as rent a tractor and to pay for fuel. He plans to repay his loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Боймуродов Назар житель Хуросонского района. Женат , имеет 4 детей. Возраст 48 лет . образование среднее.Занимается земледелием по посеву пшеницы , льна и других злаковых кльтур. Кроме того имеет огород с другими видами овощей.После того как он получит урожай он реализует его на рынках Хуросона , а также оптовым покупателям из других регионов области , конечно частьпродукции клиент оставляет своей семье с запасом на один год. Это помогает обеспечить население пшеницей и мукой . так как хлеб пользуется большим спросом у нашего населения. Занимается этим видом деятельности клиент около 3 лет. Боймуродов Назар планирует получить кредит для того ,чтобы закупить семена , удобрения , а так же частично для топлива и аренды трактора.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase  seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel 27 is married and has two girls and a boy. His wife and children grow tomatoes, beans, potatoes, and cassava on their family land, and he takes the produce to the market in Natete. In addition, he has a barbershop, two motorcycles for commercial use, and a farm supply shop at Kasaamu in Kasanje. He would use the loan to buy pesticides for his farm supply shop and to hire some farm workers. His dream is to buy a car for  transporting the farm produce to market.

loans.use: Emmanuel plans to pesticides for his farm supply shop and hire workers for his farm.

loans.name: Mon Destin Group

texts.en:
Mon Destin, or My Destiny, was created by 4 people, 3 men and 1 woman. Their names are Akama K., Segbenya E., Gomado K., and Setsoafia K., and they are aged 40, 37, 33, and 29, respectively. The first has 5 children, the second has 3, and the last 2 members of the group each have 2 children. They have operated a general store for the past 4 years and have significantly increased their operations in 2007. Their store is located in Avetonou, a small village located about 120 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. They hope to use this loan to buy 20 bags of rice, 25 bags of powdered sugar, 10 cartons of sugar cubes, 15 cartons of milk, 10 cartons of soap, and 25 cartons of canned goods to respond to the needs of their customers. These purchases will allow them to reap the benefits of their growth and to better the lives of their families. This group has already successfully received 2 loans and paid them back promptly.

L’établissement mon destin est créé par un groupe de quatre personnes dont trois hommes et une femme qui sont Akama K., Segbenya E., Gomado K. et Setsoafia K.. Tous ils sont âgés de 40 ans, 37 ans, 33 ans et 29 ans respectivement. Le premier a 5 enfants, le second 3 et les deux derniers 2 enfants chacun. Ils opèrent dans le secteur d’alimentation générale depuis plus de 4 ans et ont considérablement augmenter leur chiffres d’affaires au cours de l’année 2007. Leur commerce est situé au grand marché de Avetonou, un petit village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Ils souhaitent avec les fonds dont ils bénéficieront augmenter la capacité de leur boutique en achetant 20 sacs de riz, 25 sacs de sucres en poudre, 10 cartons de sucre en morceau, 15 cartons de laits, 20 cartons de savons et 25 cartons de boîtes de conserves afin de répondre aux besoins de leur clientèle. Ceci leur permettra de dégager beaucoup plus de bénéfices et améliorer les conditions de vie de leur famille respective. Ce groupe a déjà bénéficier de 2 crédits et sont bien remboursés.

loans.use: To buy 20 bags of rice, 25 bags of powdered sugar, 10 cartons of sugar cubes, 15 cartons of milk, 10 cartons of soap, and 25 cartons of canned goods

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 35 years old. He is married and has three children. Two of them are studying in school. His younger son has asthma. He has a shop fixing cars. He applied to borrow $1200 to purchase new spare parts and paint for the cars. He wants to renovate the shop and expand his project, develop his business, and improve his income .

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new spare parts

loans.name: Rukia's Faith Group

texts.en:
Although Rukia A. is only 19 years old, she already shoulders plenty of responsibility. She and her husband are responsible for caring for a 63-year-old family member. To help support her family, Rukia works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day selling food at a local store in her city of Dar es Salaam, Tanzania.

Rukia hopes to buy a freezer and more supplies for her business, which is why she's applied for a group loan of $275 U.S. dollars. Her loan partner is Zaina I., who earns a living by selling pillows. Zaina also wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy a freezer for a food vending business

loans.name: Agnes's Faith Group

texts.en:
Agnes M. is a 29-year-old single mother of one living in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She makes a living by running a food vending store, earning about $80 a month in profit.

Agnes hopes to expand her business so she can provide a better life for her nine-year-old child. That's why she has applied for a group loan of $400 along a woman she trusts, Hadija A.. Hadija earns a living by selling cloth and soap. Both women are extremely dedicated, so Agnes is certain they will be able to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy more food and supplies for a food vending store

loans.name: Editra's Faith Group

texts.en:
Editra is a 30-year-old single mother of one living in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. From 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day, Editra sells decorations to support her 12-year-old child. She earns about $50 a month.

Editra hopes to expand her business so that they can lead a better life. That's why she has applied for a group loan of $575 U.S. dollars with two other women she truly trusts, Hawa S. and Fatuma N.. These women have their own business, selling cloth and soap. Because all three are determined and dedicated, Editra is certain that they will be able to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for a decorations store

loans.name: Afoume

texts.en:
Mrs. Afoume S. is 32 years old, is married, and has 3 children. She uses the profits from her sales to help pay for the expenses of her children. Mrs. S. has been selling shoes for about 4 years and hopes to use this loan to buy 10 cartons of shoes to respond to her customers' demands. She hopes to use the profits from her sales to participate further in covering the expenses of her children. Mrs. S.’s boutique is located in a small village about 120 kilometers from Lomé, called Aventonou.

Madame Afoume S. est âgée de 32 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle participe aux dépenses du foyer par les profits qu’elle réalise sur ses ventes. Elle est revendeuses de chaussures depuis plus de 4 ans. Madame S. désire par ce crédit acheter 10 cartons de chaussures pour répondre aux exigences de ses clients et de satisfaire et de participer plus à la prise en charge des charges familiales. La boutique de Madame S. est située dans un petit village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise, appelé Avetonou.

loans.use: To buy 10 cartons of shoes

loans.name: Husnath's Busara Group

texts.en:
Husnath K. is a 30-year-old married mother of two children, ages 10 and 7. To help support her family, Husnath runs a catering business in her town of Dar es Salaam, Tanzania, earning about $50 a month.

Husnanth hopes to expand her business, so she has applied for a group loan of $400 U.S. dollars. The other two women in her group, Ester A. and Christina M., both sell decorations. All of these women are extremely dedicated and hard-working, and are sure they will be able to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy food and supplies for a small catering business

loans.name: Atsan

texts.en:
Mrs. Atsan A. is 39 years old, married, and the mother of 6 children. Four of her children are enrolled in school, and the others are training to be hairdressers. With difficulty, she tries to meet the needs of her family because her husband is a farmer and cannot support them all due to the rarity of cultivatable land and the dependence on the weather. Atsan has owned a general store for the past 3 years. She hopes to use her loan to buy 10 bags of rice, 15 cartons of milk, 10 cartons of soap, 5 bottles of oil, and 10 cartons of canned goods. With these sales she hopes to pay for the school fees for her children and to better all of their lives. Her store is located in a village located around 120 kilometers from the capital, and she travels there often to stock up on goods. This is Atsan’s second loan, as the first was well paid and increased her credit so that she could apply for another.

Madame Atsan A. est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont 4 sont à l’école et le reste dans un centre de formation de coiffure. Elle subvient difficilement aux besoins sa famille puisque son mari étant cultivateur n’arrive pas à supporter les charges de la famille à cause de la rareté des terres cultivables et aussi la précarité des sols. Atsan opère dans le secteur d’alimentation générale depuis 3 ans. Elle souhaite par ce crédit acheter 10 sacs de riz, 15 cartons de laits, 10 cartons de savons, 5 bidons d’huiles et 10 cartons de boîtes de conserves. Avec ses ventes elle pense mieux supporter les charges scolaires et de formation de ses enfants et améliorer aussi les conditions de vie de sa famille. Son commerce se trouve dans un village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise et ses ravitaillements se faits par déplacement dans la capitale. Elle est à son deuxième crédit puisque le premier a été bien remboursé et elle a affecté le crédit à l’activité pour laquelle la demande était faite.

loans.use: To buy 10 bags of rice, 15 cartons of milk, 10 cartons of soap, 5 bottles of oil, and 10 cartons of canned goods

loans.name: Rebecca's Imani Group

texts.en:
Rebecca C. is a 49-year-old mother living in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She and her husband care for their four children, who range in age from 12 to 18, as well as two of their elders, who are 70 and 68 years old. To help support their family, Rebecca has sold cloth for the past five years, earning about $50 a month in profit.

Rebecca hopes to buy more fabric so she can expand her business. That's why she has applied for a group loan of $400 U.S. dollars along with two other women that she trusts. Teddy B. and Catherine F. have their own businesses, selling clothing and other essentials.

loans.use: To buy more fabric for a cloth-selling business

loans.name: Budumbuli West B (Iii) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Fatuma N.. She sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to increase her inventory. Fatuma is 48 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has five children ranging from age 10 to 30 and her children go to school. Each week, Fatuma makes approximately UGX 210000 in profits and with the extra capital from her loan, she hopes to pay the children's school fees and cover her home needs. Fatuma took a UGX 250000 loan from BRAC Uganda before to add capital to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Fatuma is joined in her small group by Aidah N., Rose B., and Mariam K.. Aidah is a poultry farmer and sells charcoal and wants to purchase more broiler chicks and charcoal. Rose operates a business in education and wants a loan to invest in her school. Mariam sells used clothes and wants to add to her stock.

loans.use: Fatuma would add more capital to her charcoal business with her part of this group loan

loans.name: Budumbuli West B (Iv) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Fisita A.. She is currently in the business of selling local brew and is requesting a loan to add to the business. Fisita is 42 years old and is married with a husband who is a mechanic for work. She has 4 children ranging from ages 7 to 22 and her children go to school. Each week, Fisita makes approximately UGX 210000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to cater for her household's needs and save the rest. Fisita has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to use it in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Fisita is joined in her small group by Grace N., Rose A., Joyce M., and Christine O.. Grace N. has a business selling local brew and wants to boost her business. Rose A. is currently operating a local brewery business and wants a loan to buy more ingredients. Joyce M. operates a business selling local brew and wants to add stock. Christine O. is currently in the business of operating a local brewery and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To boost and expand brewery business

loans.name: Rafia's Tupendane Group

texts.en: Rafia  S. is a 25-year-old single mother of one She makes a living by selling cloth, earning about $80 a month in profit. She hopes to expand her business by purchasing more fabric to sell. Rafia would put the additional profits to basic living expenses, including food and clothes for her three-year-old child. That's why she has applied for a group loan of $400 U.S. dollars with two other women she trusts. The other women have business in clothing and soap sales.

loans.use: To buy more fabric for a cloth-selling business

loans.name: Budumbuli West B (V) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Grace K.. She is currently in the business of operating a public pay phone and selling crafts and is requesting a loan to buy more air time cards. Grace is 40 years old and is a widow. She has 2 children aged 14 and 20, and both of her children go to school. Each week, Grace makes approximately UGX 210000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to cater for her household's needs. Grace has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy a phone and the loan was paid back on time.

Grace is joined in her small group by Juliet S. and Justine M.. Juliet S. has a business running a drug shop and wants to purchase more drugs to sell. Justine M. is currently operating a business selling shoes and wants a loan to start selling scrap.

loans.use: To re-invest in public phone business and expand it

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Budumbuli West B (Vi) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Jane N.. She currently has a local brewery business and is requesting a loan to purchase more brewing ingredients. Jane is 40 years old and married with a husband who is an engineer for work. She has 6 children ranging from ages 5 to 21 and her children go to school. Each week, Jane makes approximately UGX 130000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save for future use. Jane has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Jane is joined in her small group by Joyce N., Mary M., and Maxensiya S.. Joyce N. has a business running a grocery store and wants to add more stock. Mary M. is currently operating a grocery store business and wants a loan to change to a business selling charcoal. Maxensiya S. operates a business selling charcoal and wants to open up another charcoal store.

loans.use: To add capital to local brewery business

loans.name: Budumbuli West B (Vii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Hanifah N.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add more stock. Hanifah is 29 years old and married. She has 3 children ranging from ages 9 to 12 and her children go to school. Each week, Hanifah makes approximately UGX 140000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to add to her business. Hanifah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Hanifah is joined in her small group by Mary K. and Sophia A.. Mary K. has a business selling clothes and spare parts and wants to add capital. Sophia A. is currently operating a kiosk business and wants a loan to buy more stock.

loans.use: To purchase more shop items

loans.name: Rahma's Raia Mwema Group

texts.en:
Rahma is 44 years old and is a married woman with 5 children, ages 25, 23, 21, 19 and 17 years old. Rahma is a cloth seller. She started her business in 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $78 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more cloth for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in tailoring, food vending, tatique sales, and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her business.

loans.name: Budumuli East F A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Immaculate A.. She is currently in the business of tailoring and selling bitengi clothes and is requesting a loan to purchase a sewing machine. Immaculate is 36 years old and is married with a husband who is a businessman for work. She has 3 children ranging from ages 3 to 14 and her children go to school. Each week, Immaculate makes approximately UGX 90000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save for future use. Immaculate has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 150000 in order to buy stock and the loan was paid back on time.

Immaculate is joined in her small group by Hanifah M. and Ruth N.. Hanifah M. has a business running a restaurant and wants to add equipment and start another restaurant. Ruth N. is currently operating a business selling used clothes and wants a loan to purchase more clothes.

loans.use: To expand tailoring business

loans.name: Budumuli East D(I) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Christine N.. She is currently in the business of running a grocery shop and is requesting a loan to add more stock. Christine is 35 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging from ages 7 to 17 and her children go to school. Each week, Christine makes approximately UGX 90000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children and save for future use. Christine has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add capital to the business and the loan was paid back on time.

Christine is joined in her small group by Rehema N. and Suzan N.. Rehema N. has a business selling clothes and wants to boost her business. Suzan N. is currently operating a business selling fish and wants a loan to increase the stock of fish.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and add to her shop

loans.name: Asha's Raia Mwema Group

texts.en:
Aisha I. is mother of nine living in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. For the past eight years, she has sold spices and vegetables to support her family. She works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day, earning about $90 a month.

To expand her business, Aisha has requested a group loan of $650 U.S. dollars with four other women. The other women sell vegetables, fish, and charcoal. Because Aisha is extremely hard-working, she is confident that she can repay back the loan.

loans.use: To buy produce and spices for a small business

loans.name: Budumuli East D(Ii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Zamu N.. She is currently in the business of selling beer and is requesting a loan to purchase a fridge. Zamu is 45 years old and is a widow. She has 5 children ranging from age 10 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Zamu makes approximately UGX 70000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children and save it for future use. Zamu has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add in business and the loan was paid back on time.

Zamu is joined in her small group by Esther N., Sarah T., Doreen Nakigudde, and . Esther N. has a business in charcoal selling and wants to purchase more sacks of charcoal. Sarah T. is currently operating a business in selling local brew and wants a loan to expand business. Doreen Nakigudde operates a business of retail shop and wants to add in stock and buy a popcorn machine.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge and more beers

loans.name: Lake H A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Hawa N.. She is currently in the business of running a grocery store and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Hawa is 42 years old and single. She has 6 children ranging from age 1 to 20 and most of her children go to school. Each week, Hawa makes approximately UGX 21000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business and repay the loan. Hawa has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to purchase more goods and the loan was paid back on time.

Hawa is joined in her small group by Jalia B. and Jaria M.. Jalia B. has a business running a clinic and wants to add more equipment like beds, furniture and mattresses. Jaria M. is currently operating a business in used clothing sales and wants a loan to improve her stall.

loans.use: To add more working capital to grocery business

loans.name: Lake H B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rebecca N.. She is currently in the business of selling used clothes and is requesting a loan to boost her business. Rebecca is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a soldier. She has 5 children ranging from age 2 to 12 and most of her children go to school. Each week, Rebecca makes approximately UGX 70000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to cater for her household's needs and repay the loan. Rebecca has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to expand her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Rebecca is joined in her small group by Mutunda K. and Jane M.. Mutunda K. has a business selling used clothes and wants to increase her purchases. Jane M. is currently operating a business trading produce and wants a loan to purchase more rice.

loans.use: To add to business selling clothes and increase stock

loans.name: Mary's Sisikwasisi Group

texts.en:
Mary J. is a 30-year-old mother of three in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. In addition to her own children, Mary and her husband also care for three other children. To support her family, Mary has run a small food stand for the past three years. Every day, she works from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m., and earns about $190 in profit a month.

To grow her business, Mary has requested a group loan of $325. Mary's partner is Haki G., who wants to expand her cloth and soap stand.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for a small food stand

loans.name: Lake H C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Pheobe M.. She is currently in the business of running a bar and is requesting a loan to purchase a fridge. Pheobe is 45 years old and is a widow. She has 5 children ranging from ages 13 to 30 and only three of her children go to school. Each week, Pheobe makes approximately UGX 21000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children and repay the loan. Pheobe has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to purchase a fridge and the loan was paid back on time.

Pheobe is joined in her small group by Muninah T., Zirifar N., and Rehema N.. Muninah T. has a business running a grocery and wants to rent land and venture into agriculture. Zirifar N. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to add more items. Rehema N. operates a business selling new shoes and wants to purchase more shoes.

loans.use: To add more equipment to the bar

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Lake H D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Ziriat K.. She is currently in the business of poultry farming and is requesting a loan to purchase local poultry. Ziriat is 50 years old and is a widow. She has 6 children ranging from age16 to 30. Each week, Ziriat makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to add to her business and repay the loan. Ziriat has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to buy more poultry and the loan was paid back on time.

Ziriat is joined in her small group by Irene N., Edisa M., and Jesca M.. Irene N. has a business selling used clothes and wants to increase her purchases. Edisa M. is currently operating a business selling fish and wants a loan to purchase more fish. Jesca M. operates a business selling shoes and wants to expand the business.

loans.use: To add to local poultry business

loans.name: Lake J A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Betty M.. She is currently in the business of poultry rearing and is requesting a loan to improve her poultry house and purchase more poultry. Betty is 48 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging from ages 18 to 28 and her children go to school. Each week, Betty makes approximately UGX 200000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase poultry feed. Betty has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to add to her poultry business and the loan was paid back on time.

Betty is joined in her small group by Harriet N. and Kevin N.. Harriet N. has a business selling used clothes and wants to change his business to sell new clothes. Kevin N. is currently operating a restaurant business and wants a loan to purchase a fridge.

loans.use: To increase poultry inventory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Lake J B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Ruth N.. She is currently in the business of selling new clothes and is requesting a loan to build another stall. Ruth is 40 years old and is married. She has 5 children ranging from ages 8 to 25 and her children go to school. Each week, Ruth makes approximately UGX 140000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save for future problems and repay the loan. Ruth has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy more cattle and the loan was paid back on time.

Ruth is joined in her small group by Zabina N., Lydia N., and Mwasiti N.. Zabina N. has a business selling clothes and wants to get a personal stall. Lydia N. is currently operating a business in clothing sales and wants a loan to change to a poultry business. Mwasiti N. operates a business selling charcoal and wants to expand to wholesale.

loans.use: To expand clothing sales business

loans.name: Lake J C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Hadija M.. She is currently in the business of selling new shoes and clothes and is requesting a loan to increase her capital stock. Hadija is 35 years old and is married with a husband who is a mechanic for work. She has 4 children ranging from ages 11 to 17 and her children go to school. Each week, Hadija makes approximately UGX 420000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a house. Hadija has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 350000 in order to expand her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Hadija is joined in her small group by Juliet M., Sylvia W. and Nandudu S.. Juliet M. has a business selling used clothes and wants to purchase more clothes. Sylvia W. is currently operating a business selling clothes and wants a loan to put up another stall. Nandudu S. operates a business selling fish and wants to add more stock.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is an enterprising business owner from Pavlograd, Ukraine. She has an attractively arranged women’s clothing store situated at the Ulana “rhinok,” or market, in Pavlograd. Margarita has been in business for five years. Loans she has received through Nadiya Ukraine have been instrumental in the success of her business. Margarita is married and has two children, a son and daughter. Her son is currently finishing college.

Margarita has requested a loan of $1000 to purchase a selection of jackets for the upcoming spring season. She hopes to continue making a good profit and earn additional income for her family.

loans.use: Purchase 20 spring jackets

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Maricela lives on the Panamerican avenue in the Mariscal Sucre zone of the city of El Alto.

She lives with her two children, 10 and 6 years old, and with her husband who works as a taxi driver.

She sells food from a small restaurant located in her home.

She would use her loan to buy ingredients at wholesale prices, in that manner reducing her expenses and purchase her supplies at better prices. Her hopes are to avoid the inflationary trends in the country.

This is her first loan with IMPRO, and the financial analysis conducted shows she qualifies for credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Marcela vive en la avenida Panamerican de la zona Mariscal Sucre ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a sus dos hijos de 10 y 6 años respectivamente y su esposo trabaja como chofer de taxi . Ella vende comida en una pensión que se encuentra ubicada en su domicilio. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de ingredientes al por mayor, y así reducir sus gastos y abastecerse comprando a buenos precios, tratando de evitar el proceso inflacionario que vive el país. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase supplies at wholesale for restaurant.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Two years ago, Tatyana, who is widowed, decided to start her own sales business to support her daughter and herself. She chose to sell items that she thought would be in good demand. Today her business is profitable and doing well. Tatyana sells a variety of household linens such as dish towels, bath towels, and bedding supplies. She has a sales kiosk at the “Kolos” market in the central Ukrainian city of Nikolaev. Tatyana is a wonderful business woman. She is honest, responsible, and kind, and she works hard to support herself and her daughter.

Tatyana has requested a loan to add to her working capital and help purchase some additional inventory to sell in her kiosk. With the warm springtime weather coming, many shoppers will be out looking to buy. This loan will help Tatyana obtain necessary inventory to meet customer demand and make a good profit.

loans.use: Increase working capital and purchase inventory

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana lives on Tocopilla avenue, in the Pasankeri zone located in the city of La Paz.

She lives with her two children, and her husband works in the interior of the country.

She dedicates herself to clothing sales. She would use her loan to purchase merchandise – sweaters, blouses, jeans, etc., in order to increase her sales.

It is the third loan with IMPRO, and the financial evaluation done indicates that she qualifies for a loan. She has been an IMPRO client since April of 2007, and her previous loans have been repaid in whole and under agreed-upon terms.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Juana vive en la avenida Tocopilla de la zona Pasankeri ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz. Vive junto a su dos hijo de 16 años , su esposo trabaja en el interior del país. Ella se dedica al comercio de ropa, cuyas ventas son en el interior del país. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de mercaderías – chompas, blusas, jeans, etc., y así aumentar sus ventas. Es el tercer crédito con Impro; la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo. Es cliente de IMPRO desde Abril de 2007 y los anteriores dos créditos han sido cancelados en su totalidad y de acuerdo a los planes de pago establecidos.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing for her business.

loans.name: Lorencia

texts.es:
Lorencia lives on Juan Pablo II avenue located in the Ferropetrol zone of El Alto.

She lives with her two children, ages 26 and 10, and her husband works in the interior of the country.

She works selling blankets made of alpaca, a wool of excellent quality and known worldwide.

The loan would be for the purchase of alpaca wool in order to be able to increase her production of blankets.

It is the first loan with IMPRO, and the financial evaluation conducted indicates she qualifies to receive the loan. The loan falls under our Fomento program’s commercial sector.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Lorencia vive en la avenida Juan Pablo II de la zona Ferropetrol ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a sus dos hijos de 26 y 10 años respectivamente, su esposo trabaja en el interior del país. Trabaja en la venta de mantas de alpaca, cuya lana es de excelente calidad y reconocida mundialmente. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de lana de alpaca para incrementar su producción de mantas. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo. Este crédito cae en nuestro programa de Fomento, sector Comercio.

loans.use: Purchase of alpaca wool for production of blankets.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha lives on Pucara Grande street, in the Juana Azurduv de Padilla zone of the city of El Alto.

Since her husband abandoned them, she lives alone with her two children aged 15 and 10. This is a very common situation within the poorer segment of Bolivia’s population.

Martha works selling food from a location she rents in the city of El Alto, thus providing the only means of sustenance for her and her children.

The loan would be used to buy ingredients at wholesale, helping her to reduce her daily expenses.

It is the first loan with IMPRO, and the financial evaluation conducted indicates that she qualifies for the loan. Also, we think that this type of person is who we should help given she has no other choice but to work to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha vive en la calle Pucara Grande de la zona Juana Azurduy de Padilla ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. Vive solo junto a sus dos hijos de 15 y 10 años respectivamente, ya que su esposo hizo abandono del hogar. Esta es una situación muy común entre este segmento de la gente pobre en Bolivia. Martha trabaja en la venta de comida en un local que alquila en la ciudad de El Alto, constituyéndose esta actividad en su única fuente de ingresos para sostener sus hijos y a ella misma. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de ingredientes por mayor, ya que esto reduciría sus gastos en compras diarias. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo, además de que pensamos que este tipo de cliente es aquel al que deberíamos ayudar, porque no tiene otra alternativa que trabajar para sostener a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase supplies/ingredients at wholesale for her small restaurant.

loans.name: Ariel

texts.es:
Ariel lives in the Rio Seco zone of the city of El Alto. Ariel is 20 years old, and just completed secondary school.

He lives with his mother, who he helps with the needs of the business given she is a merchant. Ariel receives Bs. 600 monthly from his father, who lives overseas.

The loan would be utilized for legalizing his bachelor’s degree to be ready to enroll in the university.

It is the first loan with IMPRO, and the financial evaluation indicates he qualifies for the credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Ariel vive en el Manzano N, patio 10 de la zona Rio Seco, ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. Ariel tiene 20 años de edad y acaba de terminar la Secundaria. Vive junto a su madre a la cual ayuda en los quehaceres del negocio, ya que ella es comerciante. Ariel recibe una mensualidad de Bs. 600 de parte de su padre, quien vive en el exterior. El crédito lo destinara en el trámite para la legalización de su titulo de bachiller y así estar listo para ingresar a la Universidad. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Pay the cost for legalizing bachelor's degree (finished high school).

loans.name: Block A 2024-2 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Christine B.. She is currently in the business of selling groceries and is asking for a loan to build rental housing and expand her business. Christine is 45 years old. Her husband is an agricultural worker. She has 8 children ranging in age from 10 to 29. She believes in providing an education for her children. Christine makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profits weekly.

Christine is joined in her small group by Jackline K., Elizerbert N., Robina A., and Cicilia K.. Jackline K. sells beer and wants to expand her small resturant. Elizerbert N. currently sells bread and would use the loan to buy a motor-bike that she plans to offer for hire. Robina A. sells charcoal and wants to expand her business. Cicilia K. currently sells vegetables and would use the loan to build a small shop.

loans.use: To construct rental housing and expand her grocery business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel lives with his parents and two siblings on Huancarani street in the Tahauntinsuyo zone of El Alto.

He works in a repair shop, which he owns with his father. In the shop they repair and paint vehicles.

The loan will be used to acquire equipment for their shop, specifically: an air compressor and paint. This equipment will allow them to provide a better and more consistent product to their customers.

This is the first loan from Impro. Impro evaluated Daniel and his family and they were approved for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Daniel vive en la calle Huancarani de la zona Tahuantinsuyo ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a sus padres y dos hermanos.

El trabaja en un taller, que comparte con su padre, donde realizan reparaciones y pintado de vehículos.

El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de equipo de trabajo, una compresora y pinturas, para el mejor desarrollo de su labor.

Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of an air compressor and paint for the painting of vehicles.

loans.name: Ciriaco

texts.es:
Ciriaco lives with his wife and two children, ages 14 and 16, at #479 3rd Ave. in the Puerto Mejillones zone of El Alto. His wife works in trade, buying and selling cheeses. Ciriaco is a seamstress. He hand sews sports jerseys and shirts and delivers them to local factory.

The requested loan will be used for purchase construction materials to repair the kitchen and bedrooms of his home. After three months of extraordinarily heavy rain the home is completely damaged and is in urgent need of repair.

This is the first loan requested from IMPRO. The family was evaluated and approved for the loan. Ciriaco has sufficient earnings to cover both his family’s expenses and the monthly payments on the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Ciriaco vive en la avenida 3 # 479 de la zona Puerto Mejillones ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive junto a su esposa a sus dos hijos de 16 y 14 años, su esposa se dedica al comercio de queso ( compra y venta).

Es confeccionista en mano de obra de buzos deportivos y camisas los cuales entrega a una fabrica que esta ubicada en la zona.

El crédito lo destinara a la compra de materiales de construcción para la refacción de una cocina y sus dependencias, la cual por motivo de las lluvias tan fuertes durante los últimos tres meses, está completamente dañada y necesita urgentemente una reparación total.

Es el primer crédito con IMPRO y la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo. Tiene ingresos suficientes para efectuar los pagos mensuales y sus gastos familiares.

loans.use: Repair of the home and kitchen which was severely damaged by heavy rains.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel sells “api” with rolls and other pastries. Her husband is a field laborer. To explain “api:” Api is a drink made from purple corn. The drink has a pleasant taste and is a substitute for coffee and tea.

Isabel lives in the zone of Miraflores and owns a small shop in the Cotahuma zone of La Paz.

This will be the second time Isabel has requested a loan from Impro, and the second time that she requests our assistance from Kiva. Isabel used the first credit to repair the furniture in her home.

Her loan history gives her a rating of 1, which shows that she completely repaid her loan and in good order. The loan requested this time will be used to purchase items for her work, specifically: api, butter, flour, etc.

She is approved for this credit by review of her work and loan history, especially since she has experience in her industry.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Isabel se dedica a la venta de Api con Buñuelos y Pasteles y su esposo es labrador, trabajo en el campo. A manera de explicación, el Api es una bebida caliente hecha de maiz morado, muy agradable al paladar, que reemplaza al café o al té. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Miraflores y su puesto esta ubicado en la zona de Cotahuma de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la segunda vez que requiere la ayuda de Kiva, el crédito anterior lo utilizo para refaccionar sus muebles. Su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación, el crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (Compra de Api, manteca, harina y otros) Su trabajo y su historial de crédito le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of purple corn, butter and flour for her business of "Api" sales.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria has belonged to Banco Comunal Ayni II for four months.

Victoria is married, is 57 years old and has two children. Along with her husband, Victoria owns a chicken restaurant named “La Merced,” which is located in her home on a central street of the city of Ayacucho. For two years, the specialty of her restaurant has been chicken breast and grilled chicken. With the loan that she will obtain, she plans to increase the capacity of her business for the Semana Santa festivities that are approaching.

Victoria needs a loan of 2,000 soles which will be invested in the purchase of tables and chairs.

Victoria’s dream is to increase her business’ capital, help her children in everything, improve her business and open another restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Victoria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Ayni II” hace 4 meses.

Victoria es casada, tiene 57 años y 2 hijos, Victoria junto a su esposo tienen una pollería llamada “La Merced”, ubicada en su casa, en una calle céntrica D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. La especialidad D. su restaurante es pollo a la braza y a la parrilla, actividad que realiza hace 2 años. Con el préstamo que obtendrá tiene proyectado implementar su negocio para tener más capacidad D. atención en la fiesta D. Semana Santa que se aproxima.

Victoria necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. mesas y sillas.

Los sueños D. Victoria son incrementar el capital D. su negocio, ayudar a sus hijos en todo, ampliar su negocio y tener una sucursal.

loans.use: Victoria needs a loan of 2,000 soles which will be invested in the purchase of tables and chairs.

loans.name: Antonia Flores Vilcatoma De's Group

texts.es:
Carmen, Maria and Antonia have belonged to the Banco Comunal Ayni II for 14, 15, and 14 years, respectively. They mention that they began with savings of two dollars. With the Banco Comunal, they learned to save, how to manage their businesses and to have self-esteem.

Carmen is a widow. She is 73 years old and has 9 children, of whom one lives with her. Carmen has a grocery store in her home. In addition, Carmen makes shrouds and embroiders the costumes of religious statues.

On the other hand, Maria is a 59-year-old single woman. Maria sells shoes, clothing, and jewelry on credit. She brings her products from Lima and Trujillo. In addition, Maria makes clothing and items for religious statues.

Meanwhile, Antonia is married, is 57 years old and has nine children. Antonia has a grocery store in her home. Additionally, Antonia travels to fairs where she sells clothing and from which she brings meat which she sells house-to-house.

Carmen, Maria, and Antonia need loans of 600, 1500 and 600 soles, respectively, which will be invested in the purchase of fabric, thread, shoes, clothes, jewelry, gas and rice.

The dreams of these women are that their businesses improve, to have a jewelry and shoe store, buy property for their children and have enough money for their old age.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Carmen, Maria y Antonia pertenecen al Banco Comunal “Ayni II” hace 14, 15, 14 años respectivamente, ellas mencionan que iniciaron con un ahorro D. 2 dólares. En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ahorrar, como administrar sus negocios y tener autoestima.

Carmen es viuda, tiene 73 años y 9 hijos D. los cuales 1 vive con ella, Carmen tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa. Además Carmen confecciona mortajas y también hace bordados para trajes D. estatuas religiosas.

Por otro lado Maria es soltera y tiene 59 años, Maria venD. zapatos, ropa y joyas a crédito, sus productos los trae D. Lima y Trujillo. Además Maria confecciona prendas D. vestir y también ropa para estatuas religiosas.

Mientras que Antonia es casada, tiene 57 años y 9 hijos, Antonia tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa. Además Antonia viaja a las ferias donD. venD. ropa y D. las ferias trae carne que venD. D. casa en casa.

Carmen, Maria, Antonia necesitan un préstamo D. 600 soles, 1500 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. telas, hilos D. bordar, zapatos, ropa, joya, gaseosas, arroz.

Los sueños D. Carmen, Maria, Antonia son que sus negocios mejoren, tener una tienda D. zapatos y joyas, brindarles propiedades a sus hijos y tener suficiente dinero para su vejez.

loans.use: Carmen, Maria, and Antonia need loans of 600, 1500 and 600 soles, respectively, which will be invested in the purchase of fabric, thread, shoes, clothes, jewelry, gas and rice.

loans.name: Macario

texts.es:
Marcario owns his own vehicle which he uses as a taxi. This is the only support the family has since his wife is a works in the home full-time. Macario’s home is located in the Bajo Llojeta zone on the western side of La Paz.

This will be the 8th time that Macario has requested a loan from IMPRO. His loan history gives him a credit rating of 1, which means he has fully repaid his loans and in good order.
