The currently requested loan will be used for the maintenance of his vehicle, specifically for an oil change and maintenance of the engine and breaks.

Macario is approved for this loan based on his work history and experience as a chauffeur. He has been a client of IMPRO since June of 2001 and all of his loans have been fully repaid.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Macario, tiene un vehículo que trabaja como taxi y es su única fuente de ingresos, su esposa se dedica a las labores de su casa. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Bajo Llojeta ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, Es la Octava vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación. El crédito será destinado para el mantenimiento de su vehiculo (cambio de aceites, mantenimiento del motor, frenos, etc.). Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia como chofer. Es cliente nuestro desde Junio de 2001. Todos sus préstamos anteriores han sido pagados en su totalidad.

loans.use: Maintenance of his taxi.

loans.name: Elena Emperatriz

texts.es:
Elena has belonged to the Banco Comunal Amauta Huamanga for eight months, where she has learned how to save money.

Elena is separated, is 47 years old and has four children of whom only one daughter lives with her. Elena has a store where she sells groceries, produce, and meat at retail and wholesale prices. She started this business one year ago. In addition, Elena buys potatoes at wholesale from Ayacucho city central market and sells them in different cities on the coast.

Elena needs a loan of 2,000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of potatoes.

Elena’s dreams are to grow her business, that her children become professionals, and that each one has a business of their own.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Elena pertenece al Banco Comunal Amauta Huamanga hace 8 meses, en su Banco Comunal aprendió a ahorrar.

Elena es separada, tiene 47 años y 4 hijos de los cuales solo 1 hija vive con ella, Elena tiene una tienda donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carne, al por mayor y menor, actividad que realiza hace 1 año. Además Elena compra papa al por mayor del mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho y lo vende en diferentes ciudades de la costa.

Elena necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa.

Los sueños de Elena es ampliar su negocio de abarrotes, que sus hijos sean profesionales y cada uno tengan su propia empresa.

loans.use: Elena needs a loan of 2,000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of potatoes.

loans.name: Maria Lucila

texts.es:
Small businesswoman Maria Lucila T. is 71 years of age. She is a widow and mother of seven children, all adults. She is the owner of a “mom-and-pop” store, which she has owned for 15 years. This business has allowed her to support herself and her two grandchildren who she takes care of since her daughter is in a neighboring country for work reasons. Maria is illiterate; nevertheless, she carries with her the stories from her work experience. She sells basic grains and other products. Still, with the inventory that she has, she cannot supply all of her customers. Her loan will be used for the purchase of 2 quintals of flour (US $37 each), 1 quintal of rice (US $28), 2 boxes of soap (US $32 each), 1 quintal of beans (US $80), 1 drum of oil (US $26), 2 quintals of sugar (US $27), 1 quintal of American rice (US $40), 1 box of milk (US $40), 4 cartons of eggs (US $6 each), 2 boxes of ham (US $10), 1 large bag of Meneitos (a snack) (US $56), 2 large bags of toilet paper (US $10 each).

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

La microempresaria Maria Lucila T. tiene 71 años de edad, es viuda madre de 7 hijos todos adultos. Es dueña de una pulpería la cual posee desde hace 15 años. Este negocio le permite mantenerse a ella y a dos nietos que ella cuida ya que su hija se encuentra en un país vecino por razones de trabajo. Esta microempresaria es analfabeta sin embargo lleva sus cuentas basado en su experiencia en el negocio. Doña Lucila vende granos básicos y otros productos sin embargo con el inventario que posee no puede abastecer a toda su clientela por lo que solicita financiamientos para : Comprar 2 quintales de harina a US$ 37 dólares cada quintal, 1 quintal arroz nacional a US$ 28 dólares cada quintal, 2 cajas de sopa 3 minutos a US$ 32 dólares cada caja, 1 quintal de frijoles a US$ 80 dólares cada quintal, 1 bidón de aceite a US$ 26 dólares cada bidón, 2 quintales de azúcar a US$ 27 dólares cada quintal, 1 quintal de arroz americano a US$ 40 dólares cada quintal, 1 caja de leche la lechera a US$ 40 dólares cada caja , 4 cajillas de huevo a US$ 06 dólares cada cajilla, 2 cajas de jabón marfil a US$ 10 dólares cada caja, 1 bolsón de meneitos a US$ 56 dólares cada bolsón y 2 bolsones de papel higiénicos a US$ 10 dólares cada bolsón.

loans.use: Purchase of various products including, flour, rice, soap, beans, oil, sugar, milk, eggs, and toilet paper.

payments.comment: La cuota real de pago es de $ 43.60 dólares.
La cuota real es de $ 43.60 dólares.
La cuota real de pago es de $ 43.60  dólares

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas has been a member of the Banco Comunal Ayni II for one year. She mentions that she likes her Banco Comunal because it provides training in diverse areas.

Felicitas lives with her partner. She is 28 years old and has two children. She owns a small store from which she sells CDs, DVDs, rolls of film (for a camera), car radios, and other products that she brings from the cities of Lima and Tacna. She says that she started with capital in the amount of 100 soles, selling in the streets and growing little by little. Currently, she is opening a new branch in the Ayacucho jungle.

Felicitas needs a loan of 3,000 soles, money that she will invest in the purchase of DVDs, CDs and film.

Felicitas dreams are to grow her business, start a new business selling fertilizers, and that her children study.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Ayni II hace 1 año, Felicitas menciona que le gusta su Banco Comunal porque les brindan capacitación de diversos temas.

Felicitas es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Felicitas tiene una pequeña tienda donde vende CD, DVD, rollos para cámara, auto radios, productos que trae de la ciudad de Lima y Tacna. Felicitas cuenta que inició con un capital de 100 soles, vendiendo en las calles y poco a poco fue creciendo. Actualmente esta aperturando una nueva sucursal en la selva ayacuchana.

Felicitas necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de DVD, CD y rollos.

Los sueños de Felicitas son ampliar más su negocio, iniciar un nuevo negocio de venta de agroquímicos y que sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: Felicitas needs a loan of 3,000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of DVDs, CDs, and film.

loans.name: Victoria Pascuala

texts.es:
Victoria has belonged to the Ayni II communal bank for 9 years. In her communal bank, she has learned to have self esteem, to save money, and to manage her business well.

Victoria is separated, is 42-years-old, and has 3 children. Victoria has a chicken restaurant located in the Ayacuchana jungle. She tells us that when she started her restaurant, it was in the city of Ayacucho, but since she separated from her husband, she decided to go live with her parents. Victoria also has a transportation company with her siblings, and Victoria is in charge of its administration.

Victoria needs a loan of 2500 soles, money which will be invested in a new restaurant with modern chairs.

Victoria's dreams are to buy a car and a house in the city of Ayacucho, and to see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Victoria pertenece al Banco Comunal Ayni II hace 9 años, en su Banco Comunal aprendió a tener autoestima, a ahorrar y administrar bien su negocio.

Victoria es separada tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, Victoria tiene un restaurante pollería ubicado en la selva ayacuchana, Victoria cuenta que al inicio su restaurante estaba en la ciudad de Ayacucho pero a razón de su separación con su esposo decidió ir a vivir con sus padres. Además Victoria junto a sus hermanos tienen una empresa de transporte en la cual Victoria se encarga de la administración.

Victoria necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la nueva implementación de su restaurante con sillas modernas.

Los sueños de Victoria son comprar un carro, una casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho y que sus hijas sean profesionales.

loans.use: Victoria needs a loan of 2500 soles, money which will be invested in a new restaurant with modern chairs.

loans.name: Marcelina's Group

texts.es:
Patrocinia, Jackeline, and Marcelina have belonged to the Ayni II communal bank for 14, 6, and 14 years, respectively.

Patrocinia is married, is 40-years-old, and has 5 children. Patrocinia sells meat in the Jesús Nazareno market. She travles to the markets where she buys animals and later sells them for a profit. She also sells salchipollo at the entrance of her house at night.

On the other hand, Jackeline is married, is 24-years-old, and has one daughter. She sells clothing and cosmetics by catalog on credit, products that she offers to friends and family.

Marcelina is married, is 70-years-old, and has 6 children. Marcelina has a grocery store in her home. She makes popsicles and ice cream and sells them in her home.

Patrocinia, Jackeline, and Marcelina need loans of 1500 soles, 450 soles, and 600 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of pigs, cattle, chickens, beer, and soft drinks.

The dreams of Patrocinia, Jackeline, and Marcelina are to have the necessary machinery to process meat, to have a clothing store, and to educate their children.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Patrocinia, Jackeline y Marcelina pertenecen al Banco Comunal Ayni II hace 14, 6, 14 años respectivamente.

Patrocinia es casada, tiene 40 años y 5 hijos, Patrocinia vende carne en el mercado Jesús Nazareno, Patrocinia viaja a las ferias en donde compra animales y posteriormente ella los beneficia. Además, por las noches vende salchipollo en la puerta de su casa.

Por otro lado Jackeline es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 1 hija, Jackeline vende ropa y cosméticos por catálogo a crédito, productos que ofrece a amigos y familiares.

Mientras que Marcelina es casada, tiene 70 años y 6 hijos, Marcelina tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa. Además Marcelina hace chupetes y helados que vende en su casa.

Patrocinia, Jackeline y Marcelina necesitan préstamos de 1500 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado porcino, vacuno, polos, cerveza y gaseosas.

Los sueños de Patrocinia, Jackeline y Marcelina son tener maquinaria necesaria para procesar la carne, una tienda de ropa y que sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: Patrocinia, Jackeline, and Marcelina need loans of 1500 soles, 450 soles, and 600 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of pigs, cattle, chicken, beer, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Epifania's Group

texts.es:
Rosa, Julia, and Victoria have belonged to the Agua Viva communal bank for 13, 9, and 13 years, respectively.

Rosa is separated, is 29-years-old, and has one son, who is 12-years-old. Rosa makes homemaD. Ayacuchan chocolates in her home. She purchases the inputs from the Ayacuchana jungle at wholesale prices.

On the other hand, Teofila is married, is 52-years-old, and has 8 children, 4 of whom live with her. Teofila rents land with plants which she later harvests. Teofila also grows vegetables.

Epifania is married, is 50-years-old, and has 4 children. She sells food at the entrance of a medical clinic.

Rosa, Julia, and Victoria need loans of 600 soles, 1000 soles, and 600 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of sugar, insecticides, chicken, lettuce, potatoes, and the payment of laborers.

The dreams of Rosa, Julia, and Victoria are to make chocolates in larger quantities, to sell products in the wholesale foods market in the city of Ayacucho, and to see their children finish their studies and be better than they are.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Rosa, Julia y Victoria pertenecen al Banco Comunal Agua Viva hace 13, 9, 13 años respectivamente.

Rosa es separada, tiene 29 años y 1 hijo D. 12 años, Rosa elabora chocolates ayacuchanos D. manera artesanal en su casa, Rosa compra los insumos D. la selva ayacuchana al por mayor.

Por otro lado Teofila es casada, tiene 52 años y 8 hijos D. los cuales 4 viven con ella, Teofila alquila terrenos con tunales D. terceros y luego lo cosecha. Además Teofila se dedica a la agricultura D. verduras.

Mientras que Epifania es casada, tiene 50 años y 4 hijos, Epifania venD. comida en la puerta D. una posta medica.

Rosa, Julia y Victoria necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles, 1000 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar, insecticidas, pollo, lechuga, papa y para el pago D. los peones.

Los sueños D. Rosa, Julia y Victoria son elaborar en mayor cantidad sus chocolates, vender sus productos en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, que sus hijos terminen D. estudiar y sean mejores que ellas.

loans.use: Rosa, Julia, and Victoria need loans of 600 soles, 1000 soles, and 600 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of sugar, insecticides, chicken, lettuce, potatoes, and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For the purchase of various products including sugar, rice, beans, oil, soap, flour, milk, eggs, ham, snacks and toilet paper.

payments.comment: La cuota real es de US$ 43.44
La cuota real de sus pago es de US$43.44.

loans.name: Julia's Group

texts.es:
Tiburciana, Julia, and Victoria have belonged to the Agua Viva communal bank for 3, 11, and 9 years, respectively.

Tiburciana is married, is 50-years-old, and has 7 chidren, five of whom live with her. Tiburciana sells anticuchos (marinated meat) on the new bridge as a street vendor.

On the other hand, Julia is married, is 51-years-old, and has 8 children, one of whom lives with her. Julia makes a living by selling flowers in her town. She makes her sales as a street vendor in the Nery García market. Julia and her husband also buy and sell animals.

Victoria is married, is 37-years-old, and has 4 children. Victoria and her sister wash cars in a local rented location. Victoria also sells clothing on credit, products which she brings from the city of Lima. Tiburciana, Julia, and Victoria need loans of 800 soles, 1500 soles, and 800 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of chili peppers, garlic, oil, bull, sheep, car soap, and silicone.

The dreams of Tiburciana, Julia, and Victoria are to have a local stable, to improve their businesses, to implement their businesses with machines, and to give their children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Tiburciana, Julia y Victoria pertenecen al Banco Comunal Agua Viva hace 3, 11, 9 años respectivamente.

Tiburciana es conviviente, tiene 50 años y 7 hijos de los cuales 5 viven con ella, Tiburciana vende anticuchos en el puente nuevo de manera ambulante.

Por otro lado Julia es casada, tiene 51 años y 8 hijos de los cuales 1 vive con ella, Julia de dedica al cultivo de flores en su pueblo, sus ventas lo realiza de manera ambulante en el mercado Nery García. Además Julia junto a su esposo compran y venden animales.

Mientras que Victoria es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 4 hijos, Victoria junto a su hermana prestan servicios de lavado de carros en un local alquilado. Además Victoria vende ropa al crédito, productos que trae de la ciudad de Lima.

Tiburciana, Julia y Victoria necesitan préstamos de 800 soles, 1500 soles, 800 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ají, ajo, carne, aceite, toro, oveja, champú de carro y silicona.

Los sueños de Tiburciana, Julia y Victoria son tener un local estable, mejorar sus negocios, implementar su negocio con más maquinas y que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.

loans.use: Tiburciana, Julia and Victoria need loans of 800 soles, 1500 soles, and 800 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of chili peppers, garlic, meat, oil,  bull,  sheep, car soap, and silicone.

loans.name: Espirita

texts.es:
Espirita has belonged to the Agua Viva communal bank for 2 years.

She is married, is 23-years-old, and has 2 children of 5 and 2 years. Espirita and her husband have a car, which they use to provide urban transportation in the city of Ayacucho. Espirita sometimes works as a collector. Espirita tells us that she used to sell vegetables as a street vendor.

Espirita needs a loan of 2000 soles, money which will be invested in the maintenance of her car.

She will using her savings to build her house and to pay for the education of her children.

Espirita's dreams are to have her own home, to buy another car, and to educate her children so they will become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Espirita pertenece al Banco Comunal Agua Viva hace 2 años. Espirita es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 2 hijos de 5, 2 años, Espirita junto a su esposo tienen un carro que realiza transporte urbano en la ciudad de Ayacucho, Espirita algunas veces es cobradora. Espirita cuenta que anteriormente vendía verduras de manera ambulante.

Espirita necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en el mantenimiento mecánico de su carro.

Sus ahorros lo utilizará para construir su casa y para la educación de sus hijos.

Los sueños de Espirita son tener casa propia, comprar otro carro más, educar a sus hijos y sean profesionales.

loans.use: Espirita needs a loan of 2000 soles, which will be invested in the maintenance of her car.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga has been a member of the Agua Viva communal bank for 4 months.

Olga is married, is 25-years-old, and has 3 children. She used to have a grocery store in her home, which was made of rustic material, which is why she will build her new house with noble material to better the ambiance of her store. Olga and her husband also have land in the ayacuchana jungle where they grow fruit.

Olga needs a loan of 2000 soles, which will be invested in the payment of the laborers. Part of the money will be used to buy school supplies for her children.

Olga's dreams are to construct her home, to have a large grocery store, and to provide her children with the best education.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Olga es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva hace 4 meses.

Olga es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 3 hijos, Olga tenía una tienda de abarrotes en su casa la cual estaba construida de material rústico, para lo cual Olga construirá su casa de material noble para mejorar el ambiente de su tienda. Además Olga junto a su esposo tienen terrenos en la selva ayacuchana donde cultivan frutas.

Olga necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago de los peones y una parte del dinero será para comprar los útiles de sus hijos.

Los sueños de Olga es construir su casa, tener una tienda grande de abarrotes y brindar la mejor educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Olga needs a loan of 2000 soles, which will be invested to pay laborers.  Part of the money will be used to pay for school supplies for her children.

loans.name: Catalina's Group

texts.es:
Catalina, Rayda and Silvia are members of the "CCori Ayllu Community Bank" since 11, 7 and 7 years, respectively. CCori Ayllu means “golden family” in quechua. The community bank has taught them to be responsible, punctual and to save.

Catalina is 34 years old; she lives with her couple and together they have 3 children. Catalina has a grocery store at her home and she also does embroideries and weavings for an exports company.

Rayda is 45 years old; she is married and has 5 children. Rayda buys cereals at Ayacucho, her hometown, which she sells at the coastal towns. At Ayacucho, she also sells fruits, which she brings back from her trips.

Silvia is 43 years old; she lives with her couple and together they have 3 children. Silvia sells wholesale and detail vegetables in the market of Nery Garcia.

Catalina, Rayda and Silvia ask for loans of 800, 600 and 600 soles each. They will use them to buy sugar, rice, oil, corn, wheat, barley, carrots, pore and celery.

Catalina, Rayda and Silvia dream about succeeding in their business so that their children will study and enter a profession.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Catalina, Rayda y Silvia pertenecen al Banco Comunal CCori Ayllu que significa “Familia de Oro” en quechua, hace 11, 7, 7 años respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ahorrar, ser responsables y puntuales.

Catalina es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 3 hijos, Catalina tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa. Además Catalina realiza servicios de tejidos y bordados para una empresa de exportación.

Por otro lado Rayda es casada, tiene 45 años y 5 hijos, Rayda vende cereales en la ciudades de la costa, productos que compra en la ciudad de Ayacucho y de allá trae frutas que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Mientras que Silvia es conviviente, tiene 43 años y 3 hijos, Silvia vende verduras al por mayor y menor en el mercado Nery García.

Catalina, Rayda y Silvia necesitan préstamos de 800 soles, 600 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, aceite, fideo, maíz, trigo, cebada, vainita, zanahoria, poro y apio.

Los sueños de Catalina, Rayda y Silvia son mejorar su negocio, que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.

loans.use: Catalina, Rayda and Silvia ask for 800, 600 and 600 soles each. They will use them to buy sugar, rice, oil, corn, wheat, barley, carrots, pore and celery.

loans.name: Marisol's Group

texts.es:
Maria, Isabel and Marisol are members of the "CCori Ayllu Community Bank" since 2, 1, and 3 years, respectively. CCori Ayllu means “golden family” in quechua. The community bank has taught them to be responsible, punctual and to save.

Maria is 31 years old; she is married and has 2 children. She travels to the regional fairs once a week, to buy hens, cheese, pork meat and cereals. She then breeds the hens, which she sells to her neighbors and she sells the other products at the Playa Grau market.

Isabel is 46 years old; she is married and has 3 children. She sells on credit different types of products depending on her client’s demands as clothes, shoes, crockery, etc. Moreover, Isabel and her children have a kiosk at the city’s observation deck where they sell food and liquor.

Marisol is 33 years old; she is married and has 3 children. Marisol, together with other women, has a textile handicraft’s association. They make embroideries and weavings which they sell at local and national markets.

Maria, Isabel and Marisol ask for loans of 600, 800 and 600 soles each. They will use them to buy cheese, uniforms, school supplies, cloth and wool.

Maria, Isabel and Marisol dream about succeeding in their business so that their children will study and enter a profession. They would also like to have better shops, stable enterprises and a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria, Isabel y Marisol pertenecen al Banco Comunal CCori Ayllu que significa “Familia D. Oro” en quechua hace 2, 1, 3 años respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ser responsables, puntuales y a ahorrar.

Maria es casada, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos, Maria viaja a las ferias una vez por semana donD. compra quesos, cerdo, gallina, los cereales lo venD. el mercado Playa Grau, los animales lo beneficia y lo venD. a sus vecinas.

Por otro lado Isabel es casada, tiene 46 años y 3 hijos, Isabel venD. diversos productos D. acuerdo al pedido D. sus clientes, como ropa, zapatos, locería, productos que venD. al crédito. Además Isabel junto a sus hijos tiene un Kiosco en el mirador D. la ciudad donD. venD. comida y licores.

Mientras que Marisol es casada, tiene 33 años y 3 hijos, Marisol junto a otras mujeres tienen una asociación D. artesanía Textil, los trabajos que realizan son bordados, tejidos, sus productos lo venden en el mercado local y nacional.

Maria, Isabel y Marisol necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles, 800 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. queso, uniformes, útiles escolares, tela y lana.

Los sueños D. Maria, Isabel y Marisol son salir adelante con sus negocios, que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales, iniciar un nuevo negocio, tener una empresa sólida y tener una mejor calidad D. vida.

loans.use: Maria, Isabel and Marisol ask for loans of 600, 800 and 600 soles each. They will use them to buy cheese, uniforms, school supplies, cloth and wool.

loans.name: Konul

texts.en: Konul S. is an Internally Displaced Person from the Fuzuli region of Azerbaijan. She has been settled with her family in Beylagan since 1993. She is 28 years old, married, and has two children. She raises chickens in her yard and sells them in the Beylagan city bazaar. She has been engaged in this business more than eight years. Her husband helps her at her business. She applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a KIVA loan in the amount of $900, and plans to build a new hen house for her hens.

loans.use: To build a hen house

loans.name: Alberta's Group

texts.es:
Zenaida, Rita and Alberta are members of the "Amauta Huamanga Community Bank" since 4, 4, and 8 months, respectively.

Zenaida is 44 years old; she is married and has 7 children. She is a street vendor and sells different types of products depending on seasonal demand. For instance, she sells school supplies during the school year and toys during Christmas.

Rital is 23 years old; she is married and has 3 children. Rita sells sandals at a shop, in the Grau market. She buys the sandals in the city of Lima and transports them to Ayacucho.

Alberta is 41 years old; she lives together with her couple and has 2 children. Alberta sells ceviche (form of citrus marinated seafood salad) but would like to stop this activity in order to sell clothes like school uniforms.

Zenaida, Rita and Alberta are asking for loans of 1000 soles (360USD) each. They will use them to buy pencils, colored pencils, crayons, sandals and uniforms.

Zeneida dreams of having her own stand to sell her products. Rita would like to study a profession and expand her business and Alberta would like to have a grocery shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Zenaida, Rita y Alberta pertenecen al Banco Comunal Amauta Huamanga hace 4, 4, 8 meses respectivamente.

Zenaida es casada, tiene 44 años y 7 hijos, Zenaida vende diferentes productos dependiendo de la demanda como útiles escolares en campaña escolar, juguetes en navidad, sus ventas lo realiza ambulantemente caminando.

Por otro lado Rita es casada, tiene 23 años y 3 hijos, Rita vende sandalias en un puesto del mercado Grau, sus productos lo trae de la ciudad de Lima.

Mientras que Alberta es conviviente, tiene 41 años y 2 hijos, Alberta vende cebiche, actividad que dejará de realizar porque tiene proyectado iniciar con la venta de ropa.

Zenaida, Rita y Alberta necesitan préstamos de 1000 soles cada una, dinero que será invertido en la compra de lapiceros, pintura, plumones, sandalias, uniformes.

Los sueños de Zenaida, Rita y Alberta son establecer su negocio en un local, estudiar una carrera, ampliar su negocio, tener una tienda de abarrotes.

loans.use: Zenaida, Rita and Alberta request 360USD each; they will buy pencils, colored pencils, crayons, sandals and uniforms.

loans.name: Amelia's Group

texts.es:
Amelia, Raquel, and Juanita are members of the "Amauta Huamanga Community Bank" since 10, 5, and 13 years, respectively.

Amelia is 45 years old; she is married and has three children. She is a street vendor and sells fruit at the train and bus terminals of her city.

Raquel is 41 years old and she is single. She runs a small shop where she sells an assortment of goods including vegetables, clothing, and jewelry.

Juanita is 48 years old; she is married and has eight children. Together with her husband, she runs an autobody repair shop. Juanita used to be a street vendor and she would use the loan to return to this line of work.

Amelia, Raquel, and Juanita are asking for loans of 300, 1000, and 300 soles, respectively. They will use them to buy grapes, oranges, sugar, soft drinks, rice, and other goods.

The dream of all three women is to have children who will enter a profession. They also want to improve their businesses and reach their objectives.

loans.use: To buy grapes, oranges, sugar, soft drinks, rice and other goods

loans.name: Shukufa

texts.en: Shukufa T. is an Internally Displaced Person from the Fuzuli region of Azerbaijan. She settled with her family in Beylagan in 1993. She is 59 years old, married, and has five children. She raises chickens in her yard and sells them in the Beylagan city bazaar. She has been engaged in this business for more than seven years. She applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a KIVA loan in the amount of $700 for developing her hen business.

loans.use: To develop her business

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique is a 56-year-old man who lives in the German Pomares Barrio with his wife and 3 grown children who lovingly help support their parents. His wife has always been a great support throughout the years and works selling sweets and other items to children at the Rene Schick school where Enrique has been the janitor for 9 years. The children there appreciate and adore Enrique. With their work, they plan on improving their home since their youngest daughter who is in college, works and supports them a little with the school expenses. Therefore, they are asking for a loan to buy construction materials like cement, sand and iron to build a wall in front of their home to provide better protection and security.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

Don Enrique es un señor de 56 años de edad que habita en el Barrio German Pomares con su esposa y sus 3 hijos todos ellos ya mayores y trabajadores que con amor le ayudan a sus padres. Su esposa quien ha sido su gran apoyo en todos sus años juntos trabaja vendiendo caramelos y otras cosas a los niños del colegio de nombre Rene Shick en donde Don Enrique se desempeña como conserje desde hace 9 años contando con el aprecio y cariño de los niños que allí estudian, con el trabajo de ambos se han propuesto darle mejora a su casita en la que pronto habitaran únicamente ellos ya que actualmente vive con ellos su hija menor aun estudiando en la Universidad y la cual trabaja y los apoya poco por los gastos de estudio, por lo que piden un crédito para comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, arena y hierro para construir un muro frente a su casita que les brinde mayor protección y seguridad.

loans.use:
Purchase construction materials to build a wall around his home

Compra de Materiales de construcción para hacer muro de su vivienda

loans.name: Estelvina Irene

texts.es:
Ms. Estelvina is a merchant with vast experience in retail sales of clothing, footwear and cosmetics, and this work has allowed her and her family to live a decent life. She also works on and off as a seamstress. Her husband, a construction worker, also supports the family. They live in Villa Venezuela and have 2 children, an 8- and a 12-year-old, in elementary school. They dream of giving them everything they need and helping pay their expenses. With her business, this entrepreneurial woman has positively contributed to the growth of her family, since it has allowed them to improve the quality of life of each member of the family and help her husband with the household costs. Her solid management of the business and the careful and friendly service she offers her clients has helped her to grow her business and develop a substantial client base. She is requesting a loan to purchase men’s and women’s undergarments that her clients have been asking for. She would like to meet this demand and always keep her clients happy.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

La señora Estelvina es una comerciante que posee una vasta experiencia en venta de ropa, zapatos y cosméticos al por menor, es esta actividad la que le ha permitido vivir de manera digna con su familia. También se dedica esporadicamente a la costura. Cuenta con el apoyo económico de su esposo quien labora como albañil. Esta familia vive en Villa Venezuela, tienen 2 hijos de 8 y 12 años de edad, quienes se encuentran estudiando en primaria y por lo cual estos padres desean brindarles lo necesario y poderles cubrir sus necesidades. Con su negocio esta mujer emprendedora ha contribuido de forma positiva en el desarrollo de su familia, ya que le ha permitido mejorar el nivel de vida de cada miembro del núcleo familiar y apoyar a su esposo con la carga del hogar. La buena administración de la señora en el negocio y la atención esmerada y agradable que le brinda a sus clientes le ha ayudado para expandirse y ahora cuenta con un buen numero de clientes a quienes les ofrece sus productos. La señora solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa interior de dama y caballeros, que le han solicitado sus clientes y desea satisfacer esa demanda existente y brindar siempre a sus clientes lo que le demanden.

loans.use:
Purchase men's and women's undergarments for their sale

Comprar ropa interior de dama y caballeros para comercializarla

loans.name: Marcial Salvador

texts.es:
Marcial P. is 56 year-old retailer. He is married and has five children, all of whom are of legal age and independent. This is a family full of retailers; the children learned the tricks of the trade from their parents and with their support, were able to start their own businesses. Mr. Marcial sells shoes, and his wife sells milk based products, such as cream and cheese. Their children have their own small businesses at the Oriental Market, which is the biggest in the country. This marriage has been dedicated to sells for over 30 years. Mr. Marcial is requesting a loan in order to purchase shoes and increase his inventory, since his dreams are to complete good sales during this month and he currently has low inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Mindy Burns, Kiva volunteer.

Marcial P., es un comerciante de 56 años de edad, casado y con 5 hijos todos ya mayores de edad e independientes. Esta es una familia de comerciantes ya que los hijos aprendieron de sus padres la chispa del negocio y con apoyo de ellos montaron su propio negocio. Don Marcial vende zapatos, su esposa vende productos lácteos como crema y queso y sus hijos tienen sus propios pequeños negocios en el Mercado Oriental que es el mas grande del país. Desde hace más de 30 años este matrimonio se dedican al comercio, solicita Don Marcial un crédito para comprar zapatos y ampliar su inventario ya que tiene muchas expectativas de realizar buenas ventas en este mes y no cuenta con mucho inventario.

loans.use: Purchase shoes for his business

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa belongs to the Las Caribeñas community bank, located at the Essalud (Social Security) in the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali. She is 32 years old and the mother of 3 children; her husband works in a sawmill.

She currently sells books, rising very early to go to work at her stand. The books vary according to demand and in the afternoons, she collects on the credit she´s given her customers.

With this loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy books on different subjects as well as shoes, cosmetics and clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Luisa pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Caribeñas, ubicado en Essalud (Seguro Social), del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 32 años es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo trabaja en un aserradero.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de libros, se levanta muy temprano para salir a trabajar en su puesto de venta que varia de acuerdo a la demanda que tienen sus libros, y por las tardes se dedica a la cobranza de los créditos que deja a sus clientes.

Con este préstamo, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprara libros de diferentes temas, también zapatos, cosméticos, ropa.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Anne Melissa

texts.es:
Anne Melissa belongs to the Comunal Bank Las Ucayalinas, located on Avenue Tupac Amaru 170, in the District of Manatay, Department of Ucayali. She is 27 years old, mother of two children, married, and her husband is a motocar driver. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in the purchase and sale of soft drinks. Currently her business has grown, as has her income, and now she sells a variety of brands of soft drinks wholesale. She works every day and at the same time she does the domestic labor and takes care of her children. With this loan of 1,200 soles, which will be repaid over 4 months, she will invest in 10 cases of soft drinks, gelatin, ice, and sweets. Anne Melissa is very happy with the progress that she’s made, and now has more self-confidence. She is certain that she will keep working with her communal bank for the good of the group.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Anne Melissa pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Ucayalinas, ubicado en la Av. Tupac Amaru 170, del Distrito de Manantay del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 27 años es madre de 2 hijos, es casada, su esposo es motocarrista.Con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidide invertir en la compra y venta de gaseosas. En la actualidad su negocio ha crecido al igual que sus ingresos, ahora vende gaseosas al por mayor de diferentes marcas, atiende todos los días y paralelo se dedica a las labores domesticas de su hogar y al cuidado de sus hijos. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de 10 cajas de gaseosas, gelatina, hielo, golosinas. Anne Melissa se siente muy feliz con los logros que ha alcanzado, ahora tiene mas confianza en si misma, y tiene la certeza de seguir trabajando con su banco comunal para el bien de su grupo.

loans.use: Purchase 10 cases of soft drinks, gelatin, ice, etcl.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana Maria is a member of the Comunal Bank Las Ucayalinas, located on Maria Parado D. Bellido Street 171, in the District of Manatay, Department of Ucayali. She is 63 years old, has 8 children, and her husband is a laborer. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in a small general store. Currently her general store is well-stocked with different types of products. She runs the business with the help of her children, and they distribute the domestic chores amongst themselves. At night she enjoys spending time with her children. With this loan of 1,500 soles, which will be repaid over 4 months, she will buy rice, sugar, milk, soft drinks, bags for her lollipops, noodles, preserves, etc. Ana Maria is a tough woman who likes to work in order to get her family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ana María pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Ucayalinas, ubicado en Jr. María Parado D. Bellido 171, del Distrito D. Manantay del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 63 años es madre D. 8 hijos, su esposo es obrero. Con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidiD. invertirlo en una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad su bodega esta mas implementada con diferentes tipos D. productos, con la ayuda D. sus hijos atienD. el negocio, se distribuyen las tareas domesticas y por las noches le gusta compartir un momento agradable con sus hijos . Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprara arroz, azúcar, leche, gaseosas, bolsitas para sus chupetes, fideos, conservas, etc. Ana Maria es una mujer luchadora que le gusta trabajar para poder sacar a su familia adelante.

loans.use: Purchase products for her general store

loans.name: Juana Lizbeth

texts.es:
Juana belongs to the Comunal Bank Las Caseritas, located on Sáenz Peña Avenue 872, in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 33 years old, mother of three children, and her husband is an administrator. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in a business selling children’s party decorations. She still has her decoration business, and she depends on a children’s program on a well-known regional television channel. She complements this with children’s dolls that she brought from Lima for the children’s enjoyment. With this loan of 1,100 soles, which will be repaid over 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of fabric, technopor, pins, thumbtacks, balloons, silicone decorations, other decorations, etc. Juana has a lot of fun with the business and the children love the dolls that are the main attraction of her decorations. The loans that she has received have helped her in her business and have also helped her buy some things for her home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Caseritas, ubicado en la Av. Sáenz Peña 872, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 33 años es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es administrador.Con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertirlo en el negocio de decoración de fiestas infantiles. En la actualidad continua con su negocio de decoración, y ahora cuenta con un programa infantil en un conocido canal regional, y lo complementa con los muñecos para niños que trajo de lima para el deleite de los niños. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,100, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra telas, technopor, alfileres, chinches, globos, siliconas, adornos, etc. Juana se divierte mucho con el negocio, los niños gustan mucho de sus muñecos que son la atracción de sus decoraciones, los préstamos recibidos la han ayudado en su negocio y también a comprarse algunas cosas para su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics, pins, etc. for her business

loans.name: Reyna Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. Reyna O. is a 40 year-old woman, mother, and agriculturalist. She is a farming woman, who labors diligently with the land and in the sun. She lives in San Ignacio, and is happily married to a farmer like herself, who supports the family as well by working at a solid job at a factory. Together, they have six children, three of whom work and the three youngest got to school and help their mother at home. She has cultivated two apple orchards for more than 20 years, and this agriculture business is her passion. While taking care of her crops, she sells fruit that she grows and harvests. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase agricultural items for her crops and guarantee that it is a success.

Translated from Spanish by Mindy Burns, Kiva volunteer

Mujer, Madre y Agricultora es La señora Reyna O., de 40 años de edad, es una mujer de campo, forjada en el trabajo de tierra y sol, habita en San Ignacio, dice ser felizmente casadas con un hombre de campo como ella que para apoyar en el negocio familiar y tener una entrada fija trabaja en una empresa como operario. Ambos tienen 6 hijos 3 de ellos trabajan los 3 últimos aun estudian y ayudan a su madre en los oficios de la casa. Tiene cultivada 2 manzanas de Piña y Pitaya desde hace mas de 20 años este negocio agrícola es su pasión, mientras se desarrolla el cultivo vende frutas que ella misma cultiva y cosecha. Solicita un crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas para su cosecha y garantizar esta se realice con éxito.

loans.use: Purchase Agricultural products

loans.name: Emma

texts.es:
Emma belongs to the Comunal Bank Las Ucayalinas, located on 28 D. Julio Street 902, in the District of Manatay, Department of Ucayali. She is 51 years old, has two children, and is separated from her husband. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in a small general store. Currently her general store has grown and she wants to install a copier in order to generate more income. Every day she splits her domestic chores with attending her store, along with her sons who help her. With this loan of 2,000 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy a photocopier, and with any extra money, groceries to stock her store. Emma is doing very well and the loans she’s received have helped her in many ways since she began working with Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Emma pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Ucayalinas, ubicado en el Jr. 28 D. Julio 902, del Distrito D. Manantay del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 51 años es madre D. 2 hijos, es separada. Con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad su bodega ha crecido y quiere implementar un copiadora para generar mas ingresos, todos los días comparte las tareas domesticas con la atención D. su bodega conjunto con sus hijos que la ayudan. Con este préstamo recibido D. S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará una maquina fotocopiadora, y lo que le sobrará abarrotes para surtir su bodega. Emma le esta yendo muy bien los prestamos recibidos la ayudan en muchas cosas desD. que empezó a trabajar con Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase photocopier and groceries

loans.name: Elizabeth Del Carmen

texts.es:
The young Mrs. Elizabeth H. is 31 years old and lives in San Juan de la Concha with her husband, whom supports her dreams and is a licensed lawyer. They have two children than are currently studying. Elizabeth works from home at her small business, where she sells cosmetics. She began the business six years ago with economic support from her husband, with the dream that her family would have a better lifestyle. She sells products door to door, at community centers, and from her home. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase waterproof cosmetics, now that there is a high demand during the summer season. This season is a high selling one for Elizabeth, and more merchandise has given her husband satisfaction, since she has been working hard at this business and helping her family finances.

Translated from Spanish by Mindy Burns

La joven señora Elizabeth Hernández, tiene 31 años de edad, habita en San Juan de la Concha acompañada de un hombre que la apoya en sus sueños y es licenciado en Derecho con quien tiene 2 hijos que actualmente se encuentran estudiando. Doña Elizabeth apoya en su casa mediante un pequeño negocio personal que tiene de venta de Cosméticos el cual inició hace 6 años con apoyo económico de su esposo, con la ilusión de que su familia tenga una mejor condición de vida visita clientes de casa en casa, en sus puestos de trabajos, centros de estudios etc. Ofreciendo su producto al crédito para que se lo cancelen en sus fechas de pago. Solicita un crepito para comprar cosméticos hidratantes que son de gran demanda en esta época de playa, época que resulta con buenas ventas para ella, moviendo en créditos su inventario le ha dado la satisfacción a su esposo ya que lleva años en este negocio que resulta de gran apoyo en los gastos familiares.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila belongs to the Comunal Bank Las Ucayalinas, located on Padre Irazola Street, Mz. 10, Lt. 21, in the District of Manatay, Department of Ucayali. She is 53 years old, has 6 children, and is separated from her husband. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in the sale of soft drinks and lolipops. The business has grown and currently she also sells fruits from the area. In the morning she prepares the lollipops with the help of her children, and in the afternoon she sells fruit. With this loan of 1,200 soles, which will be repaid over 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of soft drinks, ingredients for her lollipops, sugar, milk and fruit. Luzmila is very happy with the successes she’s had in her work.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Luzmila pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Ucayalinas, ubicado en Jr. Padre Irazola Mz. 10 Lt. 21, del Distrito D. Manantay del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 53 años es madre D. 6 hijos, es separada. Con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 decidiD. invertirlo en la venta D. gaseosas y chupetes. En la actualidad su negocio ha crecido ahora también venD. frutas D. la región, en las mañanas se dedica a la preparación D. sus chupetes con la ayuda D. sus hijos, y en las tardes a la venta D. sus frutas. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra D. gaseosas, insumos para sus chupetes, azúcar, leche y frutas. Luzmila esta muy contenta con los logros que ha obtenido con su trabajo.

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks and other products

loans.name: Letith

texts.es:
Letith belongs to the Comunal Bank “Las Caseritas,” located on Jr. Atahualpa Street 520, District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is a 30 year old mother of one son and is separated from her husband. With the first loan of 300 soles that she obtained from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in the business of food sales.

Currently she is still in the food business and with the help of her son she prepares food. They sell food in the afternoon and at night they rest to prepare for work the following day.

With this loan of 1,000 soles, which will be repaid over 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of tables, chairs, soft drinks, and in the supplies necessary for her food.

Letith feels more sure of herself now that she has her own business and does not depend on other people. This makes her feel very good and her son gives her the strength to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Letith pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Caseritas, ubicado en el Jr. Atahualpa 520, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 30 años es madre de 1 hijo, es separada. Con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidide invertirlo en el negocio de venta de comida.

En la actualidad continua con su negocio de comida, con la ayuda de su hijo preparan las comidas, en las tardes las venden y por las noches descansa para el trabajo del día siguiente.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de mesas, sillas, gaseosas, y en los víveres que necesitara para sus comidas.

Letith se siente mas segura de si misma ahora que tiene su propio negocio ya no depende de otras personas y eso la hace sentir muy bien y su hijo le da fuerza para seguir adelante.

loans.use: She will buy tools and supplies necessary for her business with the loan

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa belongs to the Mujeres Lideres Community Bank group, located at 160 Jr. Pucallpa, in the Calleria district of the department of Ucayali. She is 52 years old and the mother of 3 children. Her husband is retired, but the income that he has doesn't provide enough for daily needs. She decided to invest the 300 soles from the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos/crediMUJER into drink sales.

With the earnings that she has made from the sale of her drinks, she bought a stereo that she rents out for different occasions. She gets up early to do household chores and then works selling drinks and renting out the stereo.

With this loan of 2400 soles ($850), which will be paid back in 6 months, she will purchase CDs. In addition, she will use the money to maintain the stereo equipment fix up her place.

Rosa is very pleased with the acheivements that she has had with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Lideres, ubicado en el Jr. Pucallpa 160, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 52 años es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es jubilado, pero el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para su economía diaria. Con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidide invertirlo en la venta de bebidas. En la actualidad con las ganancias obtenidas de la venta de sus bebidas ella compro un equipo de sonido para alquiler en diferentes ocasiones, se levanta temprano para realizar las labores de su hogar y dedicarse a la venta y alquiler de equipo de sonido. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,400, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de Cd además lo usara para el mantenimiento de su equipo y una parte lo destino al arreglo de su local. Rosa esta muy contenta con los logros que ha alcanzado de su negocio .

loans.use: To purchase CDs and for the maintenance of her stereo which she rents out.

loans.name: Milena

texts.es:
Milena belongs to the Las Triunfadoras Community Bank group, located at 845 Jr. Salaverry in the Calleria district of the department of Ucayali. She is 51 years old and the mother of 7 children. Her husband works in a mill but the income that he brings home doesn't cover their basic needs. She decided to invest the 300 soles from the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos/CrediMUJER in food sales.

She now has a restaurant where she serves local and vegetarian cuisine to the liking of every palate with the help of her children who wait on the customers.

With this loan of 1000 soles (approx. $350), which she will pay back in 5 months, she will invest in the purchase of 3 sacks of rice, 2 bags of noodles, one box of oil, etc.

The hard work of Milena and her children has paid off as now her restaurant is one of the most popular in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Milena pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Triunfadoras, ubicado en el Jr. Salaverry 845, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 51 años es madre de 7 hijos, su esposo trabaja en un molino, pero el ingreso que tiene no les alcanza para cubrir sus necesidades. Con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertirlo en la venta de comida. En la actualidad tiene un restaurante donde ofrece comida criolla y vegetariana al gusto de todo paladar, con la ayuda de sus hijos atienden a los clientes. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de 3 sacos de arroz, 2 bolsas de fideos, 1 caja de aceite, etc. Milena y sus hijos han logrado a base de mucho esfuerzo lograr que su restaurante sea uno de los mas concurridos de su ciudad.

loans.use: To buy products for her business

loans.name: Zulmira

texts.es:
Zulmira belongs to the Las Ucayalinas Community Bank group located at 1 Jr. Maya de Brito Cdra., in the district of Calleria in the department of Ucayali. She is 43 years old and the mother of 6 children. Her husband is a fisherman but the income that he earns doesn't cover the expenses of the household. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she purchased fish to sell.

Now she sells fish in the Bellavista market as a street vendor. At 5 am, she has plenty to sell, but with the demand that she has, she runs out of fish early. In the afternoons she works taking care of her children and her home.

With this loan of 1200 soles, which will be paid back in 4 months, she will buy traps, fish of different species and maintain their boat.

Zulmira is very thankful for the loans that she's received from Manuela Ramos. It's a big help and with the earnings she is able to save money and give the best to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Zulmira pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Ucayalinas, ubicado en el Jr. Maya de Brito Cdra. 1, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años es madre de 6 hijos, su esposo es pescador pero el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para cubrir las necesidades de su hogar. Con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertirlo en la compra y venta de pescado. En la actualidad ella vende sus pescados en el mercado de Bellavista, es vendedora ambulante, a las 5 AM. ya esta en plena venta y con la demanda que tiene sus pescados termina temprano, y en las tardes se dedica a sus hijos y su hogar. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de tramperas, pescados de diferentes especies y dar mantenimiento a su bote. Zulmira se siente muy bien con los préstamos recibidos de Manuela Ramos es un apoyo grande y le da ganancias para poder ahorrar, y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en:
Lidia, an active and hard-working mother of three school-going children, lives in Yamasá, where she sells homemaD. fried chicken, spicy sausage pork, and fried vegetables. Lidia started her business three years ago, when she realized that her husband’s salary could not bear all the family’s expenses. Lidia has her stall set close to a public place, and passers-by visit the stall to enjoy her tasty goods.

The entrepreneur has requested a loan (the second one she’ll take from FSMA) to boost her business. She’ll buy new ‘cook’ utensils and raw materials to keep producing her food. Lidia hopes that her business’ growth will help her increase her revenue and better fend for her children.

loans.use: To acquire new cooking utensils and raw materials to expand her small food stand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invertir en mas mercaderia

loans.name: Elba Rosa

texts.es:
Ms. Elba R. is native of the municipality of Condega where she has had a home based tailoring business for the last 35 years. As a single mother, she is responsible for supporting her daughter and to provide her with the education she deserves. Mrs. R. has the role of father and mother.

She began her business with a lot of effort and as time passed by Ms. R. has improved her business as she has gained new customers from the municipal area.

Five years ago in order to improve her economic condition, Ms. R. obtained loans from CEPRODEL , which allowed her to develop her business, since with these loans she purchased fabrics and the necessary household goods to make the dresses and shirts for her clients. Currently, Ms. R. is once again in need of a loan, in order to buy fabric and other supplies. She is confident that a loan will be approved so she can continue to operate her business and to provide her daughter with the education she needs.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

Elba R. es una dama originaria del municipio de Condega en el que posee un negocio de sastrería en su propia casa desde hace 35 años. Por ser madre soltera, tiene la responsabilidad directa de mantener a su hija y brindarle los estudios que ella se merece haciendo el papel de padre y madre a la vez.

Su negocio lo inicio con mucho esfuerzo y a medida que han transcurrido los años lo ha venido mejorando porque ha obtenido nuevos clientes que la visitan en su local de habitación.

Para mejorar su condición económica, desde hace 5 años ella ha venido trabajando con CEPRODEL obteniendo créditos que le han permitido mejorar su negocio ya que con estos créditos obtiene la tela y enseres necesarios para realizar los vestidos y camisas a sus filetes. Actualmente su necesidad es una vez mas obtener la tela y es por eso que muy confiadamente espera que el crédito se le otorgue para continuar con su negocio y brindarle el estudio a su hija que tanto lo necesita.

loans.use: To Purchase Fabrics

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
Juan Bautista R. G. earns a living selling fruits, vegetables and other products out of his home which is located in the Condega municipality of the city of Estelí. He is married and has three children. Mr. R. and his wife work hard to provide their children the education they deserve. Not only do they help them financially but with their school assignments as well.

Since he started his business he has been working tirelessly to improve his financial situation and to break free from the poverty that has been a part of his life for so long. For this reason he has obtained loans with Ceprodel (4 loans) which he has used to purchase merchandise to sell and in this manner he is able to support his family which depends on him.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

El Señor Juan Bautista R. G. se dedica a la venta de frutas y productos varios (pulpería) en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Condega de la ciudad de Estelí. Es un caballero casado y con 3 hijos que junto con su esposa se esfuerzan para proporcionarles la educación que ellos se merecen apoyándolos tanto financieramente y en la colaboración con las tareas asignadas en su colegio.

Desde que inició su negocio ha venido luchando fuertemente para mejorar su condición económica y salir de la pobreza en que por mucho tiempo ha estado involucrado. Para esto ha solicitado créditos en Ceprodel (4 créditos) utilizándolos directamente en la compra de la mercadería para comercializarla y de esta manera obtener el sustento diario de su hogar que tanto necesita de su apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To continue supplying his store and to begin to construct a workshop

loans.name: Luis Rubén

texts.es:
It has been 18 years since Mr. Luis Ruben R. began selling shoes and clothing in the municipality of Condega in the beautiful city of Estela in Nicaragua. Mr. R. has dedicated a lot of time and effort to his business, selling merchandise to consumers with the support of his wife who is also a housewife.

One of the needs that Mr. Luis R. has is the urgency of obtaining merchandise. During the last two years Ceprodel has granted him loans which Mr. R. has used to purchase merchandise from his suppliers. Once again he needs funds to acquire merchandise, and this is why he is asking CEPRODEL for another loan, and therefore, continue to develop his business.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

El caballero Luis Ruben R. desde hace 18 años inició su negocio de venta de zapatos y ropa en general en su localidad de habitación en el municipio de Condega de la bella ciudad de Estela en Nicaragua. Se dedica a su negocio con mucho esfuerzo vendiendo su mercadería al publico en general y con el apoyo de su esposa que se dedica a la labor de ama de casa.

Una de las necesidades que hoy en día atraviesa el señor Luis R. es la urgencia de obtener su mercadería para comercializarla y es por esta razón que Ceprodel desde hace dos años le ha apoyado con créditos que le han permitido adquirir los productos de sus proveedores para comercializarlas a sus clientes. Una vez mas esta necesidad se hace vigente en el señor Luis R. y es por esta razón que acude a CEPRODEL para obtener créditos que le den lugar a la adquisición de sus productos en su localidad.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and shoes

loans.name: Oscar Leonel

texts.es:
Mr. Oscar C. O. sells replacement parts and accessories for motorcycles at a store in the municipality of Condega of the city of Estelí. At a young age he showed interest on motorcycles and for that reason, three years ago Mr. C. O. began his business selling few parts. As time has passed, he has been able to sell larger quantities of replacement parts in the municipal region where he lives, which has improved his economic situation.

Ceprodel has been a key player on the development of his business since it has given Mr. C. O. three loans, that he used to acquire motorcycle replacement parts. Nowadays, one of his greater needs is the urgency to purchase more replacement parts in order to sell them. It is for that reason that he expects Ceprodel to provide him with another loan so he can continue to develop his business and thus, support his family .

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

La actividad económica del caballero Oscar C. O. es la venta de repuestos y accesorios para motocicletas teniendo su establecimiento en el municipio de Condega de la ciudad de Estelí. Desde muy joven ha tenido inclinación hacia las motocicletas y por este motivo comienza su negocio con pocos repuestos desde hace tres años pero a medida que ha venido transcurriendo el tiempo ha mejorado su situación vendiendo mayores cantidades de repuestos en su localidad.

Ceprodel ha sido uno de los ejes fundamentales para el desarrollo del negocio por el motivo de que le ha proporcionado créditos (3 créditos) que han sido utilizados por el señor Oscar en la adquisición de los repuestos para la motocicleta. Hoy en día una de sus mayores necesidades es la urgencia de la compra de los repuestos para comercializarlos. Es por este motivo que espera que Ceprodel le otorgue el crédito para continuar con su negocio y así sostener su núcleo familiar.

loans.use: To Purchase Replacement Parts

loans.name: Socorro María

texts.es:
Mrs. Socorro J. is native of the municipality of Condega, and she began her business four years ago selling clothing for gentlemen, ladies and children. With a lot of effort and many sacrifices Mrs. Socorro J. started her business selling low quantities of merchandise, but as time passed by she improved her business as she now offers clients a larger variety of products.

It is worth mentioning that her business has improved due to the loans she has been granted by Ceprodel. Mrs. Socorro J. has used these loans to purchase more merchandise and to invest on her store’s infrastructure. Nowadays, in order to continue with her clothing business and buy merchandise from her suppliers, once again she is requesting a loan from Ceprodel, so she can invest on her business, which is the only venue of income for her and her young child.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Socorro J. originaria del municipio de Condega se dedica desde hace cuatro años al negocio de venta de ropa para caballeros, damas y niños en su local de habitación. Con mucho esfuerzo y grandes sacrificios inició su negocio vendiendo poca mercadería pero a medida que el tiempo ha transcurrido ha mejorado el negocio brindando a los clientes mas variedad en sus productos.

Es necesario destacar que para haber llegado al punto en el que se encuentra ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel los cuales nos cuenta que le han beneficiado grandemente porque así ha logrado comprar la mercadería a sus proveedores y además ha invertido en la infraestructura de su local. Hoy en día para continuar con el negocio tiene la necesidad de adquirir la ropa de sus proveedores y por este motivo una vez mas solicita prestamos en Ceprodel para continuar con el negocio que es el único ingreso para ella y su pequeños hijo.

loans.use: To Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Surtir su local con mas productos y ademas mejorar su comedor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in his fields to sow rice.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria has always been a courageous women and role model. Every since she started her family, she also started her own business buying and selling cheese.

She buys her products during the regional fairs around Juliaca, the city where she lives. Afterwards, she takes care of the packaging and together with her husband, Aurelio, distributes and sells the cheese in the city of Juliaca.

These loving parents work hard in order to offer their adorable children a roof over their heads and most of all, education. They are both convinced that education is the best legacy they can give to their children.

Doña María, analyzed the growing demand on her products and has therefore decided to ask for a loan in order to rise the amount she can invest to buy cheese.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

María siempre demostró ser una mujer muy valerosa y ejemplar, desD. que decidió formar su familia se dedicó íntegramente a la compra y venta D. quesos al por mayor. Ella adquiere sus productos los días D. feria en los diferentes pueblitos aledaños a la ciudad donD. radica, Juliaca, y los acondiciona para ser vendidos en la ciudad capital D. su país, lugar donD. se encarga D. la distribución y venta su querido esposo Aurelio.

Estos ejemplares y amorosos padres trabajan arduamente con el fin D. ofrecerles un techo propio y sobre todo educación a sus adorables hijos. Ambos están convencidos que la educación a sus hijos es la mejor herencia que pueden brindarles.

Doña María, analizando la demanda del mercado decidió aumentar el monto D. inversión, es por ello que solicita un préstamo.

loans.use: To buy more cheese in order to increase her sales

loans.name: Candido Valerio

texts.es:
Mr. Candido has been a working man from a young age. He is 53 years old, and is happily married to children’s mother. His five children are 30, 23, 20, 17, and 12 years old, and his wife has always dedicated herself to caring for their children and home while he works so that his family has what it needs. He began a small tailoring shop which had much success, due to his high quality workmanship. He has now been in business for ten years, and he always has work. Sometimes, he even gives some of his work to other tailors when he has large orders so that he can complete them on time. While his workers complete orders, Mr. Candido will often go and fine new clients and jobs. He often gets contracts to make uniforms for large companies that pay well. He is requesting a loan in order to buy material in order to fulfill the contracted order he recently received to make uniforms, therefore guaranteeing this new client. He dreams that someday his children will continue his business.

Translated from Spanish by Mindy Burns, Kiva volunteer

Don Candido es un hombre trabajador desde pequeño, de 53 años de edad, es felizmente casado con la madre de sus 5 hijos de 30, 23, 20, 17 y 12 años de edad, su esposa siempre se dedicó al cuido de los hijos y el hogar mientras él trabajaba para que no le faltara nada a su familia. Montó un tallercito de Sastrería que tubo mucho éxito por su calidad y que ahora es una sastrería de mas de 10 años de prestigio que siempre tiene trabajo y que a su vez da trabajo a otros jefes de familia ya que cuando tiene pedidos grandes contrata a otros que conocen de sastrería para lograr a tiempo la entrega de ese pedido, de esta manera mientras sus trabajadores laboran sale a las calles a ofrecer su trabajo consiguiendo contratos de elaboraron de uniformes en Empresas que le pagan bien. Esta solicitando un crédito para comprar telas y cumplir con un contrato de trabajo que acaba de conseguir para uniformes y así garantizar a ese cliente. Algún día sueña que sus hijos continúen con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Ivette Del Socorro

texts.es:
This young woman of 36 lives in the Santa Rosa neighborhood is married and has three children aged 10,15 and 20. Her husband is a merchant and she helps him out selling blank CDs and DVDs whosale. Her brother in law, who is a haulage contractor, helps her by bringing boxes of these products from Panamá which allows her to obtain higher profits because she does not need to spend money on transportation. Thanks to this arrangement she is able to offer lower prices which in turn has meant an increase in sales.

Her hope if that her children don't suffer the hardships she did as a child. Thanks to her work her children are able to get an education which she feels is the best inheritance she can leave them. She is asking for a loan to take advantage of a trip her brother in law is going to take. She plans to bring enough boxes of merchandise to last until his next trip.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Esta joven señora de apenas 36 años de edad, habita en el Barrio Santa Rosa, casada y madre de 3 hijos, de 10,15, y 20 años de edad, su esposo es comerciante y ella lo apoya vendiendo CD y DVD en blanco al por mayor, para ello cuenta con la ayuda de su cuñado que es transportista y le trae de Panamá las cajas de este producto esto le ayuda a tener mejor ganancia ya que no gasta en el transporte, este ahorro que tiene con el apoyo familiar que tiene ha significado un crecimiento en sus ventas al dar buen precio.

Su anhelo es que sus hijos no sufran ni pasen las necesidades que ella pasó de niña. Con su trabajo a sus hijos no les falta su educación que es la mejor herencia que piensa dejarles. Solicita un crédito para aprovechar un viaje que tiene su cuñado y mandar a traer suficientes cajas y tener suficiente inventario hasta el próximo viaje.

loans.use: To purchase boxes of DVDs and CDs to stock up

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use:
Purchase fertilizers, seeds and agrochemicals.

Comprar abonos semillas, fertilizantes, agroquimicos

loans.name: Augusta

texts.es:
Martha and her young husband Luis, are the parents of a 1 year old baby. They both have a lot of energy and a spirit of self improvement that allows them to completely invest themselves in their daily activities, farming and cattle rising. With these activities, which they inherited from their parents, they raise an important income for their household.

Since they started living together, they put together their savings in order to buy 2 calves. The calves grew, giving them more and more milk, developing their business.

Now they have 5 cows that they grow in a small pasture which they rent. That is why they need to constantly buy forage for their feeding. Now that the amount of cows they own has increased, they also need to buy more forage and that is why they request this loan.

Martha and Luis’s goal is to own their own pasture in which to grow their animals.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha y su joven esposo Luis, son padres de un bebé de 1 año, su ímpetu y su gran espíritu triunfador le está permitiendo ponerle muchas ganas a sus actividades diarias la ganadería y la agricultura, con estas nobles labores que heredaron de sus padres están generando importantes ingresos económicos para su familia.

Ambos desde que formaron su hogar con el ahorro que disponían decidieron comprar 2 becerritas, con esas 2 vaquitas han logrado crecer y aumentar poco a poco la cantidad de sus generosos animalitos que les proveen de leche diariamente.

Actualmente esta joven pareja cría a sus tiernas vaquitas en un pequeño pastizal alquilado, es por ello que constantemente requieren comprar forraje para su alimentación, ahora que ya cuentan con 5 vaquitas necesitan comprar mayor cantidad de forraje, es por ello que recurren a ti para solicitarte un préstamo. Martha y Luis se esfuerzan constantemente con el fin de lograr tener su propio terreno donde criar a sus animalitos.

loans.use: To buy more feeding for their cows

loans.name: Mardely Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mardely is 46 years old and lives in the suburb Villa Libertad with her spouse, who works as a driver. She has three children; two are working and independent, but she is still has one dependent child who is 12 years old. For 20 years, Mardely has sold cosmetics, clothing and domestic equipment in her small stand, which has been sustained mainly by nutritional products. Her aspirations are that her business grows and converts into a family business that she and her husband can work at so he doesn’t have to work away from home. She is requesting a loan in order to buy beach merchandise for the summer season. She would like to sell more items during the busy vacation months- items such as sunscreen, sandals, blouses, shorts, and beach dresses.

Translated from Spanish by Mindy Burns, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Mardely tiene 46 años de edad y habita en el anexo de Villa Libertad acompañada de su pareja quien trabaja de conductor. Tiene 3 hijos siendo el único a su cargo el menor de 12 años de edad, sus otros dos hijos trabajan y son independientes. Desde hace 20 años se ha dedicado a la venta de Cosméticos, Ropa y enseres domésticos en su pequeña pulpería que tiene abastecida principalmente de productos alimenticios. Sus aspiraciones es de que su negocio crezca y se convierta en un negocio familiar que puedan atender ella y su esposo y así este deje de trabajar fuera de la casa. Solicita un crédito para comprar mercadería en esta época de verano y playa, aprovechar vender todo lo de moda en esta época de vacaciones que es cuando más trabaja para tener mejor ingresos logrando vender cremas, sandalias, blusas, pantalones cortos, vestidos de playa etc.

loans.use: Capital to purchase new merchandise
